loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a new FedEx truck and route.

loans.name: Nelly Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Nelly es socia del banco comunal La Gran Amistad, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar  es de clima frió, tiene una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente es muy amable y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen a trabajar diariamente en la ciudad de Cuenca.
 
Doña Nelly tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 13, 12 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas estudian en el colegio y su último hijo en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es de profesión panadero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Nelly labora en una tienda y panadería que es de su propiedad, lleva en el negocio  9 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, huevos, levadura, azúcar sal, etc. para su panadería.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelly is a member of the La Gran Amistad communal bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish. This area has a cold climate and a beautiful view of nature. The residents are very kind and maintain the culture and traditions of their forefathers. They work in trade, raise animals, or in agriculture. Many go to the city of Cuenca to work every day.

Mrs. Nelly is 34, married, and she and her husband have 3 children ages 13, 12 and 8. Her two oldest daughters are in high school and the youngest, a son, attends a local elementary school. Her husband is a baker. They do not have their own home as they rent.

Mrs. Nelly works in a store and bakery which is her own property. She has had this business for nine years and works every day of the week from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 7 years and she will invest this new loan in the purchase of flour, butter, eggs, yeast, sugar, salt, etc., for her bakery.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, eggs, yeast, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Luciana  Flora

texts.es:
La  señora  Luciana   tiene  veinticuatro años de edad , se dedica  a la  elaboración  de antojitos mexicanos  desde  hace dos años atrás.
Es una señora muy trabajadora  a parte de vender antojitos mexicanos también   se dedica a la calzado  venta de calzado ya que  obtiene  muy buenas ganancias .
Tiene la cantidad de  dos hijas  las cuales son gemelas , cada semana  va realizar sus pagos  a la microfinanciera , le gusta mucho trabajo  ya que a sus  clientes le gusta  como los atiende y la mercancía que les ofrece.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar mas ingredientes,   para la elaboración de antojitos mexicanos.
Uno de sus sueños  es  tener un restaurante  donde pueda hacer diferentes platillos para sorprender a sus clientes. 
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y por ser parte de ellos .
texts.en:
Sra. Luciana is 24 years old and has been making Mexican street food for two years. She is a very hardworking woman and sells Mexican street food part-time. In addition, she sells shoes in order to obtain a very good income. Luciana has twin daughters. Each week she submits her payments to the microfinance institute. She enjoys working with her customers and serving them the food that they enjoy.

Luciana is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients for preparing Mexican street food. One of her dreams is to have a restaurant where she can offer different dishes to surprise her customers. She expresses her thanks to Fundación Realidad for the support that has been given to her so that she can move forward and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing street food.

loans.name: Azarius

texts.en:
Azarius is a rice farmer. He has been doing this work for the past five years. His parents taught him how to be a rice farmer. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: growing seedlings in the nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and, lately, in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labour on his rice farm

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harrient is a resident of Nkubu, Central Kenya. She is aged 43 and married with 2 children. She has been in farming for 9 years producing and selling milk, bananas, beans and eggs which all go to the local market.

Harriet has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds for her farm. She says the income will help her in educating her two children and boost her cereals shop in the local market.

She mentions drought and diseases as the challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and lives in Pob2, Clarin, Mis Occ. She is married, with 5 children. Jocelyn has a fish business and earns approximately PHP10,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase dried fish for her retail business.  Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es:
Johana sigue comercializando ropa nueva, pues es el medio de apoyar  a su familia, y cuidar de ella misma, ya que parte de sus ventas las hace en su casa de habitacion. Ya que sus hijos aun estan pequeño.
El objetivo desde hace años, ha sido la mejora de su casa, pero devido que tenian otra pioridad con sus hijos, los financiamiento los invertian en el negocio, equilibrando sus gastos.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo va hacer mejoras en las paredes interna de su casa, como comenzar con el arranque del muro en la parte frontal. Logrando tener un techo en mejores condiciones, y mejor seguridad para su familia. materiales a comprar: bloque, hierro, bolsa de cemento.Mejorando toda la infraestructura, ya que solo una parte esta en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Johana is still selling new clothes to support her family and herself. Part of her sales go towards her living expenses, as her children are still little. 

For years Johana's goal has been to improve her home, but since her other priority is her children, she has to invest her money in her business to balance out her costs. 

Now with this new loan she will make improvements on the internal walls of her home, starting by tearing down the front wall, which will leave the roof in better condition and will provide a safer environment for her family. For this project she will need to buy cement blocks, iron and bags of cement. She will make improvements to the entire structure, as only one part is in good condition.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing to keep expanding her business.

loans.name: Laura María

texts.es:
La Señora. Laura es socia del banco comunal La Merced, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana (Cuenca), este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades. Mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Laura tiene 36 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 15, 11, 8 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus tres hijos menores en la escuela. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Doña Laura hace 5 años labora en una tienda de comestibles que es de su propiedad, la cual atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y de domingo a domingo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad  para surtir su negocio.
 
Su meta es poner una panadería.
texts.en:
Señora Laura is a member of the communal bank La Merced. She lives in the parish of Santa Ana (Cuenca) which has a cold climate. The people there breed livestock and farm. Many work in the city in different activities. They maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

Señora Laura is 36 years old. She is married and has 4 children: 15, 11, 8 and 5 years of age. The eldest child studies at college and the 3 younger ones at school. Her husband is self-employed. The house they live in is their own property.

Doña Laura has worked for the past 5 years in her own grocery store which she takes care of from 6 in the morning until 9 at night, from Sunday to Sunday.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 years and she is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of staple products to stock her business.

Her goal is to set up a bakery.

loans.use: to buy staple products.

loans.name: Barrack

texts.en: Barrack is a hardworking businessman aged 27. He is married and blessed with one child who is still in school. He has been running a tailoring business for the last five years to support his family. Previously, he was employed elsewhere. Barrack has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. He has employed two people to assist him with managing the business. With the 50,000 Kenya shillings, he wants to buy fabric. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Barrack dreams of buying a piece of land in the future. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Pring's Group

texts.en: Pring, 43 years old, is married with three children. All her children are still in school. For the last two years, she has been raising pigs to support her family. She also grows rice to better feed her family. She leads a group of two female members. Her group has been with VisionFund for three years. She completely paid her loans to VisionFund. Now she is requesting a fourth loan. She wants to buy feeds for her pigs. With this loan, she hopes to feed her pigs to be healthy and fat. She also hopes to earn more income so that she can buy the basic necessities for the family and keep her three children in school.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Munhdulam

texts.en: Munhdulam is 44 years old and lives with her husband in ger (Mongolian yurt) in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.Her husband is a welder. She started her garment retail business in 2005 by renting a counter selling boots. Now she sells all kinds of garments. She is well known for her eye for fashion. Now that her business is stable, Munhdulam is planning to start another retail counter in the market. She has already arranged for a counter, however, she is lacking supplies. Munhdulam is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting a loan of MNT 2,500,000 to purchase winter garment.

loans.use: to purchase winter garments

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi est une femme âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.  
Essi travaille comme revendeuse de garnitures et des mèches depuis 2005. Elle vend dans une boutique  à ses clients. Elle achète les produits à Lomé et sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le marché.
Essi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des garnitures et des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Essi voudrait agrandir en ouvrant d’autres points de vente. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit avoir une famille heureuse et intervenir dans l’éducation de ses frères et sœurs.
texts.en: Essi is a 29-year-old woman. She is single and has no children. Essi works as a merchant of accessories and hair extensions. She sells to her clients in a store. She buys the products in Lomé and has difficulty with competition at the market. Essi has asked for a second loan from WAGES to buy accessories and hair extensions. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Essi would like to grow her business by opening other selling locations. She says that with her profits, she foresees having a happy family and to help with the education of her brothers and sisters.

loans.use: Acheter des garnitures et des méches

loans.name: Niankh Jarinu Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis 28 mars 2008. Il est composé de onze femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce

Aida (debout à droite de la photo)est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de produits cosmétiques. 

Son crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité en s'approvisionnant en quantité plus importante de produits cosmétiques.

Les profits générés par son activité lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group has existed since 28 March 2008. It is made up of 11 women who are all from the same neighbourhood. Small-scale business is their main activity. 

Aida (standing at the right of the photo) is head of the group. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of two children. She sells cosmetics. 

Her loan will help her strengthen her business by buying a larger quantity of cosmetic products.

The profits generated will allow her to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Jappante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 09 juillet 2002. Il  est  composé de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Siring qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est veuve sans enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge cinq autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de bananes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (scolarité etc.…).
texts.en:
Jappante Group was formed in solidarity on July 9, 2002. It consists of 12 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is shopkeeping.

Madam Siring who is on the right of the photo raising her hand is responsible for the group. She is 46 years old. She is a widow and has no children. She takes care of five children entrusted to her by her parents.

She actively sells bananas. She is well experienced in this business, where she has been working for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and to better develop her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (schooling etc.).

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Mr. Batbold is a photographer. Since 2008 he has been working as a photographer. He lives with his wife and his daughter in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
He uses a Japanese photo camera in his job and it is a main job tool for this job. He always cares for it. Half a month ago, his camera was damaged and there is no way to fix it. His job has stopped since it happened. 
The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of a new photo camera to get back to his job.

loans.use: To cover the cost of a new photo camera to get back to his job.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa  is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
 
Elsa  has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elsa  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Kantuta Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTA II” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Modesta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de papa y chuño, venta de fruta, venta de tripitas cocidas.

La señora Modesta  indica que este es el segundo ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chuño y papa que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de chuño y papa) que comprará de una comunidad del altiplano y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "KANTUTA II" is in its first Pro Mujer cycle at the Senkata Center.  It is comprised of seven members and is directed by a board chaired by Mrs. Modesta.  The members of the group carry out different business activities, among which are sales of potatoes and "chuño", sales of fruit, and sales of boiled tripe.

Modesta says this is her second cycle in Pro Mujer to which she was invited by a counselor  She sells "chuño" and potatoes for a living and has had the business for several years.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her working capital to buy "chuño" and potatoes in the high plains community.  Later she will sell them at her food stall.  Her work generates enough income to help her family.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, she says it is the savings.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and "chuño" (dehydrated potato)

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Oeurn is 66 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is widowed and blessed with one son. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her son is a garment worker who earns about $4 each day.

Oeurn is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build up the land around her house with earth to prevent flooding.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Bidi Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ernestine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ernestine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Ernestine est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Ernestine est mariée à un certain Falilou. Le couple a sept enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ernestine vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Ernestine vend depuis vingt ans des tissus, chemises et des cartes de recharge. Ernestine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marie ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, sollicite un deuxième crédit. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des cartes de recharges , des tissus et des chemises.

loans.name: Betty Maria

texts.es:
Con su sonrisa y gran corazón, Betty ha tenido una gran acogida en su barrio desde que tiene su negocio de venta de tinto hace 10 años con gran esfuerzo y con un deseo en su mente, el de salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos como termos para tinto y compra de surtido de frituras y cigarrillos.

Con estos elementos podrá continuar vendiendo los productos que ofrece.

Su principal dificultad es el Alto costo de los insumos.
Apoya a Betty con su negocio y has que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo!

loans.use: comprar insumos como termos para tinto y compra de surtido de frituras y cigarrillos.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a hard working lady, a mother of 7 and a member of Mercury Women Group. She is a typical subsistence farmer and that’s where she gets her income to support her family. She has 3 dairy cows, goats and she sells milk to Kangema town. She also grows tea and has coffee trees on half acre of land. The tea board of Kenya buys her tea at $ 35 per month while coffee’s income comes twice a year around $80 per harvest. This loan will assist her because she wants a hybrid goat, which will improve the local breed, which grows very fast, and thus, she will realize her returns as soon as possible.

loans.use: She would like to buy a hybrid goat.

loans.name: Tebib

texts.en:
Tebib was born in 1975 in Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has a child. 

Tebib has been running this business for 3 years.  He is very happy with his business, works hard every day to give the best service to his customers, and to keep his store well-supplied so they will always find the product they want.
Having borrowed $600, he increased the variety of products available in his store.
Now he needs a loan amount of $1000 to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Salevao

texts.en: Salevao is a married mother of five whose long time passion and talent is sewing. To help her family financially, Salevao decided to turn her talent into a business investment and she caters to people in her village. She works full-time sewing. She sews t-shirts, collared shirts and school uniforms.

loans.use: To purchase electric sewing machine

loans.name: Nancy  Jeaneth

texts.es:
My name is Nancy Jeaneth, and I am a businesswoman. I have a store where I sell new clothing, located in the plaza of my city. I have several years experience in this store and the earnings I make are used to cover household expenses and other bills. Currently, I need to stock my store in oder to offer a wider variety of products to my clientel and through which increase my earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Nancy Jeaneth, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva en la plaza de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio, para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis clientes y de esa forma mejorar los ingresos

loans.use:
To purchase underwear, women's blouses, skirts, children's clothing
 and jeans.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and has lived with 60-year-old Arsenio Marin for 35 years. The couple have one son who's married and has a daughter of his own, who Gloria and Arsenio care for.

Gloria has a business selling foods like empanadas (turnovers filled with ham and cheese, corn, beef, chicken, etc.) and croquettes (made of ground beef, egg and vegetables). She makes these at home and sells them to wholesale customers who in turn resell them to the public. She also caters special events such as birthdays, baptisms, etc.

She was only 12 years old when she started working and could not finish school, instead helping her mother to make and sell empanadas. That is how she came to learn the trade by which she still makes a living today.

Her husband helps with the family's expenses by selling leather handicrafts. They lead a very humble life but lack for nothing because of their daily hard work.

She is requesting a small loan to purchase flour, meats and eggs and also firewood, which she uses as cooking fuel, at wholesale prices, to be used in the manufacturing of empanadas and croquettes.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria tiene 52 años y está acompañada con el Sr. Arsenio Marín de 60 años desde hace 35 años. La pareja tiene 1 único hijo que ya está casado y a su vez tiene una hija también que se queda a cargo de Gloria y su esposo. Gloria se dedica a la venta de comestibles como: empanadas y croquetas (comidas rápidas muy consumidas en el Paraguay, elaboradas a base de carne molida, huevo y verduras. Las empanadas pueden ser de jamón y queso, choclo, carne, pollo, etc.) que elabora en su domicilio y son retiradas por sus clientes que luego las vuelven a revender. También elabora dichos productos sobre pedido cuando hay algún acontecimiento como cumpleaños , bautismos, etc. Comenzó a trabajar desde los 12 años aproximadamente, por tal motivo no pudo terminar sus estudios, debiendo ayudar a su madre en la elaboración y venta de empanadas, fue así como adquirió el oficio que desarrolla hasta hoy día. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar gracias a los ingresos que obtiene de la elaboración de productos artesanales en cuero. Llevan una vida muy humilde pero a la vez sin que les falte nada, todo eso gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo diarios. Necesita de un pequeño préstamo para comprar insumos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus empanadas y croquetas como ser: harina , carne, huevo y también la leña con la que cocina dichos alimentos. Esto se debe a que cuando compra en cantidades le sale más barato todo.

loans.use: To purchase meats, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael K. is 50 years of age. She has a family of three children — one boy and two girls all going to school — as well as four dependants. Rachael sells hardware products like varnish, plywood, glue, drawer locks, nails, paint and much more. Her business is strategically stationed in the city suburbs where carpentry workshops are located. This is a ready market for the goods in her small hardware shop — mainly varnish, wood glue, nails and other things. In the small earning she collects, she manages to meet her necessities: mainly food, clothing and rent for her workplace and others. She wishes to borrow $900 for capital for expanding the business to meet the clients' demands, and at the same time fulfill her future plan of saving tuition fees for her college students.

loans.use: Purchase of stock — paint ,wood glue/varnish, plywood, nails, drawers/doors, locks and many other things

loans.name: Vicenta Hilda

texts.en:
Vicenta is in the business of taxis, a very popular and high-demand business in the massive city of Lima. She and her husband own two taxis that they rent out daily. They rent to the same people each day, and charge 40 Soles (about US$ 13) per taxi each day. The drivers are responsible for paying for the gas, but Vicenta is responsible for making all repairs, which are necessary quite often, as the taxis are driven 15 hours a day (from 7am to 10pm), 7 days a week.

Vicenta also cooks picarones, a very popular doughnut-type dessert, and sells them during the day outside of her home. She and her husband have two grown children, ages 30 and 28. With this loan of $175, Vicenta will repair some tires on the two taxis, and the rest will go towards fixing one of the motors- a very expensive undertaking at 3500 Soles (about US$ 1150), but a necessary investment.

loans.use: To purchase tires for her taxis and part toward fixing a motor on one

loans.name: Kandy

texts.en: Mrs. Kandy Y., 25, sells womens clothes at an open-air market and typically earns around $6/day. Her husband is employed as a teacher, earning about $4 per day. Mrs. Kandy Y. has two little children who are too young to attend school. Because of her growing customer demands, Mrs. Kandy Y. has recently applied for a loan to expand her inventory to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase fashionable clothes to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Mrs Clotilde lives together with her husband and daughters in a house they own. The house is located in the street of José Saravia’s, neighborhood of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

Her husband is a carpenter and she sells food at construction sites. Indeed, she works together with an engineer who helps her to get contracts to sell food to the construction workers.

She now needs a credit to buy more wholesale products for her cooking in order to lower her costs of production.

Clotilde has been working with the non-profit association “Amparo Gutierrez” since 2002 and due to her good credit history; she can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Clotilde vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijas en la calle José Saravia de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja como carpintero y la actividad que ella tiene es la venta de comida en lugares donde se construyen edificios ya que trabaja con un ingeniero que le ayuda a conseguir contratos para ofrecer comida a los albañiles que trabajan la construcción de los edificios. El crédito que solicita es para comprar en insumos al por mayor para elaborar su comida y de esta forma abaratar sus costos de producción. Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Clotilde es cliente de nuestra Institución desde el año 2002 con un buen historial de pagos.

loans.use: To buy more wholesale products for her cooking in order to lower her costs of production

loans.name: Hajra's Group

texts.en: I am Hajra A. from Multan, a city in Pakistan famous for its shrines. I am married and the mother of two boys. I sell cloth from my house and need a loan to buy cloth in bulk. Wedding season is around the corner and sales of cloth will be high. There is  another woman  Kaneez B. who is borrowing for her grocery store. This is a group loan and we are mutually responsible for each other's loans.

loans.use: Buy cloth in bulk

loans.name: Sakhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sakhun B. and her husband were married in 1973. They have three children—one son and two daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives in the family home. One of the other children works in a garment factory, and other is in secondary school. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. B. has been selling Cambodian fruit (mangoes, jujubes, guavas and other kinds of local fruit) for twenty five years. She buys the fruit at a market and resells it in her village. Her husband raises cows.

Mrs. B. is requesting a loan for the third time. She is asking for $500 to purchase cows for her husband to raise.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Mrs. Edith R. P. is a member of the “Vision 2000” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín region in the Picota province in the district of San Hilarión. She sells salchi-papa (sausage with fries), salchi-pollo (chicken with fries), and soft drinks from her home, where a large number of customers who enjoy these types of dishes come daily. Her husband, who helps her financially with the sales, encouraged her to start this business. Today she has secured her daily sales. With a loan of $1,125.00 that she will repay in 6 months, she will buy: chairs and tables to increase her business and provide her customers with better service and comfort and ingredients to prepare the sausage and chicken dishes. Also, she will install a glass case in her beauty salon to display the beauty products that she sells. Edith is an enthusiastic 47-year-old woman with 2 children, one of whom lives with her. She is happy to be achieving her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Edith R. P., es socia del Banco Comunal “Vision 2000”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota, distrito de San Hilarión , se dedica a la venta de Salchi-papa ,salchi-pollo y bebidas gaseosas, desarrolla su negocio en su casa en un ambiente especialmente acondicionado, donde diariamente acuden gran cantidad de clientes que gustan de esta tipo de comidas. Se inicio en este negocio motivado por su esposo quien la ayudó económicamente en la venta, hoy en día tiene asegurada su venta diaria. Con el crédito recibido de S/ 3000.00 el cual será en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará: sillas y mesas para ampliar su negocio y brindar una mejor atención y comodidad a sus clientes y los insumos para la preparación de salchi papas y salchi pollos, además implementara con una vitrina su salón de belleza para exhibir los productos de belleza que vende. Ediht es una mujer entusiasta de 47 años, tiene 2 hijos, uno de los cuales vive con ella, se siente contenta de estar alcanzando sus objetivos propuestos.

loans.use: To purchase products for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery works selling meat in a neighborhood store and also offers a variety of other food products. Rosmery rents her home and has one son who totally depends on her as she is a single mother. She has worked in this activity for more than 4 years now and therefore has a lot of experience in this field. She has some competition, but the place where she works is well known and she takes orders from clients as well as travels to villages. The current request is to increase her merchandise. In the coming days, due to inflation, she will have to increase the price of her goods, which will vary between Bs. 0.30 and Bs. 19.-. Rosmery has a loan from another institution but she has demonstrated accountability in both.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Lim S., 41, is married and lives with one of her children in Siem Reap Province. Daily, she goes to the market to sell Khmer desserts, while her husband, Chea Sarann, works as a photographer, making $8 per day. The family’s home is in disrepair, however, and Lim is requesting a loan of $1000 to complete the construction.  She sees this as a great opportunity to raise her standard of living and to improve the conditions of her home.

loans.use: To complete their housing construction.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba G. is a fishmonger. She is married, but her husband's income as a fisherman is not sufficient for Aba and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.id:
Live in a village and work as farmer is not an easy way. One should work very hard, with uncertain result. To increase their income, some farmers choose to breed cattle. The activity is also done by several house wives in Dsn. Sari Kuning, Tukadaya Village, West Bali. They do the business in a group with 15 members. The group is managed by 3 committees whose responsible to coordinate the members in running the business. All the members do the same business: to breed pigs.

Doing the business in a group, let them to earn capital easier, and within the group they are able to help each other. The loan from KIVA through DINARI, which is IDR 1,000,000 for each member, will be deployed to purchase high quality fodder and piglets for a period (6 months). The additional capital and assistance from DINARI, are expected to be able to increase the business. All of the members are sure that their income will increase, that they will be able to improve their family's economic condition.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana DK, Kiva volunteer.

Hidup di desa dan bekerja sebagai petani ternyata tidak mudah, butuh kerja keras namun terkadang hasilnya tidak makssimal. Untuk menambah penghasilan mereka ada beberapa petani yang memilih untuk beternak. Hal ini juga dilakukan oleh sekelompok ibu-ibu yang berada di Dsn. Sari Kuning, Ds. Tukadaya, Bali Barat. Kelompok ini terdiri dari 15 anggota dan memiliki 3 orang pengurus yang bertanggung jawab untuk mengkoordinir kelompok tersebut dalam menjalankan usaha mereka. Semua anggota kelompok memiliki usaha yang sama yaitu sebagai peternak babi. Keunggulan dari usaha beternak secara berkelompok adalah memudahkan mereka dalam mendapatkan modal usaha serta mereka saling menbantu dalam menjalankan usaha ternak mereka. Pinjaman yang diperoleh dari KIVA melalui DINARI sebesar Rp. 1.000.000,- per anggota dipergunakan sebagai tambahan modal usaha yaitu untuk membeli pakan yang berkualitas dan membeli bibit yang akan dipelihara selama satu kali periode pemeliharaan (6 bulan). Dengan mendapat tambahan modal serta pendampingan dari DINARI kelompok ini mulai mengalami peningkatan dalam usaha dan mereka sangat yakin akan mendapatkan hasil yang lebih baik sehingga ekonomi keluarga merekapun bisa lebih baik dari sekarang.

loans.use: To purchase fodder and high quality piglets Membeli

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
La señora Lucinda, socia del Banco Comunal, “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Tiene un taller de mecánica donde reparan todo tipo de vehículos menores, sobre todo motocicletas y motocarros. El taller está ubicado en su casa en el Jr Trujillo, la Merced c-3. Los clientes son mayormente los motocarristas y personas que tienen moto en la ciudad.
 
Con este crédito de  S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará una máquina taladro que es muy necesario en el taller. Dado la buena acogida que tiene, necesita implementar el taller con más materiales para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, quienes a diario llegan con sus movilidades para ser reparados y así poder seguir circulando.   

La señora Lucinda tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos quienes aún dependen de ella, los cuales también la apoyan en algunas actividades del taller. Es una persona perseverante y luchadora, quien anhela  ampliar y arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucinda, member of the "Santa Rose de Lima" community bank, lives in the suburb of San Martin in the province of Marsical Cáceres in the district of Juanjul. She has a mechanical workshop where she repairs all types of small vehicles, especially motorbikes and motorcycles. The workshop is located in her house on Jr. Trujillo street in "la Merced" c-3. Her clients are mostly motortaxi drivers and others who have motorbikes in the city. With the 500 soles loan which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase a mechanical drill, which is essential in a workshop. Due to the good reception that she has had, she needs to equip the workshop with more materials to offer her clients a good service, including repairing their vehicles the same day so that they can continue working. Lucinda is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children who are still her dependents and assist her in the workshop. She is a persevering and fighting person who longs to expand and fix-up her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a mechanical drill

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 56-year-old Hilda M. from Mwanza. She is married with eight children, between the ages of eight and thirty. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants who are orphans. Hilda has been running a chicken and cattle business since 2004, selling chickens and milk. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, seven days per week, and is assisted by four employees. Hilda currently earns about 200USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more chicks. In the future, she plans to increase her stock of chickens. Hilda thanks you for supporting her!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow large sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch T. is a villager in Prey Meilang Cheoung village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Long Nouy, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. 

On their plantation, they face some problems because their field is infertile soil and has a lot of pests which hurt their crops. They cannot afford the expenses for their field. In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Touch T. decided to request for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice. 

She hopes to increase the family's income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 49 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other two children are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mrs. Mary T., 31, and her husband, Mr. Vibol Chan, 34, who live in a small village along National Road Number 5 about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1999 and have two sons. One of her sons attends school, and the other son is still young and stays at home.

Mary has been a tailor for three years, a skill she learned from her master. She buys cloth and silk fabric from the market in Phnom Penh for resale at her tailor shop. Her husband has been a motor Remoque (taxi) driver for one year; he carries goods and people from the village to Phnom Penh and from Phnom Penh to the village.

Mary is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cloth and silk fabric for resale, and also for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and silk fabric for resale, and for growing rice.

loans.name: Namutamala Lending Group

texts.en: Esther K., age 60, is the chairperson of the Namutamala lending group in Mpigi. Ten years ago she was one of the founding members of her group. She has operated a business since 1989, keeping animals (cows) at her home and poultry, for the last for 4 years. In total, she has 3 cows that provide her with milk for sale and 100 laying hens that very soon will be laying  eggs. These hens are replacement of those that she had sold. She is requesting a loan to purchase more laying hens to expand her business. As a result of investing more in her business, Esther has been able to save  money which has helped her with buying household items as well as making life comfortable for her orphaned grand children. Esther is a widow with 7 children. Most of her children have passed away and left her with the care of the grandchildren that she has to work so hard to provide for. She is grateful for the loans as she has been able to stock chicken feeds and medication for her animals. This would not have been possible without the loans. She is really a hardworking elderly lady that does farming on a very small scale mostly for food to feed her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy more laying hens and chicken feed to expand a business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles K. is 34 years old, married with three children. He is a generous man, supporting some orphans in an orphanage. He  began selling cosmetics in 2003. He is using the loan to expand his business by purchasing more cosmetics. With the income from the business, he intends to build a residential house on his plot of land. He also aspires to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Pol K., 47, lives in Pursat Province. She is married to Nol, 48, who is a fisherman. They have six children: the first two are married and live away from home, two others work in a garment factory, and the last two children attend school every day. The salary of those who work helps with the family's expenses, while K. raises pigs. K. is a very responsible mother, and she has earned a good profit for her family. The many family members live in a small house. So K. is requesting a loan of $500 to build a house for her and her family. K. and her husband are pictured.

loans.use: To buy wood to build her house

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones unidos”, del barrio Unión, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace un año y medio, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por mayor y menor, así como productos de higiene y limpieza, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que sirvió como capital adicional para adquirir mercadería variada para su negocio.  
Actualmente la Sra. Juana requiere un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo podrá adquirir mercaderías surtida para su negocio (azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche, bebidas, etc.), con ello podrá en el futuro comprarse un carro, puesto que ese es su anhelo.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Corazones Unidos ('United Hearts') community bank in the Unión neighborhood of Desaguadero district, which is in the Chucuito province of the department of Puno. She is 44-years old, has a live-in partner and five children, and completed secondary school education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year and a half and works selling groceries, in bulk and retail, as well as personal hygiene and cleaning products. Her first loan of 300 PEN served as working capital to purchase a variety of merchandise for her business. Now Juana needs a loan of 1,200 PEN, which she promises to repay in four monthly payments. With this loan she can acquire a good selection of merchandise for her store (sugar, rice, oil, milk, drinks, etc.). Her business will allow her to buy a car in the future, since that is her wish.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as sugar, rice, oil, milk, and drinks to stock her business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.
Rita es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Rita junto a su esposo tienen un grifo llamado WB, cuenta con 2 personas, además en el mismo lugar brindan el servicio de engrase y lavado a los carros.
Rita necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de petróleo.
Rita sueña con tener un carro mas grande para transportar el combustible y mejorar la infraestructura de su grifo.
texts.en:
Rita is a member of the Gratitud Community Bank.She is 43; she is married and has 3 children.

Rita and her husband have a gas station called WB, with 2 employees. They also provide oil changes and have a car wash.

Rita needs a loan of 2000 sol to buy gasoline. She dreams of having a larger truck to transport fuel and improve the gas station's infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gasoline

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa K. est revendeuse de pagnes au grand marché de Lomé. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans. Agée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. le pagne occupe une part importante dans la confection de tenus de la population togolaise. c’est ainsi que la demande demeure très élevée. Pour faire face à ce besoin croissant, Akossiwa souhaite avec ce crédit se ravitailler en pagnes.
texts.en:
Akossiwa K. sells pagnes (colorful West African cloth) at the grand market of Lomé. She has been in this business for five years. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three. Pagnes occupy a significant portion of clothing manufacture for the people of Togo. Such is the reason why the demand remains very high. To address the growing need, Akossiwa would like to use this loan to resupply herself with pagnes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with pagne cloth

loans.name: Ma. Vilma

texts.en: Mrs. Ma. Vilma A. has raised pigs for years to help her husband generate enough income to feed their eight children and educate them to ensure their good fortune. She is an active member (and the center chief) of Paglaum Coop. This will be her seventh loan in the Coop, which is intended for the purchase of construction materials to repair the cages of her swine and for their feed. Her husband drives their motor cab for a living.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for pig enclosures and hog feed

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: Jovita tiene 40 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, que es el padre de sus 4 hijos, de los cuales, los 2 últimos aún están estudiando en la escuela de su pueblo. Junto a su esposo trabajan como jornaleros en las chacras de sus vecinos, y en menor cantidad,  siembran sus propios cultivos como; papa, arvejas y ullucos. Por ello se ve en la obligación de madrugar para tener tiempo de preparar los alimentos; y estar a las 8.00am en su trabajo habitual, donde le pagan 12 soles diarios a ella, y a su esposo 15 soles, de ese modo cubren la alimentación de sus hijos. Los cultivos de sus chacras los realizan, sólo las veces que se desocupan, ya que sus cosechas son cada 6 ú 8 meses, mientras tanto, trabajar arduamente donde los contraten. Pero ahora, esta pareja se ha propuesto darle un giro a su vida, quieren avocarse más a sus cultivos y lograr que produzcan en mayor cantidad y den frutos de primera calidad, los que puedan enviar a los diversos mercados de la zona y con esas ganancias comprar sus propios terrenos de cultivo. A Jovita le agrada mucho trabajar en la chacra, por eso que sus anhelos de progreso los tiene puestos en la agricultura. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, donde hace compromisos de seguir trabajando con el mismo dinamismo como hasta ahora lo viene haciendo, y en su banco comunal está muy contenta, sobre todo porque le permite ahorrar su dinero. Los 1300 soles que solicita los usará en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para abonar su chacra de papas, mientras que en la chacra donde Jovita se tomó la foto, sembrará arvejas
texts.en:
Jovita is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, who is the father of her four children. Of those four, the youngest two still attend the local school. She and her husband work as day laborers on the small farms of their neighbors, and, in small quantities, harvest their own crops like potatoes, peas and yams. She sees it as her obligation to wake up at sun rise to have time to prepare food and starts her work usually at 8 a.m., where they pay her 12 soles a day and her husband 15. In this way they are able to feed their children. She cultivates her own crops only when she has time, so she only harvests them once every six to eight months. Meanwhile, she labors arduously on the fields she's hired to work on.

However, now the couple is proposing a change in their lives. They want to focus more on their own land and produce their crops in higher quantities and of top quality. Jovita really enjoys working in her fields, so one of her goals of progress is expanding them. This is her third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to keep working hard with the same energy she that has taken her to this point. She is very satisfied with her community bank, above all because it helps her save money. She plans to use the 1300 soles she is requesting to purchase chemical fertilizers to enrich her potato fields. Meanwhile, in the field where Jovita took the photo, she will plant peas.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth and dye for making batick.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota L. T. is a native of Maputo, the capital city of Mozambique, but has lived for the last 30 years in the neighboring city of Boane with her family. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children aged 3, 8 (twins), 16, and 24. She studied until the 4th grade but was not able to continue with her studies as she lost her parents at a young age. 

Carlota works in Boane selling clothes and fabric from a stand. She has been doing this for over ten years and has primarily taught herself the business. Through her business she is able to make around MT 6,000 (approximately $220) per month and has been able to save a little money. With this loan she plans on fulfilling her dream of building a home for her family to live in. She intends on taking out further loans in the future to help grow her business.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Elizabeth Nabwitikha

texts.en:
Elizabeth Nabwitikha O. is a 55-year-old lady living in Bukembe village of Kakamega District, Western Kenya. She is married to Linus Odera and they have six children.

Elizabeth is a fish monger and has been in the business for the last 24 years. She manages this business on her own, and she intends to diversify her business to include dairy farming. This will be Elizabeth's third loan from KADET. She plans to use this loan to increase her stock of fish and to purchase dairy cattle.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell and dairy cattle

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Mrs. Ream M. is a villager in Slaeng village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces a small problem because her field is infertile so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support the field. She would use the rest of the loan to hire laborers to work in the field. Her husband, Mr. Dom Rum, is an electric cow driver who can make a small income to support the family. 

Mrs. Ream M. has two children who are both too young to work or study. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to support the field and  hire laborers to work in the field

loans.name: Gunaron

texts.en:
Gunaron V. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Gunaron is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Gunaron owns and operates a business selling primary goods to local community members. Gunaron has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2009, Gunaron joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gunaron is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gunaron from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Amigas de Santa Bárbara”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 41 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 04 hijos, la señora Sonia no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive en el Barrio Santa Adriana 2da etapa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años es una de las socias fundadoras, con un préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió para la compra de lanas de diferentes colores.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana acrílica y lana de alpaca de todos los colores, para la elaboración de prendas de vestir y accesorios, además ella tiene su negocio de renovación y compostura de calzados y de ves en cuando le ayuda su esposo ya que el trabaja independiente.

Su deseo es ampliar su negocio.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia is a member of the Friends of Santa Barbara Community Bank, which is in the Juliaca district, in the San Román Province, in the Puno Department. She is 41 years old, married and mother of 4 children. Sonia did not have the opportunity to study formally, but she lives in the Santa Adriana neighborhood. Sonia has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for many years, and was one of the founding members with an initial loan of 300 Nuw Soles, money which she invested in the purchase of different colored wools. Currently she is requesting a loan of $175, for the purchase of acrilic wool and alpaca wool of many colors, to grow her stock of clothing and accessory items. Furthermore, she is redesigning her business and shoe repair and she sometimes helps her husband now that he works independently. She likes get-togethers, and her wish is to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase  of acrilic and alpaca wool

loans.name: Miriams Ildilcia

texts.es:
la sra. MIRIAMS IDILICIA C. OCHOA tiene una pulperia en la cual vende productos de consumo popular, el nombre de Pulpería es  "LOS GEMELOS". Tiene varios años de tener su pulperia, a la vez vende ropa y calzado, utencilios plasticos para la cocina.
con los ingresos que le proporciona este negocio contribuye a su  esposo con los gastos del hogar y juntos poder sacar adelante a su famlia pues tiene dos hijos que cursan la secundaria , uno de los retos como padres de familia es heredarles una preparacion a sus hijos universitaria si Dios a si lo permite.
necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder tener surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Miriams Idilicia C. Ochoa manages a grocery store where she sells popular consumer products. Her store is called “Los Gemelos”. She has been in the grocery business for several years. In addition, she sells clothing, shoes, and plastic cooking utensils.

The income she generates enables her to help her husband with the household expenses and the support of their two children who attend high school. One of their challenges as parents is to provide a college education for their children if God allows.

Miriams needs a loan to buy more merchandise to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Ayola

texts.en: Y., a 34-year-old married mother of one child, has been a caterer for the past four years. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more flour and decoration materials. Y. says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more decoration materials

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia U. is from the village of Inobulan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old and is married with five adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mrs. Navy Pho Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people who are all living in Damnak Rovieng village in Takeo province make up the village bank group. Mrs. Navy P. is the president who has been selected by the members of the village bank group and they all will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. She is 45 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.  Her husband, Mr. Nan Sokha, owns a loudspeaker which has been hired by the villagers for use during festivals and weddings. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Navy P. decided to request a loan to buy more loudspeakers.

loans.use: to buy more loudspeakers

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: AÏssatou D. a 23 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et a acquière une bonne expérience en matière de crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle participe aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou D., aged 23, is married and the mother of a child. She has been a member of a village bank for four years and is very experienced with the credit process. She produces and sells peanut butter. She participates in the daily expenses of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her activity

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth is married with four children and she is 45 years old. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home.

Loveth has a restaurant where she sells Nigerian cooked foods to make a living. She starts the preparation of her cooked foods at 4:30 a.m. daily. She has been in this business for a long time.

Loveth is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs  to cook and sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.

Gloria works hard to support her husband and to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey with fried fish. Gloria sells by the road side. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities.

Gloria has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Roberto Antonio Áreas Larga espada, tiene la edad de 42 años, Labora como vigilante en el Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, el tiene  dos hijos a su cargo, y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, es papa soltero, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en el mejoramiento de su  vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El cual utilizara para remodelar el piso de su de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 
Roberto dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su casa por lo que ahora sus hijos y el cuenta con mejores condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en:
Roberto Antonio Áreas L. is 42. He works as a security guard at the Roberto Huembes Market in Managua. He is raising two school age children. He is a single father. For four years he has worked with loans with Ceprodel. During this period of time he has invested three loans in improving his house, thanks to Ceprodel. He is an excellent client. The loan he is requesting is to buy construction materials, which he will use to remodel the floor of his house. His objective is to provide better security and better living conditions to his children. Roberto said that thanks to the loans from Ceprodel he has been able to improve his house. Now he and his children have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve and expand his house

loans.name: 02-Dong Hai Group

texts.en:
"Huong L. T. (19) is a 32 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Huong is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02-Dong Hai (16-05-02).

Huong is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Huong owns and operates a butcher shop, selling a variety of meats in the local community.  Huong has been in this business for over a year and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month.

In 2004, Huong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huong has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to expand the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND to expanding the business even more.  The loan will be her ninth from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Huong plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  P. T. Quyet (26) is a 27 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  P. T. Luan (20) is a 38 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

3.  N. T. Chien (21) is a 48 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  N. T. Van (15) is a 41 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  L. T. Loi (12) is a 50 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6.  L. T. Binh (19) is a 47 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
---------------------------------------------

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


Huong L. T. (19) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Huong là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02-Dong Hai (16-05-02).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán nhiều loại thịt khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Huong thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huong kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Huong đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huong đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. T. Quyet (26) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  P. T. Luan (20) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  N. T. Chien (21) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. T. Van (15) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  L. T. Loi (12) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  L. T. Binh (19) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: Expand the business.

loans.name: Ciriano

texts.en: Cipriano F. is 51 years old and is from San Estanislao.  He runs a business that rents out tables and chairs for parties and other social events, and he owns a truck to transport the equipment.  Cipriano's wife makes decorations for birthdays and weddings.  Cipriano owns three rooms that he rents out.  He now wants to build a stage that he can rent out along with the party rooms.

loans.use: Build a stage

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Crecer” esta representado por la señora Martha Elvira y conformadas por 12 miembros D. las cuales 2 son varones y el resto mujeres todas se caracteriza por ser muy unido y alegre; La señora Martha Elvira es natural D. la ciudad D. Sucre, es muy amiga D. todas y sabe como dirigir su grupo ellas no es casada pero tiene su pareja (concubino)con quien tiene 2 hijos menores por quienes velan y los cuidan esta socia cuenta con un negocio D. venta D.  asadito, refrescos y otros alimentos que son consumidos en la hora D. la merienda, la venta es realizada en las inmediaciones D. su domicilios el cual es alquilado, las expectativas D. Martha es crecer poco a poco y poder tener una pensión y poder crecer para contar con una casa propia. El resto del grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades como se la venta D. comida, D. cosméticos, repostería tradicional, venta D. ropa nueva y usada, confección y relación D. ropa, estas actividades son desempeñadas como ambulante y en otros casos en un puesto fijo. Si bien la competencia es bastante el grupo cuenta con clientes fijos que conocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otro lado cave recalcar el entusiasmo que ponen las mismas al realizar su trabajo y es esta misma razón que tienen clientes leales a sus servicios y productos. El crédito esta destinado como capital D. operaciones, para compra D. mercadería, materiales, insumos y herramientas. La mayor expectativa D. las socias es contar con un negocio bien establecido donD. puedan trabajar y obtener una mejor ganancia para el sustento D. sus hogares y para darles a sus hijos una mejor educación y un futuro mejor. El grupo va cursando ya un segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, puntualidad y bastante solvencia moral en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Crecer” (To Grow) is led by Sra. Martha Elvira and consists of twelve members, two of whom are men. The rest are women who are known for being very close-knit and cheerful.

Sra. Martha Elvira is a native of the city of Sucre. She a good friend to everyone and knows how to manage her group. Martha is not married, but she has a live-in partner with whom she has two dependent children. She has a business selling roasted meats, soft drinks, and other food items that are consumed as afternoon snacks. Martha conducts her business within close proximity of home, which she rents. Her expectations have grown slowly and now she hopes to open a boarding house and have her own home.

The rest of the group is engaged in different businesses involving food, cosmetics, traditional desserts, new and used clothing, and sewing. Some of the members work as traveling vendors while the others operate their businesses from permanent locations. They have dealt with competition very well. The members have regular customers who are familiar with their work and request their services. It should also be emphasized that the enthusiasm the members put into their work is the very reason why their customers have remained loyal to their products and services. This loan is designated as operating capital for purchasing merchandise, materials, supplies, and equipment. Their greatest expectations are to establish their businesses in the areas where they work and to generate better profits for maintaining their households and providing their children with an education and a better future. The group is already starting its second loan cycle and has demonstrated responsibility, punctuality, and reliability in the handling of their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nabuti B Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
Harriet N. is shown at the top right in the small photo and also in the big group photo.

Harriet is a hardworking 43-year-old married woman. She has six children who are between the ages of 4 and 21. The youngest one is in primary 1 and the oldest one is in senior 6.

Harriet is a fresh-food supplier and also does food sales in Kame Vendors area. It is a challenging business to be in because sometimes she does not have enough capital to buy her supplies and also because of the challenges of the different growing seasons. However, her business is good because she is able to generate 120,000 USH each week.

Harriet dreams of boosting her business to make it larger and she also dreams of educating her children. Today she is taking her 3rd loan with Pearl. She has requested 700,000 USH to buy more stock for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, greens and fresh garden foods to sell

loans.name: United Brother Group

texts.en:
Henry S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Brother. He is 26 years old, single and has a 3 years old child. He could not continue his education after high school.

For 5 years Henry has been selling medicated robs, lotion for rashes and other skin problems.He sells adjacent the Ministry Of Finance, in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He sells goods that customers need which keeps them returning.

He started selling with 1,000 LRD as working capital, but now has 15,000 LRD as working capital.

Henry plans to use his portion of the group loan to buy more medical robs to improve his business. His goal is to grow his business to a better size.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Henry is the one holding the sign.


About LEAP

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more medical robs to improve his business.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a 24-year-old married woman from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has two children and the eldest is four years old. She is involved in rice farming and has also started growing pigs. She works hard to be able to provide for her family. She also wants to save early for her children’s future. She hopes that someday she will have a stable income so that providing for her family’s needs will not be as hard.

Elvie is requesting a loan of PHP15,000, which she will use to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. She will also buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies and Feeds

loans.name: Nawy Gozar Gah Group

texts.en:
Mahboba, the daughter of J., is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She is the leader of the Nawy Gozar Gah group. She lives in Kabul. She has a carpet weaving business in which she has been involved for more than 6 years.

She has requested a loan in order to buy a new carpet frame to help her work better and to expand her business. She is very happy about this lending process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy a new carpet frame

loans.name: Edy De La Mar

texts.es:
La Sra Edy D. la Mar R. tiene 65 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 1 hijo mayor el cual vive con la misma, ya tiene propia familia formada.
