DesD. hace 5 años atrás empezó con el negocio D. Venta D. Comida para algunos personales D. empresas cercana a su domicilio.
Con el crédito obtenido D. la fundación estará comprando una cocina eléctrica D. 6 hornallas y horno, por que la cocina que tiene ya no le es suficiente para la demanda D. clientes. 
 Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Edy D. la Mar R. is 65 years old, married, and has an adult son who lives with her and has his own family. Five years ago, she started selling food to people who worked at businesses located near her home.

The loan she obtained from Fundación Paraguaya will be used to buy an electric stove that has six burners and an oven. The current stove she has is not sufficient for meeting the demands of her customers. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support that has been provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an electric stove

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal M. is a 43-year-old villager from Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phoeun Phon, are farmers who own three hectares of land to cultivate rice. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Sophal M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine and fertilizer. In addition to farming, Mr. Phoeun Phon is a breeder of ducks for duck eggs, from which he can earn a small income to support his family. The couple has three children, who all attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and fertilizer

loans.name: Monande

texts.en: Monande M. is an entrepreneur. He runs a business buying and selling eggs to customers in Dar es Salaam city center. He purchases goods direct from poultry keepers wholesale and goes around the city to find customers on a bicycle. He sells 15 to 20 trays of eggs per day. His business income enables him to meet his family's daily needs. He is requesting a loan of 700,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more eggs.

loans.use: To buy more eggs

loans.name: Denis Dimas

texts.es:
Denis Dimas F. M. tiene 55 años.  Es casado vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia. Tiene 2 hijos, Karla (8) y Denis (5). 

 Denis es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz. 

Denis se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz además tiene un negocio de víveres. Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los Agro servicios de AGRIPAD, los víveres en el Centro Comercial Mata de Cacao y vende los productos en el centro de acopio del Recinto Delicia.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos agrícolas y  comprar víveres. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño tener mayor cantidad de productos y tener una mejor calidad de vida. El desafío que enfrentamos es en tiempo ya que se puede dar plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta el baile y el deporte y salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
55-year old Denis Dimas F. M. is married and lives in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar province, in the town of Recinto Delicia. He has two children, Karla aged 8 and Denis aged 5. Denis is a member of the rural bank El Progreso La Delicia Recinto which is located in the parish of San José del Tambo. There are nineteen members in the group. Most of the community works in farming, growing cocoa and corn. Denis is a farmer too and grows corn; he also has a general store. He buys agricultural products and supplies on a monthly basis for his farm from Agripad, supplies for the store from the Mata de Cacao shopping center, and he sells his products in the wholesale market in Recinto Delicia. Denis is seeking a loan to buy agricultural products and supplies. He thinks this is an opportunity for him to get ahead in life. His dream is to have a larger quantity of products to sell and a better quality of life. The challenge he faces are the diseases and insects that sometimes infect his crops. Denis enjoys dancing, sports, and going for walks with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy agricultural products and supplies

loans.name: Djumapili

texts.en:
Djumapili is 47 years old and married with three children. Djumapili is well known for his shop where he sells a variety of goods. Djumapili has been in this business for a long time. The hours of his business are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Djumapili needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, Djumapili will start selling foodstuffs such as cassava flour, rice, beans, peas, etc. With this sale of foodstuffs, Djumapili will hopefully earn a lot of money and this will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and to start saving for the future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly foodstuffs such as cassava flour, rice, beans, peas, etc.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina pertenece al Banco Comunal Milenio hace 9 años y lo que mas le gusta es la facilidad del préstamo y las capacitaciones que la ayudan mucho en su negocio.
Justina es conviviente tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella, hace 1 año Justina vendía verduras en el mercado 12 de abril, era un trabajo forzado que dejo de realizar ahora tiene líneas telefónicas para lo cual tiene 6 personas que trabajan con las líneas, Justina esta por mas mañanas y por las noches. Además Justina realiza diferentes negocios dependiendo de la oportunidad. Justina esta construyendo el segundo piso de su casa.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ladrillos.
Justina sueña con comprar un carro moderno para alquilar y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Justina has been a member of the Communal Bank “Milenio” (Millennium) for nine years. What she likes most are the convenience of the loans and the training classes that have been a great help to her business.

Justina is in a common law marriage and has five children, three of whom still live with her. She began selling vegetables at the April 12th market a year ago after she was forced to leave her previous job. Justina also owns a call center and has six employees who manage the phone lines for her in the mornings and in the evenings. She pursues different businesses depending on the available opportunities.

Justina is currently adding a second floor to her house. She needs a loan of 900 soles to invest in the purchase of bricks. Justina dreams of purchasing a modern automobile that she can rent out and hopes to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bricks

loans.name: Valentin Pedro

texts.es: Valentín es de 28 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo varón, es tejedor, actualmente se dedica a elaborar cortes típicos, en la actividad tiene once años de experiencia, solicita su tercer crédito, para ampliación de capital, las referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora por lo que no tendrá dificultades para efectuar los pagos correspondientes.
texts.en:
Valentín, 28, is married and has one male child. He is a weaver and currently devotes his efforts to the creation of traditional woven skirts in which he has eleven years of experience. He is seeking his third loan to increase his working capital. The personal references indicate that he is a responsible and hardworking person and should have no difficulty in making the appropriate payments.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: La sra. Maria Dionisia H. tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, y junto a su familia reside en el municipio de San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho. Hace 12 años y sin saber nada de negocios la sra. Maria Dionisia decidiò comenzar a ganarse la vida instalando una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, con un horario de atencion de 6:00 am a 7:00 pm y gracias a los prestamos que ha recibido de FAMA ella ha podido ir invirtiendo mas en su negocio y ahora es uno de los negocios mas prosperos de la comunidad, tambien ha mejorado su calidad de vida y hasta a comprado unas cuantas vacas. Es la Coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Dios es Amor y junto a sus 6 compañeros de grupo ya tiene 4 años de ser cliente activa en FAMA. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para surtir su pulperia de mas y variados productos como ser: arroz, frijoles, condimentos, salsas, espaguetis, churros, refrescos, margarina, aceite, dulces, pan, etc. Su sueño es que su negocio se convierta en un mercadito y tener mas ingresos porque sus hijos estudian y ella quiere que lleguen a ser profesionales universitarios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Dionisia H. is 46 years old, married, has 4 children, and lives with her family in the town of San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho. Twelve years ago, without much knowledge about business, Mrs. Maria Dionisia decided to make a living by installing a small grocery store in her home. She works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. and thanks to the loans she has received from FAMA she has been able to invest more in her business and now owns one of the most successful businesses in the community. Her quality of life has also improved and she has been able to buy some cows. She is coordinator of the Solidarity Group, God is Love, and together with her 6 fellow members has been active for 4 years in FAMA. The loan she is requesting is needed to supply her grocery store with more and varied products such as: rice, beans, condiments, salsas, spaghetti, churros, sodas, margarine, oil, candies, etc. Her dream is that her business develop into a small market and that she make more profits for her children to study so that they can become university students.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora A., from the town of Talibon, is 55 years old. To make a living, Leonora owns and operates a specialized retail store selling spices and vegetables such as squash, carrots, and onions to the community. She hopes for her store to grow and wishes to acquire more vegetables to sell.

Leonora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Havings repaid her previous loan from CEVI, Leonora is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase more products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is part of the communal bank “Peulla Brotes Nuevos,” and resides in the city of Viña del Mar. She runs a small sewing and clothing shop at her house. Elizabeth also sews for a boutique, but this is not a steady employment contract. Elizabeth receives help from her husband in the business; he also has a second job working in construction. Her husband takes care of all the ironing and sometimes does some sewing tasks as well.
With this loan Elizabeth intends to rent a local studio in a more visible location, which will also offer more space. She dreams of expanding her business to sell clothing items and decorative items that she produces. Elizabeth’s motivation is to give higher education to her four sons: aged 20, 18, 17 and 16. Elizabeth's oldest daughter (aged 20) studies pedagogy and is also a well versed seamstress, so Elizabeth also plans to lean on her skills as her business grows more.
For Elizabeth, working with Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza has been helpful as it has motivated her to think about the future of her business and through that advance forward to the next step. She is also happy with the interest rates and the weekly payment schedule, as this gets her out of debt quicker.
Viña del Mar is a city and community located in the central coastal region of Chile, known as the "Garden City" because of its beautiful parks and gardens. The city is in the Valparaíso region, known for its temperate climate. This region is known as the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: To expand her business by renting a local studio

loans.name: Sovanna

texts.en:
Mr. Sovanna O. is a 35-year-old and his wife, Mrs. Phalleap Sao is a 34-year-old (pictured together). They have been married since 1999 and have three children--one sO. and two daughters. Both daughters are in school and the sO. is still young and stays at home. The family lives along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sovanna is a teacher. His wife sells rice and other food at school along with her husband. He is applying for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to replace their motorcycle for commuting because the old one breaks down and uses a lot of gasoline. He will also use a part of the loan to provide capital for his wife to expand her business.

loans.use: To replace their motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma L. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Norma is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Norma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Norma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily, age 31, spends her time managing her rice-farming business.  She enjoys working on the farm because it provides food, shelter, and clothing for her family.  She is a widow and has 5 children to support.

She would like to continue working on her farm for the sustenance of her family, but she is limited by farm financing. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to be able to take a business loan. She requested a loan of 4,000 Php, whichis enough to buy the materials and supplies she needs for her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Siek's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consist of ten members, and they are located in Preaek Dach village in Kandal province. Mr. Siek S., 40 years old, is the village bank president, who was selected by its members. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve the living of their families. 

Mr. Siek S., is single, and is a laborer for which he can receive a little salary to support himself. With his laboring, he still earns little income to improve his living conditions. Thus, Mr. Siek S., would like to ask for a loan to build a chicken house, to buy chicken feed and to buy chickens for breeding. With the new loan, he hopes to increase his income to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To build a chicken house, to buy chicken feed and chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Mary Njeri

texts.en:
Mary  is 35 years old. She is married to John Murage, who contributes to the family's income. She runs a dairy farm which has been in operation for a period of 14 years. The farm brings in an income of about KES 7,000.

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD to buy an extra dairy cow in order to increase productivity. She hopes to become a leading dairy farmer in her region and to give her children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy an extra dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials to make clothing

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice C. is a married lady of 48 who resides in Kapsabet town. She is blessed with three children between 24 and 14. Alice owns a shop in Cheplengu trading centre and has been in this business for eight years.  

Her monthly profit is Ksh. 3,000 and she normally saves this amount. Alice has borrowed a loan of Kshs. 10,000 from KADET LTD.It is her first loan with which she intends to purchase more stock for her shop, such as tea, cooking oil, and salt. 

Her hope and dream is to own a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase business stock

loans.name: Haruni

texts.en: Haruni is 30 years old and married with two children.  He is able to send his children to school with the income he gets from selling electronic goods.  He has been running the business for three years and he has employed one person. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for training him in business management.  This has helped him to improve his business. He has requested 60,000 Kes to buy televisions and mobile phones.

loans.use: To buy televisions and mobile phones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, rice, and vegetables

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria R.: Tiene 34 años desde muy pequeña vindia con su mama ahora tiene un puesto en el mercado local de su localidad,se dedica a la venta de verduras y especies para comida, nececita su refinanciamiento para invertir mas en verduras ya que ella tiene a una persona que le ayuda a vender en otro pueblo y nececita que sus verduras sean variables para complaser la demanda de sus clientes y clientes nuevos, su deceo es poder tener un local mas en el mercado, y asi tener mas ganancias.
texts.en: Maria R. is 34-years-old and since she was very little she has sold with her mother.  Now she has a stand in the local market for her town and works selling vegetables and seasonings for food.  She needs a loan to invest more in vegetables as she has a person who helps her in another town and she needs more varieties of vegetables to meet the demand from her customers and also new customers.  Her hope is to be able to have another stand in the market and thus have more profits.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 26 años, vive en compañía de sus hijos y su madre en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a realizar costuras de faldas y prendas típicas desde hace 3 años, aprendió este oficio por medio de sus amigas y en la actualidad se asoció con su cuñada para comprar maquinas de coser y bordadoras que la ayudan a optimizar el trabajo con mayor calidad y rapidez en su producción. De esta manera ahorra tiempo para atender a su pequeña hija, su horario habitual de trabajo es casi todo el día, dependiendo además de la cantidad de prendas que debe elabora o de los pedidos de los clientes que le hacen para alguna fiesta festiva que se presente en su localidad, cuando es así es donde lleva su producción a los comerciantes de prendas típicas que se encuentran en las ferias. Le agrada bastante su oficio y desea concretar sus proyectos de crecimiento de su negocio. Es su crédito número 2 con MFP, gracias a los créditos solicitados en el banco comunal que integra aprendió  el valor importante del ahorro ya que ha visto en su propia experiencia que salva de apuros en momentos de dificultad además de trabajar a gusto con personas que considera de confianza por lo que se siente muy agradecida. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos y telas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Lidia is 26 years old.  She lives with her children and mother in her parents' home.  Lidia's business is making skirts and traditional clothing and she has been in this business for 3 years.  She learned the trade from her friends and formed a partnership with her sister-in-law in order to buy sewing machines and embroidery machines which help her to optimize her work, producing better-quality garments more quickly.  This means that she saves time that she can then spend looking after her young daughter.  Lidia's usual work hours are 'nearly all day' but they also depend on the quantity of clothes that she has to make and on orders that her customers make for festive events in their area.  When this is the case, she takes her products to people who sell traditional clothing in the markets.

Lidia enjoys her work and would like to carry out plans to grow her business.  This is her second loan with MFP.  Thanks to the loans requested through her community bank, she has learned the importance of saving since she has witnessed through her own experience how it can help get you out of a tight spot when you are going through a difficult time.  She also enjoys working with people who she trusts and feels very grateful for this.  Lidia will use the loan she is requesting to invest in buying thread and fabric wholesale.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric

loans.name: Pajalib'al Chij Group

texts.es:
Vilma Antonieta L. C., es soltera, tiene 19 años de edad, cursó los seis años de estudios primarios, se dedica al comercio de utensilios de cocina y artículos de plástico, lleva tres años de experiencia con este trabajo, inicio su negocio con un pequeño capital que tenía. 

Decide organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar su capital de trabajo, las integrantes del grupo realiza diferentes actividades productivas como: venta de utensiios de cocina, artículos de plástico y crianza de animales. Esperan mejorar sus ingresos con la inversión del prestamo que estan hacendo a ASDIR.
texts.en:
Vilma Antonieta López C., 19, is single.  She finished 6th grade.  She sells kitchen utensils and plastic items.  She has three years experience in this line of work.  She started the business with a small amount of capital she had.

She decided to organize a group to request a loan and expand working capital.  The members of the group carry out a variety of productive activities, such as: sale of kitchen utensils, sale of plastic items and raising livestock.  They hope to improve their income by investing the loan they are getting from ASDIR.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and plastic items.

loans.name: Santos Margarita

texts.es: Doña Santos Margarita T.,tiene 53 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ninguno estudia, se dedica al comercio, a la reventa de cortes típicos de seda, lleva 2 años de experiencia en este negocio, inició por iniciativa propia y deseos de superación, se acerca a ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para capital de trabajo, para la compra de cortes típicos para su reventa, y obtener la ganancia, espera con la inversión que hace  tenga un negocio mas grande y mejores ganancias, y darle de esta manera un mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Santos Margarita T., 53 years old, has 3 children none of whom are in school. She is a merchant, re-selling traditional cuts of silk. She has been doing this for two years. She got started on her own initiative and her desire to get ahead. She came to ASDIR to ask for a loan for business capital, to purchase traditional fabric cuts for resale and to earn money this way. She hopes that by making this investment she will have a larger business and better profits and so will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cuts of silk for resale

loans.name: Agneta

texts.en:
Agneta. age 36, is married with seven children between the ages of 1 and 18. She has been farming for five years in her hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya producing maize, beans and milk. All her produce is sold locally. Agneta fully relies on farming for her family's upkeep.

Agneta has requested a loan of 52,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She is optimistic that she will be able to make adequate income to provide for basic family needs like the provision of education and meals. However, Agneta laments of the high costs of animal diseases.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Irma es una señora D. 52 años D. edad, domiciliada en la Compañía Itá Potrero D. la Ciudad D. Itá, tiene 9 hijos D. los cuales 2 se encuentran en España, 1 cursando la Carrera D. Militar, otro estudiando en el S.N.P.P; la mayoria D. sus hijos ya se independizaron y formaron su propio hogar.
La Sra.Irma se dedica a la venta D. leche desD. hace más D. 6 años, posee 4 vacas y 2 vaquillas, su venta diaria D. leche alcanza los 30 litros, posee una clientela bien formada en los alrededores D. su domicilio.
Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable y requiere este préstamo para aumentar la calidad D. los animales y obtener mejor y mayor cantidad D. leche.
texts.en:
Sra. Irma is 52 years old. She lives in the Itá Potrero neighborhood in the city of Itá. She has 9 children. Two live in Spain, one is pursuing a military career, and another studies at the S.N.P.P (a Paraguayan institution that provides vocational training). Most of her children are independent and have formed their own households.

For more than six years, Sra. Irma has been engaged in the sale of milk. She owns 4 cows and 2 heifers. Her daily milk sales reach 30 litres. She has an established clientele from the area around her home. Irma is a very hardworking and responsible person and needs this loan in order to improve the quality of her animals and obtain a greater quantity of milk.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cows.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher provides transportation services around the territory of Istaravshan, where he lives with his wife and two young children. His business is the only source of income for his family. He has been in this business for four years. Alisher enjoys his work because he loves being around other people. 
 
Alisher is planning to use his loan of 10,000 Somoni to make essential repairs to his vehicle. He is confident that these repairs will make his car more durable and will help him handle tough competition and expand his business. Profits generated will not only promote continued growth for Alisher’s business but will also provide a better income for his family. Alisher is a balanced and determined individual who has repaid his previous loans from IMON International without any delinquencies.

More about Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and served as the location for the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

More about IMON International:
 
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for necessary repairs to his minivan

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Arlene has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads & biscuits. She has had this business for 28 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages & breads. 

Arlene is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & breads

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, 33 years old, is a bread seller. Her husband is a driver and their income is $10 per day. They have two children, 16 and 13 years old, both students. Sopheap's monthly expenses include $112 for food, $10 for electricity, $37 for school fees and $25 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a car for her husband to run a taxi business. Sopheap hopes to expand her bread selling so that she has enough money for her children's school fees. She wants to send her children to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy a car to run a taxi business

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Juan tiene 46 años de edad, es divorciado, vive en la ciudad de Villarrica, cuenta con casa propia.
El se dedica a la albañilería dentro y fuera de su ciudad. Debido a que tiene muchos trabajos necesita de herramientas que faciliten y agilicen su labor diaria, pues así incrementara su ingreso y tendrá un mejor nivel de vida.
El se define como un hombre muy trabajador ya que su profesión es muy sacrificada ya que requiere un gran esfuerzo físico y mental.
Solicita el credito para la compra de herramientas que va a utilizar en su profesión. El tiene las esperanzas puestas en el credito, ya que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan is 46, divorced and lives in the city of Villarrica in his own house.  He is a bricklayer and works in and outside of the city.  Because of the many jobs he has, he needs a set of tools that will make his work day more flexible.  This will allow him to increase his income and improve his lifestyle.

He defines himself as a hard worker since his profession requires a lot of sacrifice and much physical and mental effort.

He is requesting a loan to buy the tools he needs and has high hopes that the loan will be of great assistance to him.

loans.use: To buy tools for his construction trade.

loans.name: Francisca Fabiola

texts.es: Francisca Fabiola es madre de una niña de 5 años y un niño de 1 año de edad por los que sale adelante para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. Hace tiempo adquirió su vivienda de interés social, que regularmente estas casas son muy pequeñas el beneficio que tiene la casa  es que tiene suficiente espacio para construir lo cual aprovecho iniciando con ahorros. Es por ello que Fabiola solicito este crédito para terminar la construcción de los detalles como lo es enjarrar, poner ventanas y vitropiso.
texts.en:
Francisca Fabiola is the mother of a five-year-old daughter and a one-year-old son. She wants to get ahead so that she can offer them a better quality of life. Some time ago, Francisca Fabiola acquired her home through a government housing program. These houses are usually very small, but the benefit is that people can purchase them with their savings and have enough space to live in as a starter home.

For this reason, Fabiola is requesting a loan to finish the construction of her house and to add details such as lattice work, windows, and a floor.

loans.use: to finish the construction of her house.

loans.name: Elsa Elena

texts.es:
Para Elena de 38 años de edad fué una Bendicíon de Dios quedarse con el negocio que le dejó su padre, por ello el nombre del mismo "Bendición de Dios", como no tenía ahorros empezó con poco capital. 

Su trabajo lo empieza desde las 8h00am a 20h00pm sola ya que considera que sus hijos ( 2 y 11 años) tiene que estudiar y están pequeños aun.

Ser madre soltera y vivir en una zona periurbana le dificulta comprar los productos para abastecer su tienda, su casa es mixta y por ello desea un préstamo para terminarla de cemento totalmente y compar arroz, azucar, frejoles, aceite y obtener mas ganancias ahorrar y tener una vida digna junto a su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
To Elena, age 38, it was a blessing from God to stay in the business her father left her.  That is why the name of the business is “Bendición de Dios” (God's Blessing).  As she did not have savings, she started with little capital.

She only works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 pm. considering that her children (ages 2 and 11) have to study, and they are still little.

Being a single mother and living in a peri-urban zone makes it difficult for her to buy products to stock her store.  

Her house is made of mixed materials.  Therefore, she wants the loan to finish it completely with cement.  She will also buy rice, sugar, beans, and oil in order to get more earnings, to save, and to have a decent life together with her small family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, and juice.

loans.name: María Janeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Fe Y Progreso.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 38 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  22, 15 y 5 años de edad, actualmente está en su séptimo mes de  embarazo, dos de sus hijos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es operador de maquinas pesadas.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa interior por catalogo y de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Nuestra amiga vende en su casa aunque a veces también sale por los alrededores a ofrecer sus productos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva seis años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la ayuda que recibe del banco.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Janeth lives in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí.  It has been known for many years as the city of real tamarinds, due to the large quantity of this fruit that it produced years ago.  She meets with the members of her communal bank, Fe y Progreso (Faith and Progress), every two weeks.

María is 38; married; and has 3 children who are 22, 15, and 5.  She is currently 7 months pregnant.  Two of her children are in high school, and one is in elementary school.  Her husband operates heavy equipment.

She is a housewife who started selling lingerie and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories) to make her own money.  Our friend sells out of her house but also sometimes goes to the surrounding areas to see her products.  She offers her products on credit and collects every week or two weeks according to what her customers request.  The beauty products are delivered to her home, and she gets the lingerie from a distributor downtown.  She has done this work for 10 years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and lingerie.  She has been a member of her communal bank for 6 years, and she likes it because of the help she has received from it.

Her dream is to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and lingerie.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 42 años, su actividad es la venta de cerdos. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio. Inicio por la necesidad de ofrecerles a sus dos hijos de 2 y 8 años las condiciones necesarias. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos ya que actualmente tiene demanda de parte de sus clientes. El les enseña a sus hijos  aganarse la vida de una manera humilde, pues tiene las esperanzas de que algún dia sus hijos puedan finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Francisco is 42, and sells pigs. He has had his business for 8 years. He started it because he needed to provide for his two children, ages 2 and 8.

This loan is for the purchase of pigs, since at the present time there is demand from his customers. He is teaching his children to earn a modest living, since he hopes that someday his children can complete their schooling.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 31-year-old married woman and mother of one child from Irbid, Jordan.

Hiba has a beauty salon and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to expand her salon and purchase more cosmetics for it.

Hiba aspires to open a wedding dress section for her salon and put in new decoration for it. She is also looking to increase her family income and open new locations for her salon in other areas.

loans.use: To purchase new cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Banco Mujer Valientas Y Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Doña  Ana es la Presidenta de Banco Mujer Valientas y Luchadoras, es una mujer muy trabajadora y lidereza comunitaria, con 40 años de edad madre de 4 hijos, todos estudiantes, con quiénes vive, junto a su esposo.
Se enteró de los servicios de Fundación Mujer por medio de una vecina de la comunidad, está es la primera solicitud de crédito de este grupo, ella se dedica a actividades agropecuarias como cria de animales y siembra de algunos cultivos,  va a invertir el crédito en la compra de pollos, concentrados, alimentos y vitaminas para estos animales; Tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de campo, y cuenta con el apoyo de toda su familia.
Los principales obstáculos que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de dinero para comprar materia prima, la falta  un mercado fijo para comercializar sus productos y el bajo precio que se ve obligada a vender dichos productos. 
El día de Doña Ana debe empezar muy temprano, para poder atender sus labores domésticas, preparar la comida para sus hijos que se van a estudiar, y luego junto con su esposo trabajar todo el resto del día en las labores del campo. 
Ana y sus compañeras tiene muchos sueños y metas por cumplir; entre las más importantes está la superación personal, mejorar la condición económica de sus familias, ampliar sus microempresas, y su gran sueño es crear una cooperativa que les reciba todo lo que ellas producen y lo vendan en grandes cantidades a mejores precios.  El crédito va ser de gran ayuda para ella y sus 8 compañeras del grupo que van a invertir en actividades como avicultura y porcicultura.
texts.en:
Ana is the president of communal bank "Mujer Valientas Y Luchadoras". She is a very hardworking woman and she is a community leader. She is 40 years old and the mother of 4 children, all of whom are attending school. She lives together with them and her husband.

She found out about the services provided by Fundacion Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) through a neighbor in her community. This is the first loan which she requests from this group. She is dedicated to agricultural activities, such as raising livestock and planting some cultivations. She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of poultry, concentrated food, feed, and vitamins for them. She has a great deal of farm experience and she has the support of her entire family.

The primary obstacle she has had to face is the lack of funds to purchase raw materials. She does not have a stable market to sell her products and the drop in prices at which she is forced to sell these products.

Ana needs to start her days very early in order to attend to the household work, such preparing food for her children who attend school. Later on she works alongside her husband all day taking care of the farm work. 

Ana and her colleagues have many dreams and goals to attain. Among the most important is the dream of self-improvement, improving the financial condition of their families, and to expand their small businesses. A great dream is to create a cooperative that will accept all that they produce to sell in large quantities and at better prices. The loan will be a great help for her and 8 group-mates. They will invest in their businesses, such as poultry farming and pig farming.

loans.use: to purchase poultry, concetrated feed, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma tiene 52 años, es una mujer amable, alegre y muy responsable, esta separada de su esposo, pero es madre de dos hijos de 27 quien ya es independiente y de 19 años quien vive en Lima estudiando y que depende aún de ella. Ella vive en su casa propia junto a sus sobrinas a quienes le renta habitaciones. El trabajo de Emma consiste en la venta de frutas y verduras regionales, entre las frutas que vente están el aguaje, guabas, cocona, guanábana, anona, camu camu, y otros más así como los tomates regionales, el culantro y el ají dulce regional. Ella posee un stand en el mercado número 2 de su ciudad, y tiene 42 años trabajando en este mercado. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se puede dar el tiempo de trabajar, divertirse con sus amistades en el mercado y generar ingresos a su hogar, además trabaja con las personas de forma directa y eso le gusta, estar en contacto con la gente, le esta yendo bien ya que tiene sus caseritos a quienes se ganó durante tanto años de trabajo, espera poder seguir trabajando de esta manera en su puesto y tiene como proyecto el de arreglar mejor su casa para poner una quinta y empezar a vivir de las rentas que le produciría. Este será el décimo crédito  con MFP, hasta ahora le esta yendo bien, gracias a los prestamos recibidos anteriormente y por tal espera contar nuevamente con su apoyo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más frutas y verduras para seguir con la venta de su productos y ofrecer mayor variedad de los mismos a sus diferentes y fieles clientes.
texts.en:
Emma is 52 years old. She is a friendly, cheerful and responsible woman who is separated from her husband. However, she is a mother of 2 children. One is 27 years old and independent. The other is 19 years old, living and studying in Lima and still dependent on her. She lives in her own house with her nieces to whom she rents out rooms. Emma works selling regional fruit and vegetables, including coral palm, guavas, peach tomatoes, soursop, custard apple, camu camu and more such as the regional tomatoes, cilantro and sweet chillies. She has a stand at the number 2 city market and she  has been working here for 42 years. 

What she likes about her work is that she can take the time to work, have fun with her friends in the market and generate an income for her household as well as work directly with people and be in touch with them, something she likes doing. She is doing well as she has her customers acquired over so many years of work. She hopes to continue working this way at her stand and has in mind a project to improve her house so as to set up a guest house and start living from the income that that would generate. This will be her 10th loan with MFP. So far she is doing well thanks to the loans received earlier and so she hopes to be able to count on your support again. With the amount requested, she will buy more fruit and vegetables to continue selling her produce and offering a greater variety to her different and loyal customers.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to stock her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has operated her dairy business in Naivasha town for the last two years. She is 38 years old, married to Benson, and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more milk stock for sale.

In the future, Lydia hopes to package her milk and become the largest milk distributor in the Naivasha area.

loans.use: to buy more milk stock

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Sophorn is 28 years old, married and has 1 kid. She has been running a grocery store for more than 2 years. She sells items such as cake, vegetable oil, detergent and beer. She is requesting her first loan with VisionFund to buy stock of groceries for her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her stock and increase the family income. She hopes to set aside some money for future needs and also for her kid.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock for her store

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 55, married, and has four adult children. They live happily in a village and farm for a living. They own and manage 2 hectares of farmland and plant corn and vegetables for sale. Although corn farming is difficult to manage, through patience and hard work they are able to have a plentiful harvest. They have aimed to expand their corn plantation to increase their yields and income to support the education of their youngest children who are now in college.

Due to financial constraints, Evangeline is asking for additional capital of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost required for planting corn. She believes that this loan will help them to work out their plan and they are hoping that they will be having a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and the pay labor cost required for planting corn.

loans.name: Zulfa

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4  filhos dos 3 ja tem os seus lares e 1 ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seu neto que vive com ela.

É negociante dedica-se a venda de roupa usada ha mais de 4 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Já teve emprestimos noutros bancos(GGLS) a bastante tempo e pagou sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 9.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, para o negocio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende melhorar construir um estabelecimento comercial onde possa expor o seu produto, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Zulfa was born in the Boane district, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique.  She is married and has 4 children.  Three of them have their own homes and 1 is still in school.  She attended school through the 4th grade but dropped out due to her parents' financial situation.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports a grandson who lives with her.  

Zulfa is a merchant and has had a business selling used clothes for more than 4 years.  She earns around 6.500.00mt monthly, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).

She has had prior loans in other banks (GGLS) a long time ago and she paid them without any problems.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25.000.00mt, which she plans to use to purchase bundles of clothing to increase her stock.  The prior loans were for 9.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, and 20.000.00mt, all for her business.  She promises to make her payments on schedule.  In the future she plans to build a shop where she can display her products, and for that purpose she intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Chegulo Central Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chegulo Central Group in Western Kenya! Lenah is the facilitator of Chegulo Central group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Lenah takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Lenah had an excellent maize yield harvesting seven bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Lenah was only able to harvest 1 1/2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lenah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Lenah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Chegulo Central group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Madres Ladereñas Group

texts.es:
Amina es clienta de EDAPROSPO por varios años, ella pertenece al grupo “MADRES LADEREÑAS”  lo conforman 09 socias y Amina es una de ellas, sus 2 hijos aun están en edad escolar el negocio que tiene es la venta de diversos productos, ella empezó vendiendo artículos pequeños como zapatillas, ropas y accesorios de belleza, durante todo este tiempo los pedidos fueron en aumento  por la facilidad de pago que les brinda a sus clientes, es así que actualmente puede comprar y vender productos más grandes como bicicletas y algunos artefactos. Vender estos productos a crédito le otorgan mayores ganancias sus clientes son en su mayoría comerciantes que tienen sus propios negocios, gracias a su trabajo puede pagar la universidad de uno de sus hijos y lograr que sea un profesional será su mayor logro, el préstamo de EDAPROSPO le será de gran utilidad para comprar articulos navideños especialmente juguetes debido a la cercanía de las fiestas navideñas será un buen negocio, por otro lado está a punto de comprar un terreno donde construirá su casa y pondrá una tienda para seguir trabajando.

•	La Sra. Amina es la octava viste polo rojo y cartera negra, también aparece una señora como invitada.
texts.en:
Amina has been a client of EDAPROSPO for several years. She is a member of the group “Madres Ladereñas” which consists of nine members. Amina is one of them. Her two children are in school.

Amina has a business selling different products. She began selling small items such as slippers, clothing, and beauty accessories. Throughout the entire she has been in business, her orders have increased because of the payment options she offers to her customers. The products she buys and sells the most are bicycles and a few appliances. Amina sells these products on credit so that she can obtain more profit. Most of her customers are merchants who have their own business. Thanks to her work, Amina is able to pay for the university education of one of her children. Seeing her children become professionals will be her greatest achievement. The loan from EDAPROSPO will be a great help with purchasing goods for the holiday season, especially toys for the approaching Christmas parties. This will turn out to be a good business. At some point, Amina would like to buy a piece of land on which she can build her house and set up a store so that she can continue working.

Sra. Amina is the eighth woman, wearing a red polo shirt and holding a black handbag. Also appearing in the photo is another woman who is a guest.

loans.use: to purchase toys and other Christmas goods.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 29 year old and married with one child in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for one year.

Lucia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her child.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 62 years old with four children. She lives in Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. 

Leonila owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of shoe products to earn a living. She's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns 1,200 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

In 2010, Leonila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes for  business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Salomon 2 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is the coordinator of her group named Salomon 2 from the city of Samana's Peninsula, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. 

Francisca is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, a little store where she sells groceries. She will purchase rice, beans, meat, canned food, flour, sugar, and other goods. She will use the profits to provide for her family. She also plans to save to build a local business next to her house, where she can run her grocery store. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, canned food, flour, and other goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes for the shop.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar is a young man, originally from the Agsu district. He opened his business in 2004 and in that year he borrowed $250 from Normicro and used it for establishing his business. Now he wishes to borrow $500 to buy material and sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy material and a sewing machine..

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa is a married mother of four children.  Her main source of income is selling cooked foods, snacks and drinks at a canteen at the local village primary school.  An initial loan helped finance the start-up of this business, and Lisa has found that her canteen is very lucrative.  Her family is very supportive of her efforts and appreciative of the extra income, so she continues to expand her small stand. In order to purchase additional products to sell, she has applied for another small loan to help her expand her product line.

loans.use: Buy ingredients and packaged foods for resale

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en: A 42 year old mother of 3 children, Mrs. Kheng N., lives with her husband in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband run a grocery store in a village and make an average of $7.00/day in revenue. Two of her children work at a nearby beauty salon and one attends school. Kheng N. is currently asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase more grocery products to keep investing in her store, as well as satisfying her clients’ needs. In the future, she hopes to be able to save money to provide her children with a high level of education, as well as keep expanding the business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria, 62, has been separated for 25 years. She says that of her two children, one is deceased and the other, a 33-year old daughter, is a teacher with whom she lives. She makes a living making cigars (that are similar to Cuban cigars), work that she’s been doing since she was 10 years old. She said that she learned the trade from her parents who taught her how to do it. Thanks to the income that she’s made from the production and sale of cigars, she was able to solve the problem of how to educate her daughter who is now a wonderful teacher. She also managed to build her own house and make it comfortable for them. This is a hard-working woman who had to sacrifice a lot when she separated and took on the job of educating her daughter alone.

She needs a loan to buy tobacco in bulk so that she can get discount pricing.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

María tiene 62 años, está separada hace 25 años. Comenta que tuvo dos hijos de los cuales uno falleció y le queda una sola hija de 33 años que es docente y que vive con ella. Se dedica a la fabricación de cigarros (parecidos a los habanos), actividad que lleva a cabo desde los 10 años de edad. Comenta que aprendió el oficio de sus padres que le enseñaron cómo hacerlo. Gracias a los ingresos que obtuvo con la fabricación y venta de dichos cigarros pudo solventar la educación de su única hija quien hoy en día es una flamante docente. También logró construir su casa propia y hacerse de comodidades. Se trata de una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada ya que a raiz de su separación tuvo que hacer frente a la difícil tarea de educar sola a su hija.

Necesita de un préstamo para la compra de fardos de tabaco que consigue a menor precio si compra en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: Buy tobacco at discounted pricing.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat’s husband is in Russia working as seasonal laborer. In the past, he helped Saodat to sell, but once the business stabilized, Saodat’s husband went to Russia. Saodat sells food products, which she buys wholesale on the same market. Before taking her first MicroInvest loan, Saodat’s sales volume was relatively low. The loan helped Saodat to expand her business. This loan she plans to use to continue the expansion.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муж Саодат находится на заработках в России. Раньше он помогал жене в ее торговле, когда бизнес наладился, решил уехать на заработки. Теперь Саодат сама занимается бизнесом. Она продает продукты питания, которые закупает оптом здесь же на рынке. Оборот ее бизнеса вначале был небольшим, и она решила взять займ в Микроинвест. Это послужило толчком для развития. Сейчас она собирается и дальше расширяться и получать новые займы.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Selepa

texts.en: Selepa S. comes from the village of Mulifanua. She is in her thirties and she is still active and hard-working. Selepa has five children and she is supporting them through school. Mulifanua is one of the richest parts of Upolu Island. Families living in this part of the island mostly fish for a living. Selepa’s husband goes fishing six days a week, if the weather is good. This would mean that Selepa can go to the market six days a week to sell the catch along with the crops from her farm. She can usually make 100 Tala (US$ 40) a day at the market. She is looking forward to receiving more loans in the future so she can buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: To buy fishing gear for her husband and supplies for their farm

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.ru:
Gunduz H. was born in 1982 in the village of Padarkishlak, Agsu region. He is single. For three years, Gunduz has been raising cattle. This year, he turned to NorMicro for help to finance expansion of his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гусейнов Гюндуз родился 1982 году в село Падаркышлак Ахсуниского района. Холость . Уже три года подряд занимается скотоводством. В этом году обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал . Гюндуз хочеть расщирять свой бизнес . Семья большая, по этому ему надо помочь.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of animals

loans.name: Mirela

texts.en:
Mirela is a 31-year-old woman and she lives in a village near the town of Kovači. Her husband is self-employed in construction. His monthly income is about US$ 300, when weather permits. When her husband does not have seasonal construction work, they are busy with agricultural work. They have a 5-year-old daughter.

Mirela is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 450 at MCO WWI and her intention is to buy seeds for their greenhouse. She wants to secure a safe future for her child.

loans.use: Buying seeds for her greenhouse

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene, Juana, and Nicolasa are members of the “Virgen del Carmen” community bank. Irene has been a member for ten years, while Juana and Nicolasa joined three years ago. They are all from the district of Pacaycasa, which is 30 minutes outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. In the community bank, they have learned to be responsible, to take care of their children, and learned how to manage their businesses.

Irene is 50 years old and has four children. She makes bricks in the fields that she owns. She uses general laborers to help her make the bricks. She then sells the bricks to people who fire them. In addition, on Sundays, Irene sells popular local foods and soft drinks from her home, which is located close to the local stadium.

Juana is 63 years old. She has eight children, one of whom still lives with her. Juana raises pigs and sells their meat. On Sundays, she travels to the market in the town of Huanta, where she buys pigs to fatten in her yard. She sells her meat in the district of Quinua. In addition, seasonally, Juana sells tara, which is a local tree used to make industrial products. She also sells soft drinks from her home.

Nicolasa is 55 years old. She has three children, one of whom is still living with her. Nicolasa buys pigs from different towns. She later butchers them, and sells the meat in her district, or she transports it to other towns. She also buys guinea pigs, which are eaten in Peru, and sells them to restaurants in the town of Conchopata.

Irene, Juana, and Nicolasa need loans of 300, 300, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy pigs and guinea pigs, and to pay their laborers.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Irene, Juana, and Nicolasa plan to use their savings to pay for any unexpected costs, old age, and to make home repairs. Their dreams are that their children will have better lives and be professionals, to have bigger businesses, and to start raising cattle.

loans.use: Irene, Juana, and Nicolasa need loans of 300, 300, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy pigs and guinea pigs, and to pay their laborers.

loans.name: Jafar.

texts.ru:
Jafar S. lives in Yavan, Tajikistan. He is 48, married with 10 children. He has no education and no regular job outside his house and raises livestock at home. He usually buys a few young bull-calves, raises them for 40-45 days and then sells them at a fair market price. After selling one or two bull-calves he buys another one or two, starts to raise them, while trying to sell the rest at the local market before they grow too big. This is one of the most popular businesses in the countryside which is especially profitable in spring and summer. Jafar has been doing this for 15 years already. Due to the bad weather this winter his business was slow and he needs a loan to buy one more bull-calf. It would help him to restore the business and to provide the income which his family needs so badly. He is planning to repay the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Саидов Джафар живет в городе Яван . Возраст 48 лет , женат и имеет 10 детей. Образования не имеет. Клиент нигде не работает , но занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их 40-45 дней , а затем продает по более выгодной для него цене с учетом расходов. После того как он продаст одно или двух бычков на их место он покупает новых , начинает их откармливать , а оставшихся бычков выводит на рынок для продажи , пока те еще не подросли до нужного уровня. Этот бизнес самый распространенный в сельской местности , поэтому дает доход, тем более весной и летом. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 15 лет.На данный момент у клиента уменьшилась оборотная сумма в связи с погодными условиями зимой и ему необходимо пополнить товарооборот. Он хочет купить еще одного бычка. Для этого клиенту нужно получить кредит. Это поможет ему восстановить бизнес и получаемый доход , который так не хватает его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течение 10 месяцев

loans.use: To buy bull-calves

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Sarorn S. is a 64-year-old widow and mother of six living on an island in Cambodia's Mekong River. Five of her children are married, and her youngest son is studying in the capital city of Phnom Penh, about 15 kilometers away. One of her daughters, her son-in-law, and grandson live in her home.

For nearly two decades, Sarorn has earned a living by weaving silk into cloth. In fact, in her living room are three looms: One for her, one for her daughter, and the last for her grandsom. They sells their finished products to a middle man who then sells them in Phnom Penh. To supplement her family's income, Sarorn also tailors as well.

Sarorn is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 U.S. dollars to purchase more silk for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Fabril Group

texts.es:
The Fabril community bank is maD. up of 13 women who have the same goal: to grow. As this is their first lending cycle, they have just begun to establish and improve their micro-enterprise. Ruth is the group’s president and lives near the May 18 neighborhood, where the rest of the women live.

The bank member's names, activities, and years of experience are listed here:

C. M. NEISA - Health Supplements Promotion, 4 years

F. M. ROSA - Bakery, 3 years

F. S. ANA KARINA- Herbalife Promotion, 1 year

J. A. ILARIA - Beauty salon, 15 years

K. D. V. RUTH - Seamstress, 17 years

M. V. ANALIA - Artisan, 2 years

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Mrs. Lia L. is a housewife and her husband is a wood carver. Mr. Reth purchases pieces of wood to carve and earns around $10 per day from the sale of his craft. They live with three children in Orkhcheay Village, Battambang Province. Their first son helps Mr. Reth with his wood carving business. The second is a construction worker.

They are requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more wood to carve. The loan will allow them to expand their business and thereby increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to carve

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa María is 50 years old and married. She completed her secretarial studies and she has two children who no longer depend on her; she lives only with her husband and her mother. Her home is located in the Victor Larco district of the Trujillo province in La Libertad.

She worked for many years as a bank employee, but due to staff cuts she had to leave. At that time, her best option was to start a business. With some capital, she began selling a few products from her home. Currently, she has a well-stocked grocery store which she has successfully built thanks to her effort and dedication for the past 15 years.

She is a member of "The Palm Trees" Communal Bank, where she received her first loan to buy soft drinks to stock her store. With this current loan of $425, which she will repay in six months, she will buy beer to increase her sales. Rosa says that thanks to her business and the loans she has received from her bank she has been able to become more independent and to contribute to her children's education. She dreams of her small business growing each day and eventually turning it into a mini-market.

Translated by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa María está casada, tiene 50 años, estudió secretariado, tiene 02 hijos que ya no dependen D. ella, vive solo con su esposo y su madre. Su casa se ubica en el distrito D. Víctor Larco Provincia D. Trujillo, La Libertad. Trabajó varios años como empleada en un banco pero por reducción D. personal tuvo que salir y en ese momento la mejor opción fue poner un negocio así que empezó con un capital D. S/. 50.00 vendiendo pocos productos en su casa, actualmente, tiene una bodega muy surtida la cual ha logrado construir gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación durante 15 años. Es socia del banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS” en este banco comunal recibió su primer préstamo D. S/.300.00, con este dinero compró gaseosa para surtir más su bodega. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00, que cancelará en un plazo D. 06 meses; comprará cerveza, para incrementar D. esa forma sus ventas. La señora rosa nos cuenta que gracias a su negocio y a los préstamos que recibió en su banco comunal pudo ser una mujer más independiente y pudo colaborar con la educación D. sus hijos. Sueña con crecer cada día como microempresaria y convertir su bodega en un minimarket.

loans.use: To purchase beer in bulk to stock her small store.

loans.name: Salma's Tusongembele Group

texts.en:
Salma is 40 years old. She is married with four children aged between 5 and 16 years old. She started her fish selling business in 2007, putting in 14-hour days at work. She earns a monthly profit of about $25.

Salma wants to use this loan to increase her inventory of fish. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, who have a variety of businesses including selling clothing, eggs and juice.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of fish.

loans.name: Josefa Blasina

texts.es: La señora Blasina O., tiene sesenta años de edad, es casada, madre de once hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad, y en su defecto ellos ya trabajan y le ayudan, la actividad economica de la señora es la comercializacion de productos del hogar relacionados con su pequeña pulperia, teniendo tambien el negocio de la venta y comercializacion de tortillas, actividad con la cual crio a sus hijos, ya que su esposo ha sido albañil y los ingresos del nucleo familiar eran pocos para la cantidad de hijos que procrearon . En la actualidad doña Blasina tiene como meta poder ampliar su negocio y mantener su taller de tortilleria donde sus clientes ya le conocen.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blasina O. is 60 years old, married, and has eleven grown children. Now that they are on their own, they work and help her out. Her business involves the sale of home products, in conjunction with her small grocery store. She also makes and sells tortillas, an activity which helped her support her children as they were growing up. Her husband was in construction and his income was low for the number of children they had and needed to support. Currently, Blasina’s goal is to expand her business and maintain her tortilla workshop where her customers already know her.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es: La señora Maria Nela habita en el barrio Batahola Norte, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 27 años, se encuentra acompañada del señor Daniel Enrique Rodriguez, el se dedica a la supervisión de construcción, tienen un hijo de 7 años. Actualmente la señora Maria Nela se dedica a su negocio que es una pulpería, donde vende al por menor diferentes productos de granos basicos,  tiene 2 años de tener su negocio, donde comenzó con capital  propio y en los  últimos años ha venido trabajando como mucho esfuerzo  para poder   ampliar su negocio, por tanto recurre al micro crédito para solicitar fondos para incrementar su inventario y obtener mayores ventas, ella esta solicitando la cantidad de C$ 6,000 a un plazo de 9 meses para invertirlo en su pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Nela lives in the town of North Batahola, in the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is 27-years old and lives with her companion Mr. Daniel Enrique Rodriguez, who is a construction supervisor. Together they have a 7-year old child. Currently, Mrs. Nela has a business where she sells various basic grains. She has maintained this business for the last 2-years that initially started with equity. In recent years she has been working hard to be able to expand her business and has resorted to applying for a loan to increase her store’s inventory and generate more sales. She requests a loan of $6,000 to be repaid in 9 months for her little shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more inventory products for her store.

loans.name: Mata

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans, Madame N. Mata est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Son activité principale est la vente des légumes et c’est grâce à ces revenus qu’elle arrive à contribuer aux besoins du foyer. Avec une gestion rigoureuse de son activité elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir son étalage en achetant plus de légumes et satisfaire sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Mata N. is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four. Her main work involves selling vegetables, and thanks to the income from it, she manages to help cover household needs. Although managing her business rigorously, she isn't meeting customer demands. To do so, she is requesting financing to expand her display of goods by buying more vegetables. This will enable her to do better providing for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get supplies of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Islomjon

texts.en: N. Islomjon is 30 years old. He is married with 2 children. His wife is a housekeeper and she is taking care of their children. Thus Islomjon is the main bread winner in the family. Islomjon’s children are small now, but already he is working hard to ensure the best future for them. For more than 5 years Islomjon has been baking the national bread “lepeshka”. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes lepeshka and other bread so people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. All the input materials like flour, salt, and yeast is purchased in the local market. Now Islomjon requests 2500 Somoni (750 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing flour, and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. Islomjon deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing flour for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Zahida Abdul Latif Group

texts.en:
Zahida baji is a 40-year-old married lady and resides in a small area called Riwind in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She is an uneducated lady and she doesn’t get hesitate to mention that this is the case because she belongs to a poor family and her parents couldn’t cover her education expenses. She married a man whose name is A. L. who is a driver, driving an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She has six children: four sons and two daughters. Her eldest son also a driver, driving a rented auto-rickshaw. Her others kids are getting education from a school which is located near their house.

Zahida baji is involved in a decorative embroidery business. She makes embroidered dresses and sells them at clothing markets. She gets US$ 3 per dress. She invests the income in a committee and plans to renovate her house when it is her turn to get the amount. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her son.

Zahida baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable-selling business. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy sewing machines for her clothes-sewing business. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy scraps for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San M., 32, and her husband married in 2004 and have one young daughter. She lives with her parents and two nephews and one niece in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

San has been a silk weaver for 5 years. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a driver. He drives a truck to transport goods and fruit for a private company.

This is San’s third loan. This time, she is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Borei

texts.en:
Mrs. Borei K. is a villager in Damnak Sangke village in Kandal province. She is employed in a casino club. Since her workplace is far from their house, she usually pays a lot of money for a motor taxi as transport to work.

Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to reduce her transport expense. Her husband, Mr. Tang Kok Heng, is a soldier. Mrs. Borei K. is a 35-year-old mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Daria

texts.es:
La señora Daría C. D. G. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 D. Julio”, del cercado, en el distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 48 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (tercer grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años, ella se dedica a la artesanía en metal, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. materiales para producir sus productos (carros en miniatura) para las ferias tradicionales D. la región.  
Ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2800.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, el dinero lo invertirá e la compra D. materiales en cantidad (lata, metales, estaño, pasta, etc.) para continuar elaborando sus productos, ya que se acerca la feria D. las “Alasitas” donD. tiene mayor demanda. Su anhelo es comprarse una casa en la ciudad D. Tacna, así como adquirir una movilidad para poder trasladarse juntamente con sus productos a las distintas ferias y fiestas costumbristas.
texts.en:
Daría C. D. G. is a member of the “Unión 28 D. Julio” Communal Bank in the district of Yunguyo, in the province of Yunguyo, in the Puno area. She is 48-years-old, married and has 5 children.
