She completed her elementary school studies up to the third graD.. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years. She works with metal handicrafts. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, a sum that she invested in the purchase of materials to make her products (miniature cars) for the traditional fairs of the area. She is requesting a loan of 2800 nuevos soles, the same amount that she has agreed to repay in 3 monthly installments. She will invest this money in the purchase of a large amount of materials (tin, metals, pewter, polish, etc.) in order to continue working on her products, since the "Alasitas" fair is coming up and her products will be in high demand. Her wish is to buy a house for herself in the city of Tacna as well as a car to be able to carry her products to the various fairs and traditional fiestas.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a large amount of materials, such as tin, metals, pewter, polish, etc.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: El señor José Francisco tiene 33 años de edad, reside en el barrio Enrique Smit, su esposa le tiene dos hijos, de 6 y 10 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de medicina natural, lleva doce años en las ventas, que inicio con fondos propios, todo estos medicamentos los compra en el mercado oriental, los cuales son: zepol, cofal fuerte, panadol, y otros. Con este crédito va a comprar medicina para vender en los departamentos y poder captar clientes. Sus planes es poder crecer en inventario y poder mantener los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Francisco is 33 years old, lives in the Enrique Smit neighborhood, he has two sons with his wife, 6 and 10 years old. His business is the sale of natural remedies. He has been in sales for twelve years. He started his business with his own money. He buys all his remedies at the oriental market, they consist of zepol, cofal fuerte, panadol and others. With the proceeds of this loan he will buy products which he can sell in the departments and attract customers. He plans to grow his inventory and support the education of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various remedies.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a 55-year-old married mother of six. Currently all her children are working. Her husband drives a commercial vehicle and transports passengers to their destination for a fee. 

Comfort is very hard-working and is resourceful for her family. She trades in charcoal and also sells grocery products like biscuits, toffees, evaporated milk, and canned drinks in her neighborhood. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all traditional Ghanaian homes. Comfort obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages in her community and retails them to her customers. 

Comfort wants to use the loan to buy charcoal in bulk and purchase additional grocery products to upgrade her inventory. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings so she can pay for her children's educational fees. Comfort belongs to a village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua’ which literary means "God’s family."

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of charcoal and grocery products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is a petty trader who sells gari, tomatoes, peppers, cassava, groundnuts and maize, etc. in her neighborhood. Gari is produced from milled cassava which is dried and fried and it is one of the local foods that is enjoyed by many Ghanaians, served with cooked beans and palm oil. Elizabeth is 39 years old. She is married with eight children who are currently in school. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of gari, beans, groundnuts and maize to increase her stock of goods for sale. She hopes to raise sufficient income to pay her children’s school fees. Elizabeth is a member of the trust group, Heavens. In this group, members guarantee loans for one another as social collateral, permitting access to loans and providing peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of gari, beans, groundnuts and maize

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine E. is 48 years old and married with eight children. She sells drinks and sachet water, and is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more stock to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda B. is from the village of Zone 1, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Merlinda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of goods in the local community such as pre-packed dairy products, snack foods and candies. She also sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to pay for the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Zone 1, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, cette femme réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’attiégou. Pour aider son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle a commencé depuis 1997, le commerce de céréales. Son ancienneté dans ce commerce fait qu’elle en a la parfaite maîtrise. Une partie de son stock est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 5 sacs d'haricot et divers autres céréales.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of two, this is a woman who resides with her family in the Attiégou district. To help her husband with household expenses, she started a business in grains in 1997. Her seniority in this commerce means she has mastered it. Part of her inventory is exhausted. She wants to stock up again and is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy ten sacks of corn, five sacks of beans, and various other grains.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is 60 years old and she is a widow with 4 children. She is requesting the loan mount of N120,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek P., age 29, is married and has five children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She has been engaged in a business as a vegetable seller, typically earning US$ 4 per day. Her husband’s business is the primary source of income for her family. He is a motor-taxi driver who always provides his transportation services to the people at the local markets and in his village, typically earning US$ 4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a convenient stand at the market, a purchase that she sees as an opportunity to sell her vegetables well and to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: purchasing a stand at the market

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema P. is from the village of Brgy. 3, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 27 years old, married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gema wants to own and operate a business venture in the retail sector, selling everyday products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Gema is just starting this business. As soon as this loan be disbursed, she will then buy stock to sell.

In 2009, Gema joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gema is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gema from HSPFI. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 06 hijos y estudio educación primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de Ccotos.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace muchos años es socia fundadora,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para aumentar a su capital en su negocio de pesca artesanal. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en su negocio de venta de carne de avino en el mercado, también se dedica a la pesca artesanal, ella trabaja por pedidos  para las Islas de Taquile para  los restaurantes.

Su mayor deseo es darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the “San Salvador Luminoso” Village Bank, which is located in the Capachica district, Puno province and department. She is a 38-year-old married mother of six children, who have all completed primary school and live in the Ccotos community.

For many years she has worked as a founding member of the Manuela Ramos movement. Her first loan was 300 soles to increase the capital of her handicraft fish business.

She requests a loan of 3000 soles, which she will invest in her business selling sheep meat in the market, handmade fish, and her work for the Islas de Taquile restaurants.

Her greatest wish is to give an education to her children.

She likes the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of sheep meat

loans.name: Albarka Group

texts.en:
Patrick A. K. (in the middle) is the leader of this group. Patrick has been a businessman for more than 20 years now. He sells palm oil by the gallon. Patrick was born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. He is approximately 56 years old and married to two wives who are businesswomen. He is the father of 15 children, between the ages of 13 and 30 years old.

Patrick A. K., Kadiatu C., Mary P. K., Aminata K. and Marie K. are members of the group Albarka (a Temne word for “thank you”). They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. They have re-paid previous loans successfully. Their previous loan was for Le 1,000,000 each. That loan made a tremendous impact on the lives and businesses of these borrowers. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan and were able to solve many of their problems. Having repaid the last loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan of 1,200,000 each to add to their businesses.

loans.use: To invest in a palm oil business

loans.name: Arinze

texts.en: Arinze N. is 45 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells foodstuffs and drinks and is requesting the loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to Kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita V. is from the village of Upper Loboc. She is 52 years old and married with three infant children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store selling different products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $106 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chasquis Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Empredimiento LAS CHASQUIS trabaja en nuestra Institución desD. el año 1997, es un banco que se caracteriza porque la mayoria D. las socias son antiguas,además en este tiempo han  logrado consolidarse como grupo y establecer lazos D. amistad.  Lidia es una D. las fundadoras y presidenta del Banco, ella se dedica a la panaderia, con el prestamo a logrado poder abastecerse D. los principales insumos para realizar su actividad, logrando comprar por mayor harina, azucar, manteca y levadura, posibilitando D. esta manera que el alza D. precios no la perjudique. La Sra. Lidia se constituye en jefe D. hogar, ya que se encuentra separada D. su esposo, con el aumento y deversificación D. sus productos a logrado mejorar sus ingresos y tambien sus pedidos. Esther vive en una zona popular D. la ciudad D. La Paz, tiene una familia numerosa, la socia es una participante antigua del Banco y actualmente esta como tesorera,la Sra. Calderón se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. pan por su domicilio, con el prestamo a logrado comprar por quintales  harina, esto a posibilitado que pueda aumentar su producción mejorando D. esta forma su calidad D. vida. Daniela es una participante muy joven, pero una D. las fundadoras del grupo actualmente ocupa el cargo D. secretaria, ella trabaja en la venta D. productos D. belleza, con el prestamo a logrado comprar en cantidad y en oferta perfumes, desodorantes,talcos y joyeria, lo que permitirá que pueda ahorrar para seguir estudiando y terminar la Universidad.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank, Las Chasquis, has worked with our institution since 1997. It is a bank characterized by the fact that the majority of its members are old. Additionally, in this time, they have achieved to consolidate themselves as a group and establish bonds of friendship. Lidia is one of the founders and is the president of the bank. She is dedicated to selling bread. With the loan, she has been able to supply herself with the main needs to perform her activity, being able to buy flour, sugar, butter, and yeast, at wholesale, thereby ensuring that rising prices don't damage her. Lidia is head of her household since she is separated from her husband. Through expansion and diversification of her products, she has managed to improve her income and also her orders. Esther lives in a popular area of the city of La Paz. She has a large family. She is an old participant in the bank and currently is the treasurer. Mrs. Calderón is dedicated to making and selling bread from her home. With the loan she can buy flour per hundredweight. This enables her to increase her production thereby improving her quality of life. Daniela is a young participant, but one of the founders of the group. Currently, she occupies the job of secretary. She works selling beauty products. With the loan, she will buy perfumes, deodorants, talcs, and jewelry in bulk and at discount which will allow her to save so she may pursue her education and finish university.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan will serve to purchase merchandise and increase capital.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel T. is 43 years old, married, and has been a resident of the province of Rizal for almost 16 years.  She has 4 children with her loving husband, a 55-year-old electrician named Joel T.. Her eldest child is a college student, the middle two are in high school, and the youngest is in grade school. 

Raquel is in the clothing business and has already had seven loans from ASHI.  All her previous loans have been paid in full and on time, which is why she is now being trusted with a bigger loan. She is asking for PHP 30,000, which she plans to use to expand her business and sell a greater variety of clothing products.  She believes the bigger her business is, the bigger her profit will be.  

All of Raquel’s perseverance and effort is simply designed to give her children the best in their education and future. As a housewife, she also wants to support her husband with all the family expenses, and to contribute toward the building of a more accommodating and comfortable house for their family. These things will all be possible if the proposed loan is granted.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of clothing products to sell

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 40-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children.

Khaled has been working as a builder since 1986. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time.

Khaled is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work as well as having previous experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Igembe Group

texts.en:
Jambo (hello) from Tanzania! Judith M. is 28 years old and married. She and her husband have two daughters aged eight years and six months old. Judith owns a barber shop in the Tegeta community of Dar es Salaam and a beauty salon in Temeke, Dar es Salaam. She opened both of these businesses in 2005 after working for many years as a server at Steers, a local fast food restaurant. She says it was one of her proudest moments to finally be able to open her own business after saving for so long.

Judith received her first loan from Tujijenge in 2008. Since then she has taken four loans and has been able to hire two employees at the barber shop and two more at the salon. She splits her time between the two locations, bringing her six-month-old daughter to work with her and caring for her while carrying out her work duties.

While she was pregnant, Judith was worried about taking loans from Tujijenge because she was not able to work as much. Therefore, she did not receive a loan for the past two loan cycles. Now that she has given birth and is back to a regular work schedule, she is happy and excited to take another loan.

Judith hopes to use this loan to invest in more supplies for her barber shop and salon. She will purchase items such as hair tongs, scissors, combs, brushes, hair weave (hair extensions) and other hair products. She says she hopes to use any extra profits to pay her children's school fees and medical bills. Right now, Judith makes a profit of about 615 US Dollars per month. Her businesses are especially busy on Saturdays and Sundays, or when her customers need their hair done for weddings.

Judith will share this loan with the members of her group, Igembe. In the photo, Judith is sitting third from the left.

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for her barber shop and salon

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely D. J. is currently residing at Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married and the mother of four adult-aged children. To make a living, Ely owns and operates a business that provides motorcycle-for-hire services to local community members. She has been engaged in this kind of business for over seven years and earns approximately PHP 3,000 a month for these activities.

In 2001, Ely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 14,900 from PMPC. Ely is requesting a new loan of PHP 20,000 which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the thirteenth loan taken out by her from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials and accessories for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 41-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ibrahim has been working in construction. He tiles floors. 

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, A. Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Ibrahim has requested a loan. 

When he first started his business, he had to face some competition. Now, Ibrahim is known for his good work, and he is trustworthy. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans to expand his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi, a 50-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their ten children, is a farmer who owns livestock, has milking cows, and buys yogurt and milk. Mahdi has requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase more livestock for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

Mahdi is speciA. in his work due to his honesty, expertise, and cleanliness. His clients are the industries, his friends and neighbors. He decided on this business because of family members. In the future, he plans on expanding his production by having more livestock.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his work.

loans.name: Kori Chuyma Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Kori Chuyma” esta representado por la señora Leidy Aurora y conformado por 11 miembros  muy unidos y responsables. La señora Leydy Aurora es madre D. tres niños, casada, y tiene como actividad comercial la venta D. electrodomésticos y regalos para matrimonio, su esposo se dedica al transporte publico D. pasajeros como chofer D. un mini bus con la expectativa D. comprar uno propio para mejor sus ingresos y la calida D. vida D. su familia. El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. llantas D. auto, comida, tensillos D. cocina, manta, ropa, papa, gaseosa, y al servicio mecánico. En el mercado donD. elaboran sus actividades las señoras, existe bastante competencia sin embargo ellas se valen D. la rapidez que tienen para cambiar y surtir sus mercaderías siempre están D. acuerdo al comportamiento del mercado y D. las exigencias D. la temporada. El destino del crédito es principalmente para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo, para que D. aquí a un futuro no muy lejano puedan tener un puesto fijo y un ingreso permanente .La mayoría D. las socias tienen experiencia crediticia ya que van cursando ya un tercer ciclo dentro D. la institución y saben muy bien como manejar su capital y administrar bien sus fondos.
texts.en:
Leidy Aurora represents the Kori Chuyma group. It is comprised of 11 very united and responsible members. Leidy is married and has three children. She sells electrical domestic appliances and wedding gifts. Her husband works in public transportation and drives a mini bus. He hopes to buy his own in order to improve his income and his family’s quality of life. The rest of the members sell automobile tires, food, kitchen utensils, blankets, clothes, potatoes, soft drinks, and mechanic services. There is plenty of competition in the market where they work. Nonetheless, they rapidly change and stock their merchandise. They are always aligned with market behavior and the seasonal demands. The loan is primarily to increase their work capital. In the near future they want to have a fixed stand and a permanent income. Most of the members have experience with loans because they are now in their third cycle with the institution. They know how to manage their money and administer the funds well.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Los Naranjos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Naranjos lo conforman  Abismael Arsenio M. M., Francisca Teodora Velázquez López y Lino Nemesio Velásquez López. Ellos son provenientes del municipio de Nindiri.

El coordinador del grupo es el señor Abismael Arsenio M. M. una persona trabajadora, humilde, optimista, luchadora y padre excepcional. El acaba de enviudar en este pasado diciembre pero se ha sabido recuperarse de esta pérdida principalmente por dos hermosas razones sus hijas una de cuatro años y otra de tres meses. Además cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de la familia de su esposa.

Este señor de 36 años trabaja  de sol a sol en la alcaldía de Masaya como cobrador y por las tardes a tiende su sastrería con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia. Este desea aumentar sus ganancias y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio con la compra de materia prima como telas, hilos, botones entre otros materiales.

Los otros dos integrantes del grupo son Francisca Teodora Velázquez López de 62 años que desde hace trece años trabaja vendiendo verduras en el M. de Masaya y Lino Nemecio Velásquez López de 41 año quien es vendedor ambulante de verduras en el M. oriental.

Ambos desean invertir su préstamo en la compra de verduras como yuca, chayote, ayote, pipián, zanahoria…etc.
texts.en:
The Los Naranjos group consists of Abismael Arsenio M. M., Francisca Teodora Velázquez López, and Lino Nemesio Velásquez López. They are from the municipality of Nindiri.

The coordinator of the group is Abismael Arsenio M. M., who is hardworking, humble, optimistic, a fighter, and an exceptional father. He just became widowed this past December but he has been able to recover from this loss for two beautiful reasons – his daughters, one of which is 4 years old and the other is 3 months. He also has the unconditional support of his wife’s family.

He is 36 years old and works from sunrise to sunset as a collector in the mayor’s office of Masaya, and in the evenings, he works at his tailor’s shop with the objective of helping his family to succeed. He wants to increase his earnings and continue investing in his business with the purchase of raw material such as fabrics, threads, buttons, and other materials.

The other two group members are Francisca Teodora Velázquez López, who is 62 years old and has been selling vegetables in the Masaya market for the past thirteen years, and Lino Nemecio Velásquez López, who is 41 years old and is a traveling vegetable merchant in the oriental market.

Both want to invest their loan in the purchase of vegetables such as yucca, chayote, ayote, pipián, carrots, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Awa

texts.en:
Awa D. is a 45-year-old married woman who is the mother of eight children. She runs a small grocery store where she sells mainly oil, rice and sugar.

Awa has been a member of the Banc Villageois Thiéckéne for three years and has always paid back her loans on time. She wants to use this loan in equal parts to buy oil, rice and sugar in order to stock up.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice and sugar for her shop.

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam S., 28, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorian temples.

S. sells vegetables at a local market and ice snow filled with sweet syrup at home for an income of about USD 5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day to help cover the family expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to buy a new motorbike for her husband’s business because the old motorbike often needs repairs. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to purchase groceries for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Uafala

texts.en:
Uafala I. is currently in the business of selling beans, pulses, and cassava flour and is requesting a loan to stock maize flour to sell.  Uafala is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store to sell her goods in.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock maize flour to sell

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo  Nueva Esperanza  se conforma  por tres señoras  quienes se dedican  a diferentes negocios  viven en la aldea llamada Vista Hermosa  la señora Carolina T.   tiene su negocio de tortillería y a la vez tiene una venta  de regalos  que se encuentran  ubicados en su domicilio en el tiempo que le queda libre  después  de atender  su tortillería, atiende a sus 3 hijos  que estudian en la  Escuela de la misma aldea ella tiene  10 años  de dedicarse en sus negocios  , Hortencia  T.   se dedica a la venta de ropa típica  desde hace 6 años  la venta lo tiene ubicada en su casa, Angélica T.  tiene una tortillería  y tienda en su domicilio la cual ha trabajado desde hace 15 años ha trabajado muy duro y cuenta que su mamá le ha apoyado y animado para seguir con su negocio.  Cada una de ellas manifiesta que su objetivo es poder invertir en su negocio para que puedan tener todo lo necesario que piden los clientes y que puedan salir adelante con su negocios y con sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) is made up of 3 women who have different businesses. They live in a village called Vista Hermosa. Carolina T. has a tortilla business, and at times also sells gifts from her home in the free time that remains after she attends to her tortilla business. She has 3 children who attend school in the same village. She has had these businesses for 10 years. Hortencia T. has sold traditional Guatemalan clothing from her home for 6 years. Angélica T. has a tortilla business and store in her house, where she has worked very hard for 15 years. She tells us that her mother supported her and motivated her to continue with her business. Each of these women state that their objective is to be able to invest in their businesses so that they can have everything that their customers ask for, and can continue to get ahead with their businesses and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for businesses selling tortillas, gifts, and traditional clothing

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara P. is from the village of D'Ban. She is 50 years old, married and has two adult children. To make a living, Barbara owns & operates a business selling assorted vegetables. Barbara has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Barbara joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Barbara has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional stock. Barbara is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Barbara from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for vegetable vending

loans.name: Burulbu's Group

texts.ru:
Человеческая судьба неповторима и настолько своеобразна, что можно бесконечно поражаться всем неизведанным поворотам, и неожиданным изменениям в жизни, которые заставляют нас принимать ответственные решения и тем самым помогают нам держаться в тонусе. Эти стихийные события и делают нас сильными, укрепляют нашу веру в себя и не дают нам расслабиться. Герои этой истории – люди, которые в самый пик безработицы, экономического спада, и политической нестабильности, целеустремлённо продолжают заниматься своим делом, и шаг за шагом претворяют свои мечты в действительность. Тагайматова Бурулбу – лидер группы. Бурулбу пятьдесят семь лет. Когда в стране повсеместно царила безработица и люди от безысходности начали покидать страну в поисках заработка, Бурулбу предпочла использовать средства, которые у неё имелись, для того, чтобы остаться на плаву. Она ещё с детства знакома с животноводством и решила, что это и есть её формула успеха. Теперь она разводит скот и продаёт молоко. Продажа молока приносит две тысячи восемьсот сомов ежемесячно. У Бурулбу пятеро детей и нехватку в помощи ей не пришлось ощущать. Благодаря совместным усилиям всей семьи, был построен дом. Далее Бурулбу благополучно женила сына. Не все члены вовлечены в животноводство. Разведением скота занимается Бурулбу и её младший сын. Муж Бурулбу работает охранником на стоянке, но в свободное время активно помогает Бурулбу по хозяйству. Один из сыновей работает на сахарном заводе, а две дочери уехали на заработки в Россию. Младший сын работает в водном хозяйстве, и помогает маме ухаживать за скотом.  Бурулбу обратилась за кредитом, так как давно мечтала купить стиральную машину, которая облегчила бы её домашние хлопоты. 

Партнёры Бурулбу по группе:

Суранчиевой Жайнагуль двадцать пять лет. Вместе с мужем Жайнагуль занимается разведением скота и продажей молока. У Жайнагуль одна четырёхлетняя дочь. Жайнагуль надеется получить этот кредит, чтобы купить холодильник, и тогда её молоко не будет пропадать. 

Турдугуловой Атыркуль пятьдесят три года. Она – вдова и мать троих детей и уже воспитывает внуков. Тем не менее, Атыркуль до сих пор занимается животноводством. Она обратилась за кредитом, с целью купить ткани для приготовления приданого дочери.

Алыбаевой Чолпон пятьдесят лет. Чолпон – вдова и мать четверых детей. Она вместе с одним сыном занимается разведением скота. Чолпон намерена использовать кредит для подготовки приданого дочери.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
The human destiny is so unique and original that one can be endlessly amazed at all the uncharted turns and unexpected changes in life that compel us to make responsible decisions and keep us alert. These spontaneous events make us strong, strengthen our belief in ourselves and keep us from becoming lazy. The heroes of this story are people who at the peak of unemployment, economic recession and political instability resolutely continue to do their work and step by step realize their dreams. Burulbu T. is the leader of this group. Burulbu is 57 years old. As the country was suffering from unemployment and hopeless people began to leave the country in search of work, Burulbu preferred to use the funds that she had in order to stay afloat. She has been familiar with livestock husbandry since childhood and decided that this would be her formula for success. Now she breeds cattle and sells milk. The sale of milk brings 2,800 som per month. Burulbu has five children and she never felt a lack of help. Through the joint efforts of the entire family, they built a house. Next, Burulbu successfully married her son. Not all members of the family work with the animals. Burulbu and her youngest son are involved in breeding cattle. Burulbu’s husband works as a security guard at a parking lot; but in his spare time actively helps Burulbu with her work. One of her sons works at a sugar factory, while her two daughters have gone to work in Russia. The youngest son works in water management and helps his mother tend to the animals. Burulbu is requesting the loan to buy a washing machine, which has been her dream for a long time as it would lighten the load of her household chores. Burulbu’s partners in the group: Zhayangul S. is 25 years old. Together with her husband Zhayangul works in animal breeding and sells milk. She has a 4 year old daughter. Zhayangul hopes to get this loan to buy a refrigerator, so her milk will not spoil. Artykul T. is 53 years old. She is a widow and the mother of three children, and she is raising her grandchildren. Nevertheless, Artykul still works in animal husbandry. She is requesting the loan to buy fabric to make a dowry for her daughter. Cholpon A. is 50 years old. She is a widow and mother of four children. Together with her son she is engaged in breeding cattle. Cholpon plans to use the loan to prepare a dowry for her daughter.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Eugenia Aureola

texts.es:
Eugenia Aureola O. G. tiene 31 años.  Es soltera vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia. Tiene 1 hijo, Shirlei. 

Eugenia es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Eugenia se dedica al cultivo de maíz en Chillanes y de arroz en Babahoyo. Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los lugares de Pronaca y vende los productos en Babahoyo en Comercial Chávez.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra insumos para los cultivos de maíz y arroz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener un terreno propio. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta trabajar para tener dinero para el estudio de los hijos.
texts.en:
Eugenia Aureola O. G. is 31 years old, single, and lives in Recinto Delicia in the canton of Chillanes, Bolivar Province. She has one child name Shirlei.

Eugenia is a member of the Communal Bank “El Progreso La Delicia Recinto”, which is in San José del Tambo Parish. The group has 19 members and their community engages in growing cacao and corn.

Eugenia grows corn in Chillanes and rice in Babahoyo. Every month she buys merchandise and farming supplies from various places in Pronaca. She then sells her products in Babhoyo at Comercial Chávez.

Eugenia is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing corn and rice. She views this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to have her own land. The greatest challenge that she faces is the lack of financial resources and time.

She enjoys working in order to have money for her child’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies for growing corn & rice

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 34 years old and married with three children. The first one is 14 years old, the next is 6 years old and the last is 3 years old. Nelly is a businesswoman as is her husband. This family is serious about her daily activities. Nelly owns a small business selling shoes. Nelly employs one person from her community and the hours of her shop are from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except on Saturday. Nelly has one year of experience in her business.

Nelly is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more shoes to sell. This loan will help Nelly satisfy her customers, which is one way to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz R. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 32 years old, married, and has 1 school-aged child. Luz owns and operates a livestock-raising business. She raises pigs. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 7 years.

In 2008, Luz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Luz is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Luz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hermelinda;  La socia tiene 59 años de edad;  ella es soltera  y tiene 3 años; se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y lencería fina, La socia también teje a palitos chompas y chalinas para la venta a pedidos y elabora tortas a pedidos también, Ella  solicita el préstamo para que le sirva de capital de trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de  mercadería para su negocio. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hermalinda belongs to the Virgen de Chapi Communal Bank. It is situated in the Huanchac district, Cusco province and department. Hermalinda age 59, is single and has three children. She sells cosmetics and fine lingerie. She also knits sweaters and scarves to sell buy order, and she makes cakes by order as well. She is requesting a loan to serve as working capital. She will buy more merchandise for her business. She appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo T. is from the village of Biasong. He is 57 years old, widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Alfredo owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Alfredo joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his third from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Alain

texts.en:
Alain P. is from the village of Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 36 years old. Alain is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alain owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Alain has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alain joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alain is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alain from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Iris Yolanda

texts.es:
la señora Iris Yolanda C. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la Aldea El Corinto de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta casada con el sr. Julio Cesar Nuñez. Iris tiene tres años de dedicarse al comercio cuenta con una pulperia y tiene 17 años de vivir en dicha Aldea.
La señora Iris utilizara el credito para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
su meta es poder tener bien acondicionado su negocio y con mucha variedad de productos. 
nos comento que se siente feliz porque siente que su negocio va creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en: Mrs. Iris Yolanda C. is 34 years old and lives in Aldea El Corinto in the city of San Lorenzo. She is married to Mr.Julio Cesar Nuñez. For three years Iris has worked in commerce in a grocery store and has lived in the Aldea village.  Mrs. Iris will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store. Her goal is to have her business well stocked with a wide variety of products. She tells us that she is happy because she feels her business will continue to grow little by little.

loans.use: Purchase soda, salt, rice, beans, cornmeal, eggs, butter, sugar, sauces, spaghetti, matches, candles, and batteries.

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambat N. (pictured above), 37, and her husband, Mr. Soy Sok, are fishermen. They fish from the nearby lake and sell their catch in Prek Phnao market.

The couple has been married since 1987 and have four children--two sons and two daughters. One of them has full-time employment and the other three attend school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Because their children commute to school far away, they have to take motor remorque or motor taxi very often. A remorque is a motorcycle with a trailer on the back. Taking a remorque to school is expensive for the family. 

Hence Sambat is asking for her first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to school

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
C.  Nguyễn Thị (20201030008) is a 26 year-old woman who lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, C. sells metal & metal-related products in the local community.  C.  has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.600.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, C.  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  C.  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  C.  is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  The loan will be C.'s 5th loan from SEDA.  C.  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C.  Nguyễn Thị (20201030008) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, C.  Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm kim loại & có liên quan đến kim loại trong cộng đồng địa phương.  C.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C.  kiếm được khoảng 3.600.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, C.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C.  đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thiết bị & dụng cụ mới để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  C.  dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business

loans.name: Amie

texts.en: Amie P. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Amie owns and operates a bakeshop, baking and selling a variety of staple products (including bread) in the local community. She is also engaged in selling snack foods, canned goods and biscuits. Amie has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Amie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional cooking ingredients and for additional capital. Amie is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Amie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann D. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Tapi, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  meat vending and bakery businesses. Her husband Adilito D., who is 48 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 12 and 20 years old.

 Mary Ann joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 28 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Ann has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 29th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use as additional funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future and her children's education. Mary Ann D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama E. makes a living selling cassava, plantain, vegetables and other food items at a local market. She has four children, is married to a taxi driver and uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills. She will use her loan to buy more food to sell and continue expanding her business. Ama hopes to use the additional profits made possible by this loan to build a shop where she can sell her goods.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Memena's Group

texts.en:
Memena is the group representative of a group of 15 Haitian women called Dios Bendice 3, 4 & 5. She is the mother of five children. She has lived in the same community for many years after immigrating from Haiti 15 years ago. She is excited to do something different with her life and is ready to make a change and better her life with this loan investment.  She will use her share of this loan to improve her charcoal selling business and to expand to selling other miscellaneous products. She said her most difficult challenge has been to study.  That is why she is making an effort to help her children study and to take care of them.

Memena plans to invest in her charcoal sale business, as well as begin selling other miscellaneous products. She will use her business profits to invest in her new activity.  She wants to start working harder toward having a little store. 

Memena's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.   Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and cosmetics products to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mary faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality. During the rainy season, the availability of charcoal is limited. She hopes to purchase a matatu (a motor vehicle) for transportation in the future. With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale and building materials to finish her construction. She decided to work with Yehu because it does not require legal attachments.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale and building materials to finish her construction

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 31 años, es una madre de familia muy responsable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hijo. Desde hace 9 años Betty, esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, en su bodega situado en el ambiente de su casa, además los días viernes y sábados se dedica a trabajar en un spa. Esta muy satisfecha, pues ambas actividades le genera buenas ganancias, además cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su hermana, en la que atiende su bodega cuando ella asiste al spa. Ella trabaja desde muy temprano y para abastecerse con más mercadería su negocio, realiza sus pedidos de los proveedores que acuden a su tienda y a veces lo consigue en el mismo centro comercial de la ciudad, de ese modo apoya a los gastos de su hogar y la educación de su hijo. Por ello tiene pensado para el futuro ampliar e incrementar su bodega, construir su casa, y  brindarle una  profesión a su hijo. Es el 16avo crédito con MFP, demostrando compromiso y liderazgo en su grupo de lo que los integrantes de su asociación, están muy contentos de su gestión. Betty compra mercadería necesaria para su negocio, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos comestibles para abastecer más su bodega.
texts.en: Betty is 31 years old and is a very responsible wife and mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and son. For 9 years, Betty has been working hard by selling groceries from the small shop located in her home. In addition, she works in a spa every Friday and Saturday. She is very satisfied, as both jobs earn her a good living, and she has the unconditional support of her sister, who looks after her shop when she is working at the spa. She works from very early in the morning and, in order to stock her business with more goods, she orders from suppliers who visit her in the shop. Sometimes she even picks up stock from the shopping centre in the city. This is how she covers her household costs and pays for her son's education. For this reason, in the future she intends to expand and increase the size of her shop, build her own house, and enable her son to have a career. It is her 16th loan with MFP, and she has proven her commitment and leadership within her group, so the members of her association are very happy with her management skills. Betty buys the goods she needs for her business, so with the loan she is requesting she will buy grocery products in order to better stock her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery products to stock her shop.

loans.name: Kokoè  Homefa

texts.fr: Dame Homefa est mariée et a un enfant.  Elle est née à Lomé et habite  vakpossito.  Elle  fait le commerce  de friperie  et compte déjà  10 ans dans cette  activité. Elle achète les habits au marché local de hedzranawoé et les  revend  au grand  marché de Lomé en face de la pharmacie  du  grand  marché.   Elle demande un prêt  pour acheter  2 balles d’habits pour  les enfants,  1  balle  d’habit dame  et  1 balle de pantalon.
texts.en: Ms. Homefa is married and has one child. She was born in Lomé, the capital of Togo, and lives in Vakpossito. Her work involves second-hand clothing, and she has ten years of experience in this business. She buys the clothes at the local market in Hedzranawoé and sell them at the main market of Lomé opposite the main market’s pharmacy. She is asking for a loan for buying 2 bales of children’s clothing, 1 bale of women’s clothing, and 1 bale of pants.

loans.use: Buying used clothing

loans.name: Anamile

texts.es: Anamile tiene 23 años, es soltera y vive el lado de sus padres y hermanos en la casa que es de la propiedad de sus padres. Desde hace varios años que tiene su propia fabrica de dulces de chocolates, instalado en su misma casa. Sus padres la apoyan en este negocio, sobre todo cuando es el tiempo de preparación, su trabajo es arduo y de todos los días ya que reparte a las diferentes tiendas de golosinas al por mayor. En su casa se ha convertido en una local de progreso y fuente principal de ingresos, sus deseos de superación la motivan a realizar este negocio, además que le sirve de sustento para cubrir los gastos de la universidad, ya que aún estudia. Se siente muy contenta de ver las ganancias de su creciente negocio que la motivan a seguir adelante, su principal compra es para el abastecimiento de insumos que le servirán para preparar sus golosinas. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta  muy contenta de acceder a una oportunidad de crédito que es muy ventajoso para el desarrollo de su negocio,  promete ser puntual en sus pagos y utilizar enteramente el dinero para mejorar su negocio. Con el crédito, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos al por mayor como cobertura de chocolates y envases al por mayor.
texts.en:
Anamile is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents in their home along with her siblings. For several years, she has made chocolates at home. Her parents help with this business, especially during the time required for preparation. The work is hard and Anamile goes out every day to distribute in bulk to different candy shops. Her home business has become a place for making progress and the main source of income. The desire to succeed motivated her to establish this business and it helps her to cover her university expenses since she is still pursuing her education. Anamile is very happy to see the profits from her growing business which motivates her to continue forward. Her main expenses are the supplies used in preparing her sweets.

This is her first loan with MFP. Anamile is very happy to access an opportunity for a loan which she sees as advantageous for developing her business. She promises to be prompt with her payments and fully utilize the money to improve her business. The loan will be invested in wholesale supplies, such as melting chocolate and containers.

loans.use: To purchase melting chocolate and packing containers in bulk.

loans.name: Hector Hernán

texts.es:
Desde las 3:00 de la mañana Hector Hernán T. M. y su grupo familiar están en pie para iniciar con la elaboración de la mazamorra, producto típico de Antioquia-Colombia, que se convirtió en la fuente de sustento para esta familia. 

Después de la dispendiosa elaboración de la mazamorra, Héctor sale a ofrecer el producto por las calles de Puerto Berrío donde es conocido por su buena sazón. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones en el lugar de producción.
texts.en: From 3:00 in the morning Hector Hernán T. M. and his family group are up to begin making mazamorra, a traditional product in Antioquia-Colombia. It has become the source of income for this family.  After the laborious production of the mazamorra, Héctor goes out to offer the product in the streets of Puerto Berrío, where he is known for being a good cook. At present, he needs a loan to refurbish the production area.

loans.use: to refurbish a processing area

loans.name: Maria Nelis

texts.es:
María, reside en San Miguel, es soltera, tiene 32 años de edad, vive con sus padres, se dedica a la venta de ropa,  esta mercadería la vende en los pueblos cercanos, trabaja de 8:00am a 4:00pm, todos los días.
Ella necesita de un préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir, ya que este negocio debe tener movimiento en cuando a lo que ofrece, porque las modas cambian y los colores de igual manera, con esta inversión espera satisfacer las demandas de los clientes y contar con su preferencia.
Para el futuro tiene como meta compra su propia casa, instalar su negocio y hacer su propia familia.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old, single, and lives in San Miguel with her parents.  Her business is selling clothes.  She sells her merchandise in neighboring villages.  She works from 8.00am to 4.00pm every day

María needs a loan to buy clothes since this business needs movement in terms of what is sold because fashions and colors change.  With this investment, she hopes to meet her customers' demands and be able to count on their loyalty.

In the future, María's goal is to buy her own home, to set up her business there and to have a family of her own.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción A. Vda. D. P. D. 68 años D. edad vive con su hijo en San Juan Opico en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella posee un taller D. confección D. ropa tiene muchos clientes y la prefieren porque realiza prendas D. muy buena calidad, con mucho estilo y sobre todo a muy buen precio; María a pesar D. ser una persona D. edad avanzada siempre esta activa y a disposición D. las personas que la visitan, además sus clientes la admiran porque siempre está D. buen humor y vive cada día plenamente, María quiere mantener su negocio y por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más telas D. diferente estilo para seguir produciendo y seguir vendiendo a las personas que la visitan. Con esto María tiene confianza que podrá seguir sustentando sus necesidades y podrá seguir teniendo una vida plena.
texts.en:
María Concepción A. Vda. D. P., 68 years old, lives with her son in San Juan Opico in the department of La Libertad. She has a workshop where she makes clothes, and has many customers who prefer her because she does work of very good quality, with a lot of style, and above all at a good price. Maria, in spite of being of advanced age, is always active and at the disposal of those who visit her. Her customers also admire her because she is always in good humor and lives every day to the fullest.

Maria wants to maintain her business and for this reason has asked INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy more fabrics of different styles to continue producing and selling to those who visit her. With this loan, Maria is confident that she will be able to continue to meet her needs and have a full life.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Twezimbe Development Kasenge-Kampala Group

texts.en: Clothing sales is 36-year-old N. Sarah's enterprise. It has been her source of livelihood for the last three years. The hardworking, courteous and good-natured mother of six began this enterprise under the financial auspices of her husband. Prior to that, she was a housewife. Weekly, Sarah says her profits amount to approximately $42, and she says that with this loan, she is going to purchase more bales of clothing to resell. In the group photo, Sarah's face is only partially seen, as another client unwittingly covered part of her face. For that reason I have marked her as unpictured.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 90 kilograms of Irish potatoes and ice cream ingredients.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: La señora Segundina es comerciante en el mercado de la zona desde hace dos años, se dedica a la venta de ropa de niño en mayor parte,  no cuenta con puesto fijo lo que le dificulta tener mayor venta de sus productos, vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus padres con sus nietos a quienes tiene que cuidar ya que los padres de los niños se fueron al exterior a trabajar buscando un mejor futuro, solicita el crédito para la compra de mas mercadería ropa por docena para esta temporada de invierno como chompas y chamarras, es una persona muy amable y trabajadora su deseo es mejorar sus ingresos y así crecer en su negocio, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Segundina has been selling goods in her local market for two years.  She mainly sells children's clothes.  She does not have a fixed sales location which makes it difficult for her to sell more products.  She lives in a house belonging to her parents together with her grandchildren who she has to look after because their parents went abroad to work, in search of a better future.  She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise (clothes in bulk) for this winter season such as sweaters and jackets.

Segundina is a very kind and hard-working person and her wish is to improve her income and grow in her business.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (winter clothes)

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 55 years old and she lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Luzviminda has a shop that sells native delicacy snacks like ensaymada & botche. She has had this business for 31 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients in making native delicacy snacks.

Luzviminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Luzviminda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making native delicacy snacks.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren is a 33-year-old divorcee, and she lives with her son and mother in her own private fenced house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a woman who works hard for her family. Since 2001, she has been selling different kinds of clothes including outerwear, like kids' coats. Sometimes she sews them herself at home. Also, she grows cash crops on her place. 

She has the desire to expand her own business and then provide higher education to her son. The loan she is taking will be used to buy some new commodities for her business and to complete her house repairs.

loans.use: To buy some new commodities for her business and to complete her house repairs.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad de 54 años, está casado y vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposa. El pretende con el crédito comprar los insumos necesarios para una excelente producción de café este año el cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo, el consta de una gran área sembrada y tiene que darle la asistencia necesaria para su buena cosecha. El pretende con estas mejoras generar las ganancias necesarias para seguir adelante con su familia y cumplir sus proyectos como un caficultor de la zona. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
54-year old Gerardo is married and lives with his wife and their five children. With the loan he plans to buy the supplies necessary to have an excellent coffee crop this year. He has good land for growing coffee and says that he’s planted a big area. Now he needs some assistance in order to get a good harvest.

With these improvements he will have a greater income and be better able to provide the necessities for his family as a successful coffee farmer. This is his first loan with Kiva partner FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with better repayment options and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his coffee fields

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 24 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is only 7 years old. Angelita is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She grows rice and vegetables to sell. Angelita also buys vegetables from other farmers. She goes to nearby towns to sell her products. Angelita works hard to support her family.

Angelita has requested a loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. She hopes to be able to save for her children's education. She also hopes to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es: Este banco comunal se llama "Rosa De Saron". El banco está conformado por 11 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo. La señora Emperatriz es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 45 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos omnilife que inicio hace 1 año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar materia como suplementos nutricionales, malteadas con proteínas, limpiadores, energéticos y regeneradores y así ofrecer a sus clientes. Además sus otros compañero que también necesitan financiamiento para sus productos como venta de tortillas, crianza de gallinas, venta de ornado, crianza de gallinas, venta de ropa nueva, venta de helados, venta de ornados,  pulpería, crianza de gallina y pulpería. Todos tienen el mismo empeño y ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Rosa de Saron” (Rose of Sharon) and it has 11 members.  This is their first loan request.  

Emperatriz, 45, is the group President.  She sells Omnilife products; she started a year ago.  She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise like nutritional supplements, protein shakes, cleansers, energizers and regenerators to have available for her customers.

Besides, her other group companions  also need financing for their products like tortilla sales, raising chickens, roasted pork sales, chicken raising, new clothing sales, ice-cream sales, roasted pork sales, grocery store, chicken sales and grocery store.  They all have the same dedication and will to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy Omnilife brand health products.

loans.name: Eva Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Eva es socia del banco comunal Las del Rio, vive por la comunidad de  El Progreso lugar que es de clima frió, cuenta con lindos paisajes naturales, su gente es carismática, alegre y trabajadora, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones, laboran en la agricultura, cría de animales y mucha de su gente laboran en la ciudad en diferentes áreas de trabajo.

Doña Eva tiene 38 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 21, 19, 17 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros trabajan para sus gastos personales, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y su última hija en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es comerciante de ropa, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora Eva se dedica a la atención de su tienda la misma que tiene hace 5 años, trabaja en ella desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. También realiza campeonatos de  indor fútbol.
 
Nuestra socia se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para el negocio de su esposo.
 
Su meta es mejorar su cancha de football.
texts.en:
Eva is a member of the Las del Rio Communal Bank. She lives for the community of El Progreso, with its cold climate, its beautiful natural landscapes, and its charismatic, cheerful, and hardworking people.  They preserve local culture and traditions and work in farming, raising animals, and many work in the city in different fields.
