Eva is 38 years old and married, with four children who are 21, 19, 17, and 11 years old.  Her two eldest children work for their personal expenses, her third son is in high school, and her youngest daughter goes to the local elementary school.  Her husband runs a clothing store and they own the house they live in.

Eva looks after their store, which they have had for five years.  She works there from eight in the morning until eight at night.  She also organizes indoor soccer championships.

Our member is seeking her third loan, which she will use to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing for her husband's business.

Her goal is to improve her football field.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Dorling Andrés

texts.es:
El joven Dorling Andrés es originario del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como maestro de educación primaria en una comarca de dicho municipio con muchos años de experiencia, tiene un hogar conformado por su esposa y un menor, cuenta con su vivienda propia la que ha ido mejorando poco a poco gracias a estos créditos.
Una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos a es adquirir su segundo crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, zinc y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de construir una cocina en su vivienda, para ampliarla y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The young man Dorling Andrés is from the town of El Sauce. He is working as a teacher in a primary school in one of the areas of the town and has had many years of experience. 

He lives with his wife and a young child, in his own house, which he has been improving little by little thanks to these loans. He is asking for this loan to satisfy the need he has right now of buying bricks, cement, and sheet metal roofing materials and to pay to have the work done. 

He is building a kitchen in his home in order to expand it, which will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and sheet metal roofing materials and to pay to have the work done

loans.name: Nhu

texts.en:
Nhu is a 38-year-old married man with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For the past 15 years, Nhu has supported his family by repairing and replacing locks in his local community. Nhu would like to take a loan to invest in his business by buying a greater quantity and variety of locks and new equipment for his business in order to better meet his customers' needs.

Through the loan, he hopes that he will be able to increase his income and set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy new locks and equipment for his lock repairing business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melani, 31 years old, lives with her husband and child in their village and is generating income through her hog-raising business. She also sells feed in their village to earn extra income for daily meals. She aims to save for the future education of her child.

Melanie is now requesting a loan of P13,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy pigs to raise and sell in the future. She believes that the loan will enhance her business, leading to a higher income upon sale of the hogs that will help to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for the season

loans.name: Mbila Plus Group

texts.en:
Bafuleru is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Mbila Plus,” which is composed of 24 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Bafuleru has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2010. She operates a general store to the east of Kinshasa. She works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a larger store in her environment. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that now earns her $10 per day. 

She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying cans, sacks of rice and sugar, and milk, and reselling them at a profit. Bafulero is 46 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children, whose ages vary between 10 and 28 years old. Four of the children attend school.

loans.use: to increase the store’s stock by buying cans, sacks of rice and sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Majengo Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Majengo Group in Western Kenya! Beatrice is the facilitator of the Majengo group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Beatrice takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Beatrice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Majengo group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Beatrice is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie works hard to support her family. Julie is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now, and also earns additional income from manicure/pedicure services.

Julie requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Brijette

texts.en: Brijette is a 52 years old woman. She has a decent pension salary and she owns a kindergarten. She wants to make some necessary repairs to her house such as: painting, changing windows and doors, installing tiles, etc. However, the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the renovations. She needs to take a loan amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When Brijette gets the loan, she will pay to make these necessary repairs to her house and be able to live in better home conditions. Brijette is shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Gameli

texts.fr:
Gaméli est un homme âgé de 27 ans. Il est marié å une coiffeuse. Il n’a pas encore d’enfants. Gaméli travaille comme revendeur de matériels électroniques et de plomberie depuis 2010. Il vend seul et n’a aucune difficulté principale. 
Gaméli a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Il veut investir dans le commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Gaméli voudrait  faire développer son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit améliorer le niveau de vie.
texts.en: Gaméli is a 27 year old man.  He is married to a hairstylist.  He does not have any children as of yet.  Gaméli has worked as an electronic and plumbing equipment retailer since 2010.  He sells by himself and has no major difficulties.  Gaméli has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase more merchandise.  He wants to invest in his business.  Over the next few years, Gaméli wants to his business to develop.  He says that with the profits, he plans to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase electronic and plumbing equipment.

loans.name: Jay Dawn

texts.en:
Jay Dawn is single. Jay Dawn is 27 years old, residing at Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Jay Dawn own and operates a coco farm land, planting & harvesting coconut for sale to earn a living.She has been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 8,500 doing this type of business. Jay dawn is very proficient in handling the business she operates by that the revenue generated is of high-quality. 

She requested a loan of 20,000.00 to purchase coconut fertilizer for the good growth of coconut. Jay Dawn is been a member of GDMPC for 5 year. In the future, plans that the business she handle will grow and progress.

loans.use: To purchase coconut fertilizer for the good growth of coconut

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée.Elle vit avec son mari et ses quatre enfants. Elle tient au marché de sa localité une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires et de consommation courante.Son commerce lui rapporte des bénéfices qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses propres besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants.Elle soutient également son mari dans les autres dépenses d'entretien de la famille. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en cette veille de fête pendant laquelle la demande est très importante, elle sollicite un prêt de 300 000f auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter des sacs de riz, d'oignon, de pomme de terre et de l'huile.Son ambition est d'élargir son commerce.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman. She lives with her husband and her four children. At the market of her region she runs a shop selling regularly used food products. Her business brings her profits that allow her to meet her own needs as well as those of her children. She also supports her husband with the other family expenses. 

To strengthen her business during this pre-holiday season during which demand is significant, she is requesting a loan of 300,000f from UIMCEC in order to buy bags of rice, onions, potatoes and oil. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, onion, potatoes and oil.

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Samon, 42, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been a staffer in the tourism department for over 10 years. Her husband has been involved in agriculture for over 20 years, has extensive experience and is successful in his career. He is involved in growing rice and fishing. 

All of her children are construction workers. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Samon is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to pay for her children's passport fees. By doing so, she will enable her children to legally seek work in Thailand to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to build a warehouse for keeping rice and support her children to study foreign languages.

loans.use: to pay for her children's passport fee to go to find jobs in Thailand.

loans.name: Sandra Norberta

texts.es:
La señora Sandra es  una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como es : tacos dorados , enchiladas rechinas , entomatadas y empanadas.
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos  por quien decidió iniciar su propio negocio  para darles un mejor futuro y vean como se esfuerza para que ellos tengan una mejor vida.
Tambien se dedica a tejer manteles y coortinas  para la venta.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de : chiles verdes , chiles secos, tomate , ajos, cebollas  , quesos y maíz para la elaboración de tortillas.
texts.en:
Señora Sandra is a hard-working woman who sells Mexican snacks such as fried tacos, enchiladas rechinas, entomatados and empanadas [stuffed pastries].  She started her business for her three children so she could give them a better future and so they would see how hard work can give them a better life.  She also weaves tablecloths and curtains to sell. 

She is requesting a loan to buy green chilies, dried chilies, tomatoes, garlic, onions, cheese and corn to make tortillas.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to make her traditional Mexican dishes.

loans.name: Benkadi 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 8 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Djigonso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs  avec  ADIARATOU SIDI , debout au milieu  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Benkadi 8" are married women averaging 35 years of age and five children each all living in traditional families in Djigonso, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with ADIARATOU SIDI, standing in the middle of the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, some seeds, and sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining one hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 150,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en: Residing in Dambae district of Battambang province, Chreb is 35 years old. She struggles for a living via rice cropping on two hectares area. To earn more income, she catches fishes for resale. This is the original loan for Chreb with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her cash crop. She hopes that she can gain a good income better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her cash crop.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 57 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lilia has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock in the business

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en: Gabil now is living in Beylagan town but originally he is from Khojavand region now under occupation of Armenian troops. In 2002 he took out the first loan from Normicro Beylagan branch to start the business of trading vehicle spare parts. For his second loan amounting $900 he has built a small car repair workshop. Now he needs $1200 to buy a new pressure device.

loans.use: To buy a new pressure device

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is a married mother of one child. She was formerly employed at one of the government’s offices, but her entrepreneurial spirit and desire for independence led her to resign from her post and start her own business.

She now runs a small store in front of her house and reports being happier now that she is master of her own financial destiny.

She can earn up to ST 300 - 400 (USD 120 – 160) each week. She is applying for a loan to purchase more inventory to stock her shop.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en: Every day Mrs. X., 28 years old, spends 6 to 7 hours by an oven heated to over 50 degrees Celsius (130 F) to make rice crackers with sesame. Every hour she makes about 100 crackers that are later dried in the sun. Sometimes Mrs. X.'s sister-in-law helps her, so they can make 1,000 crackers a day. Then, she also has some time for her 2 daughters, 4 and 6 years old. Her husband is working as a carpenter. He makes doors, tables and chairs, ordered by his neighbours. Mrs. X. is asking for a loan of US$375 to buy wood and more tools for her husband to help him at his work.

loans.use: Purchase of wood and tools

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Mrs. Gita R., 27 years old, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur.  She lives with her mother, her husband and three children.  Her husband, Jay Kumar R., is a driver for a brick factory, her daughter is in grade 4 and her son is in grade 2.

Her family's condition is not strong enough to fulfill their needs, and she cannot provide better education for their children.

A few months ago, Mrs. R. opened a vegetable shop to earn money.  Now she seeks a loan of $150 to buy vegetables for her shop such as green vegetables, potatoes and others to be able to sell more.  She wants to generate income and change their life style.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her shop

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married 38 year old man with 8 children and one dependent. He has a retail business that sells beans, coffee and maize which he has operated for 15 years. He has been receiving loans for the past 5 years and has had no problem with repayment. 

With his new loan, he plans to add used clothing and poultry to his existing business of produce sales. He is very creative and hardworking. He helps the farmers to get their produce sold locally.

He dreams of one day being able to buy a motorcycle to enable him to reach broader markets and to improve on his income. Currently, he uses a bicycle to get his produce and goods.

loans.use: Emmanuel plans to use his loan to add a line of used clothing and poultry to his business

loans.name: Blanca Asela

texts.es:
Blanca traveled from the city of Veracruz to the city of Reynosa 10 years ago along with her family, looking for a better future. From the time she arrived until 6 years ago, she worked in a maquiladora and due to a tight budget, the business laid her off. She decided to start a business and invest some money in something that would help maintain her children, as she had just gotten divorced. This was how she began to buy merchandise to sell such as toys, plastics for the kitchen, serving trays, talcum powder, among other things. Thus she started her business and began to maintain the house and her three children.

However, she expects that during the Christmas season the number of customers will increase, and for this reason she is requesting a loan of $475, which she will repay over a period of 6 months. She will be able to supply Christmas merchandise, as the season is near, and in this way will continue to keep her business growing. With your help Blanca’s children will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Blanca viajó desde la ciudad de Veracruz a la ciudad de Reynosa hace 10 años junto con su familia buscando un mejor porvenir. Y desde que llegó trabajó en una maquiladora hace seis años, y por falta de presupuesto en la empresa la despidieron y fue entonces donde decidió iniciar un negocio, invertir su dinero en algo que le dejara una ganancia para la manutención de sus hijos ya que se acababa de divorciar. Así fue como comenzó a comprar mercancía como juguetes, plásticos para cocina, charolas, talcos, entre otras cosas, para vender y a partir de esto comenzó su negocio y a sacado para mantener la casa y sus tres hijos.

Sin embargo para la temporada navideña se espera que los clientes vayan aumentando y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá surtir mercancía para la temporada navideña que ya esta cerca y seguir con el crecimiento de su negocio. Con tu ayuda Blanca podrá sacar adelante a sus tres hijos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Jamonoy Tey De Kacoumpa Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of women who would like to make crafts and house wares using local products. We make house wares with materials such as palm tree bark and leaves, with which we make things such as laundry baskets, breadboxes (which we sell in restaurants), mats and other types of baskets. Financing will allow us to buy a large quantity of raw materials and to train young girls in the village in the art of basket making. This will help discourage young people from fleeing to the city. It will also allow us to make brooms, which we sell in big cities in Senegal. This will be our group’s second loan, but this time it will be for a limited amount so that we will be able to create a sustainable business.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous sommes un groupe de femmes qui voudrais confectionner des objets d'art et d'ustensiles de maison
avec des produits locaux. Notre travail consiste à fabriquer des ustensiles de maison avec des matériaux comme le rônier et les feuilles de palmier avec lesquels nous fabricons des paniers à linge ou de rangement des paniers à pain que nous vendons dans des restaurants, des nattes et autres objets de vannerie. Le financement nous permettra de pouvoir acheter la matière première en quantité suffisante et nous permettra ainsi de pouvoir former des jeunes filles du village au métier de vannerie, contribuant ainsi à la lutte contre l'immigration des jeunes vers les villes. Cela nous permettra aussi de fabriquer des balais que nous vendons dans les grandes villes du Sénégal. Ce sera le deuxième prêt que notre groupe va recevoir, mais cette fois ci ce sera un nombre très limité, afin que le financement puisse nous permettre de créer une entreprise durable.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make crafts

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en: Ms. Zarifa is  a resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with the family of her husband. She, along with  her mother-in-law (who is pictured), breeds cattle in her yard. They have been engaged in this business since 1991 and are now quite experienced.  Zarifa raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. Cattle breeding is a tradition in this region, and is often the only source of income. It can bring a good income. Zarifa wants to develop this business,by buying five more calves to add to their livestock.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married with two sons, ages 13 and 4. His elderly mother also lives with him and his family in Simferopol, Southern Ukraine.

Andrei owns a rapidly growing business selling the “Dr. Nona” brand of natural cosmetics and food supplements in the central city market. He has been in business for three years and has proven to be a very sharp business owner. In those three years, his business has expanded a lot. Presently, Andrei has about $3000 in merchandise. His monthly income is about $550. There is not much competition for Andrei’s products, because they are unique and characterized by very high quality.

Andrei has requested a loan of $500 to help him purchase additional merchandise for retail sale. He would like to use the additional financial assistance to grow his business even further. Andrei loves what he is doing, and is looking forward to the future. He is grateful for the opportunity this business has given to provide for his business and sustain his family of five. We believe Andrei’s natural liveliness and optimism, along with his responsibility and serious business approach, will help him make his dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim L., 40, and her husband, Sophorn Mean, married in 1988. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. All of their children are in school. The family lives across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Lim is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her neighbor and started silk production in 2003. She sells her finished products in her village. Her husband is a wooden house repairer.

Mrs. Lim is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $100 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Rany

texts.en:
Rany D., 33, lives on an island on the Mekong River in Cambodia. Her home, which she lives in with her mother, is about 15 kilometers from the capital city of Phnom Penh. Since she was 17, Rany has woven silk into cloth. She sells her products to someone in her village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh.

Rany is requesting a loan of $100 U.S. dollars to purchase more silk material to weave.

loans.use: To purchase silk to weave into cloth

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a young woman who lives with her family in her relatives' house in a single room. She sells American clothing at various markets in the Southern region of el Alto. She supports two children her need her care and attention. They are both in school and it is clear that she very much hopes to help her children succeed and thus give them a better way of life. This is her second individual loan and she has an excellent loan history.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Es una persona joven, ella y su familia viven en la casa de sus familiares en un solo cuarto, la cliente se dedica a la venta de ropa americana en las diferentes ferias de la zona sur de el Alto, a su cargo tiene dos niños que requieren de su cuidado y atencion, los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar y en ella se observa que tiene muchos deseos de sacar adelante a estos dos niños y asi darles una mejor forma de vida Actualmente es el segundo credito que solicita de forma individual, teniendo un exelente historial crediticio

loans.use: Increase her capital

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep Y., 64, sells porridge and rice. She has been doing this for the past eight years and earns approximately $5 per day. Her husband, Mr. Hy Chrun, 67, is a retired civil servant. They have three children, one of whom is married, and lives in Kork Khleng Village in the Phnom Penh City. Their two other children are working in a garment factory and they make a combined income of $80 per month. 

Tep Y. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase ingredients and expand her business. She hopes that the loan will empower her to sell more porridge and rice, and thereby increase her family's income. Mrs. Y.'s husband is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and expand her business

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza is married and has 2 daughters, aged 17and 10. She is a hardworking person who learned the art of hair styling when she worked as an assistant in a beauty salon. Little by little she observed how the stylists created different hair colors and styles, and in the afternoons she studied at a beauty school in order to earn her diploma. As time went by, Lorenza gained confidence and experience and finally she decided to open her own salon. She fitted out a part of her home for the shop and little by little she earned clients and credibility and now she enjoys a good reputation.

She needs a loan for $350, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy the sink and chairs that will give her salon better client service and a better image. With your support she will move her business ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Lorenza es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 17 y 10 años, es una persona trabajadora que aprendió el arte del Corte de cabello al trabajar como ayudante en una estética, poco a poco fue observando como se hacia los diferentes tintes y peinados y en por las tardes acudía a una academia de belleza para tener un diploma, con el paso del tiempo adquirió seguridad y experiencia y decidió abrir su propia estética, para lo que acondiciono un área dentro de su domicilio, poco a poco acredito el lugar y hoy día goza de buena reputación.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un lavabo y sillas que requiere la estética para un mejor servicio e imagen. Con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: To buy a sink and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Kitimbwa Group

texts.en:
Sarah B. is the leader of her subgroup of the Kitimbwa mixed group in Kayunga. She is a single mother with 3 kids; 1 is 9 years old and the other 2 are 18-month-old twins. Sarah's story is a sad one: she was abandoned by her husband while she was on the ropes, after she developed a mental illness as a result of trouble with her co-wife, with whom the husband stays now. Her sister helped to care for her in that state, and worst of all, she was in the final stages of her pregnancy, which no one knew was twins.

With constant medication using native medicine, Sarah was able to recover slowly only to be told by people that she had 3-month-old twins. She thought of what to do but had no money to do anything at the moment, but since she had worked in the salon during those happy days with her husband, she couldn't settle for anything else.

Sarah started her salon with $100 from her only sister, and once she was set, she was introduced to the Kitimbwa mixed group that has surely given her a rebirth. She is now able to buy braids for plaiting her customers' hair, who like the way she twists their hair. She has a dream of enlarging her salon so that she is able to lay a strong foundation for her children, whose father has publicly abandoned them. She is a strong woman with a drive to succeed.

Sarah needs a loan to help her buy more braids, weaves, and chemicals for treating her customers' hair. Surely I was driven to visit Sarah in her salon, which is not very far away from where her group meets every Thursday. She now wants to restock her salon by buying braids, weaves, chemicals and lotions so that she can save and buy a drier in future.

loans.use: Sarah needs to restock her salon by buying braids, weaves, chemicals, and lotions.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Agée de 28 ans, madame Enyonam A. vit  à Lomé avec son mari. Revendeuse de charbon de bois  et mère d’un (01) enfant. Agent commercial, son mari s’en sort difficilement car il n’arrive pas à trouver un emploi stable. Et c’est grâce à son petit commerce de charbon de bois  que madame Enyonam A.  arrive à subvenir à quelques besoins urgents de la famille. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter la quantité de son stock et en les revendant en détails qu’elle puisse réaliser d’important bénéfice pour pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Enyonam A., 28, lives in Lomé with her husband. She sells charcoal and is the mother of one child. Her husband, a commercial agent, is having a hard time because he hasn't managed to find a steady job. And so it is thanks to her little charcoal business that Mrs. Enyonam A. manages to provide for the most urgent needs of the family. She is requesting this loan to increase her inventory which she sells retail so that she can make more profit and satisfy the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of charcoal

loans.name: Julia Estela

texts.es:
Habiendo vuelto al negocio de la venta de ropa por catálogo hace un año, la señora Julia, de 33 años, se dedicaba a la venta de zapatos pero, al ser muy caros los precios para el público, decidió dejarlo y enrumbarse hacia la venta de ropa, rubro en el que le va bien pero es consciente de que pudiera irle mucho mejor en caso de contar con más capital para la compra de la mercadería. la señora Julia sueña algún día con poder volver al negocio de zapatos para lo cual asegura contar ya con la adecuada cartera de clientes, consiguiendo así mucho más ingresos y, por ende, elevar su nivel de calidad de vida junto con su menor hijo y esposo.

Es por ello que requiere de un préstamo de 700 soles y poder comprar mercadería necesaria para la próxima temporada de estos meses y  emprender de ahora en adelante su vida, llena de juventud y ganas de crecer.
texts.en:
Having returned to the business of selling catalog clothing a year ago, Señora Julia, 33, used to sell shoes but, because the retail prices are very dear, she decided to change to selling clothing. This line is going well for her, but she is aware that it would go much better if she had more capital to buy merchandise. Señora Julia dreams of one day being able to return to the shoe business when she is sure of the adequate finances of her clients, with the much greater income that would result in raising her level of quality of life with her minor son and her husband. This is why she needs this loan of $250, to be able to buy the merchandise necessary for the next season, starting now to get ahead in life, full of youth and the desire to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the future Christmas and summer seasons

loans.name: Mansa

texts.fr: Mansa K. est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2001 au grand marché de Kpalimé, une ville à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit, le quatrième à FECECAV accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant des pagnes de différentes gammes. Cette chance lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et par conséquent ses profits, source d’amélioration des conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mansa K. is 54 years old, married, and the mother of five. She has been a retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) since 2001 at the grand marketplace of Kpalimé, a city about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She wishes to use this loan, her fourth one with FECECAV, to expand her commerce by buying different ranges of pagnes. This chance will allow her to increase her turnover and consequently her profit, out of which living conditions improve.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes for resale

loans.name: Ruth Kato Group

texts.en:
K. Ruth is 43 years old and married with 6 children, all school-going. She has a retail business of selling produce that she harvests from her farm as well as buying from fellow farmers in instances where she does not have enough for her customers. As a result, Ruth has been able to pay school fees for her children as well as improve her home by buying household items. Plus she buys animals that she keeps at her home basically for sale when they are mature. Ruth seeks a loan to be able to buy more produce for sale. 

She is a member of the Kwewayo Namukozi lending group in Mityana, and they are applying for a group loan. The other women will use the loan for similar purposes.

loans.use: Ruth seeks a loan to be able to buy more produce for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret E. is 44 years old and married with 7 children. She sells plantain in wholesale and retail to her customers. She plans to expand her plantain business so she can make more profit. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 to purchase more plantain to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more plantain to sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao P., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Lyna Eng, 30, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom P., married in 2003 and have one young daughter.

Mao has been a construction worker for three years; it’s a skill he learned from his brother. Besides construction work, he does farming as well. His wife has been a farmer for two years. They grow vegetables and other crops in their farmland in the village. Mao is requesting his first loan of US$ 500 to purchase a water pump for his farming.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Flara

texts.en:
Flara S. is currently in the business of selling books in the bookshop and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Flara is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has one child, and her child goes to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, vive en el Jr. San Martín Nº 657, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y es madre 3 hijos, que ya no dependen de ella

Se inicio, con S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia, quien empezó vendiendo anticuchos en la esquina de su casa. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio de venta de anticuchos por la noches y durante el día , se dedica a la venta de comidas preparadas, ubicada en su propia casa, donde atiende a sus pensionistas como familiares, docentes, y trabajadores de ESSalud.

Con el préstamo de S/1,500.00 que cancelara a plazo de 6 meses, desea invertirlo, implementando su negocio, comprando mesas, sillas, platos, vasos,  vajillas y ollas y así dar una mejor atención y comodidad a sus clientes.

En lo personal, se siente más independiente y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y sabe tomar sus propias decisiones.

Isabel, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Isabel T. V. belongs to the "Women in Action" Communal Bank and lives in the Pillory district of the Department of San Martin. She is a single 41-year-old mother of three independent children. She took the initiative to start her business with $95 of her own when she began selling skewered meat (anticuchos) at the corner by her house. She has been working with the bank for eight years. Currently she continues with the same business of selling skewered meat at night and during the day, she sells prepared food. The business is located in her home, where she attends to retirees as if they were family, as well as to teachers and workers from “ESSalud.” The loan of $475 will be repaid in 6 months. She will invest the funds in her business, buying tables, chairs, dishes, glasses, and pots and thus be able to provide more comfort and better attention to her customers. On a personal level, Isabel feels more independent and responsible for the payment of her loan, and she knows how to make her own decisions. Isabel is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, dishes, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Lourdelyn

texts.en:
Lourdelyn D. specializes in manicure and pedicure treatment. She took a thorough seminar on this work and is now serving the entire community, especially wives wishing to have their nails polished and cleaned. Lourdelyn, the 35-year-old mother of three children, is married to Cuneberto, a farmer. They have worked together to endure the global crisis that has created instability in businesses such as hers.

Lourdelyn is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI to buy new sets of materials for her pedicure/manicure business. The loan will help her gain more customers and earn a larger income.

CEVI is helping people to start and maintain their own businesses. They also provide credit, training and insurance coverage services to help clients achieve business growth.

loans.use: To purchase sets of materials for her manicure/pedicure business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica acaba de cumplir 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Tras haber concluido sus estudios superiores como profesora, ha implementado una bodega en la casa de su madre porque dice gustarle mucho estar en constante comunicación con la gente, además que tiene un buen beneficio económico. Años atrás, mientras estudiaba, vendía cosméticos a todas sus amigas, y este dinero que le sirvió para cubrir los gastos que requería su carrera, por ello que Mónica aprendió a generarse sus propios recursos. Ahora, mientras realiza su proyecto de tesis, a la par se ocupa de su negocio, con el cual podrá cubrir los gastos que vaya requerir para la obtención de su título profesional. El espacio donde puso su negocio, años atrás su madre tenía una bodega similar pero fracasó, Mónica no espera tener el mismo resultado, pues quiere convertir su tienda en un negocio rentable y sostenible, ya que también quiere que se convierta en la principal fuente de ingresos de su casa, para que su madre deje de  trabajar como empleada del hogar. Por tal iniciativa su madre se encuentra muy contenta y orgullosa de su hija. Este es el primer préstamo de Mónica con MFP, acaba de integrar un grupo de solidaridad, donde se compromete en pagar cada una de las cuotas en las fechas señaladas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará bebidas gaseosas y golosinas para la bodega que acaba de emprender
texts.en:
Monica has just turned 22 years old, she is single and lives at home with her parents. Having completed her post-secondary studies in teaching, she has set up a convenience store in the house because she says she loves with in constant communication with people, and it is of great financial benefit. Years ago while she was studying, she sold cosmetics to her friends, and that money helped her to cover the costs of her schooling. This is how Monica learned to generate her own resources. Today, while she is working on her thesis project, she is still running the business which will help her cover her costs while she acquires her professional designation. Where her store is now located her mother years ago set up a similar store but it failed. Monica does not foresee the same outcome, because she wants to convert the business into a very successful and sustainable one. She also wants to make this the principal source of income for the household so that her mother can retire from being the family breadwinner. For her great initiative, her mother is very happy and proud of her. This is the first loan for Monica through the MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has joined the group and she has compromised to pay the dues on the dates indicated. With the funds she will purchase soft drinks and snacks for the convenience store she has started.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. LUCILA, ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 55 años, es casada  y tiene 3 hijos, la menor tiene 19 años, y juntas trabajan en su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, en ella vende diferentes productos como los que son (arroz, azúcar, fideos, galletas, leche, aceite, harinas, entre otros). L a socia requiere l préstamo para poder así implementar su pequeña tienda y tener mayor rentabilidad.

Nuestra socia se muestra sumamente contenta por el apoyo y préstamo otorgado, agradeciendo la oportunidad prestada se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos en los plazos dispuestos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila lives 30 minutes away from the city of Cuzco in the San Jeronimo district.

Mrs. Lucila is 55 years old and married. She has three children, the youngest of whom is 19, and together they work from home at the family business. She owns a grocery story, selling various products, including rice, sugar, pasta, cookies, milk, oil, and flour. Mrs. Lucila needs a loan to run her store and to improve her profitability.

Extremely grateful for this opportunity and pleased with the loan awarded to her, Mrs. Lucila agrees to repay her loan in the agreed-upon period.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Saúl

texts.es: Saúl es un joven soltero de 27 años, que apoya en los trabajos agrícolas a sus padres para brindarles comodidades a sus hermanas menores, quienes viven juntamente con él, en la casa de sus padres. Por más de 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, durante este tiempo aprendió a tener dominio y conocimiento de la tierra, se levanta muy temprano, para que a las 8.00am ya esté trabajando en la chacra. A Saúl le gusta su labor porque depende de la atención que le ponga a sus plantas, serán sus cosechas, y en todos estos años le han generado muy buenas ganancias. Por ello le dedica toda su atención, para que produzcan en cantidad y productos de gran tamaño, pero pese a eso, en algunas oportunidades a pesar de ser abonadas y fumigadas no le han dado buenos resultados, y en otras ha obtenido grandes ganancias. Ahora, Saúl ha tenido una excelente cosecha de papa, y ha acumulado varios sacos de ella en su depósito, de donde de poco a poco las va comercializando, y antes que las termine de enviar al mercado, quiso posar allí para la foto. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, durante los préstamos anteriores no tuvo dificultades de pago, y espera seguir manteniéndose con ese record, él es un cliente muy jovial, y en sus conversaciones siempre aflora su picardía innata, lo que es muy apreciado por sus compañeros del banco comunal al que pertenece. Saúl planea invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para realizar el abonado de sus próximos cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Saul is a young man of 27 years, he is single and he helps his parents with their agricultural work to provide his younger sisters with what they need. They all live together in their parents' house. For more than 10 years he has worked as an agriculturer and during this time he has learned how to manage the fields and all there is to know. His day starts very early - by the time it's 8 a.m. he is already in the fields. Saul loves his work because he can see his efforts in his plants that will eventually be the harvest. Every year he has gotten very good yield and earnings. That's why he spends all of his efforts there, to produce large quantities of harvest. Sometimes his harvest suffers despite the use of fertilizers and pesticides, while other times he has enjoyed large harvests. Saul has an excellent harvest of potatoes and he has already gathered up many sacks full in his storage. Slowly he sells them, but before he shipped them all out to the market he decided to pose for the photo. This is his third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). In the past loans he has not had any trouble paying them back and he hopes to keep up his record. He is a very happy client and his conversation always reveals his innate sense of joy, something that is very much appreciated by his colleagues in the community bank. Saul plans on investing the requsted funds in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for future potato plantations.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi A. est un exploitant de carrière de sable dans les banlieues de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 45 ans, Kossi est marié et père de 4 enfants. il souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son activité en achetant des outils de travail et aussi engager des ouvriers. Kossi compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi A.’s business is the exploitation and development of sand (quarrying) in the suburbs of Lomé, the capital city of Togo. At 45 years old, Kossi is married and the father of 4 children. With his credit, he wishes to increase the capacity of his business by purchasing some work tools and also hiring some workers. Kossi is counting on this chance to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Laura Buhler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing work tools and also hiring some workers

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica M. is a budding entrepreneur who owns a small store specializing in veterinary sales. She sells all things associated with animals, such as food, medicine, antibiotics, and hygiene products. With her Kiva loan, Veronica plans to expand her inventory in all that she sells.

Veronica is a single mother with a sixteen-year-old son. Her son is an excellent student who divides his time between studying and helping his mother run her store. Veronica has dreams of her son attending college in the future and, with the loan, she hopes she will be able to earn enough money to allow her son to concentrate more on his studies and less on working with his mother.

Veronica loves animals, and her store provides services for all animals, big and small. There are an abundance of animals near her home and that is one of the reasons she is requesting a loan. She believes the market for her products is untapped and she can only be successful.

loans.use: To purchase shampoo, medications, antibiotics, food, and other items for veterinary sales

loans.name: Uyên's Group

texts.en:
Uyên T. N. has a store at home selling cakes, sweets, Coca Cola, fruit, etc., and she breeds a pig. She was born in 1966 and lives in Dong Dau, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and two children. Her husband is a driver. Her two children are small. They have been in business for over five years and earn approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5.450.000 VND (or ~300 USD) which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

Uyên T. N. is the group leader of this five member group sharing a loan offered by SEDA. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. No.010103040043.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

Huế Thị N. was born in 1977. She has two children. She is a teacher. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND (or ~300 USD) to breed pigs and poultry. No. 010103040045.

Doan T. T. N. was born in 1980. She has just married. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND (or ~300 USD) to buy goods for her store. No. 010103040046.

Chất Thị N. was born in 1960. She has one child. She wants to borrow 4.570.000 VND (or ~250 USD) to buy feed for chickens. No. 010103040052.

Hồng Thị Thuý N. was born in 1973. She has two children. She has a restaurant serving rice, noodle soup, etc. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND (or ~300 USD) to invest in her restaurant. No. 010103040049.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Нисолат

texts.ru: Махкамова Нисолат, женщина торгует женской одеждой на Джума и Якшанбе базарах. Товар она закупает в городе Бишкек. Когда Нисолат ездит за товаром в Бишкек ей в бизнесе помогает ее дочка. Она продолжает кредитоваться в нашей организации МЗФ Микроинвест. Ей нравится условия нашей организации. В период кредитования она увеличила свой товарооборот и улучшила финансовое положении семьи.На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить летние и осенние платья.

loans.use: На закупку летних платьев.

loans.name: Kuru Momoh Ii Group

texts.en:
These women are Mamusu M., Kadiatu K., Kadiatu M. and Hawanatu S.. They named their group Kuru Momoh II, a Temne phrase meaning thank you God. This will be their third loan from SMT/Kiva. The previous loans have made meaningful impacts in the lives of these women. The last loan they each received from Kiva through SMT was for Le 400,000.00. Now, they are each requesting a loan of Le 600,000.00 to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Mamusu M. (middle) is the leader of the group. Mamusu is forty-three years of age. She was born in Freetown, but lives in Magburaka town with her husband, who is a tailor, and their two children. Mamusu’s children are attending school. One is in Junior Secondary School II, and the other is in class V. Mamusu sells rice. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying different varieties of rice wholesale, and reselling them in the Magburaka town market. Mamusu has been in this business for fifteen years.

loans.use: Invest in their businessses

loans.name: Dong

texts.en: Dong D., 48, is married and earns a living as a taxi driver. He has been in this business since 2000, and makes about $5 a day. He also buys fish in bulk for his wife to sell in the local market. His wife is facing a problem, because she does not have a place from which to sell. To help make this possible, they are applying for a loan of $800 to buy their own kiosk. We see Dong D. and his wife in this photograph.

loans.use: To buy a kiosk to use in the local market

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El señor Cirilo H. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito y con el cual pudo surtir su carrito de venta de tacos.
Ahora esta nuevamente solicitando otro préstamo para acondicionar y surtir un nuevo carrito para la venta de tacos y así mismo ayudar a otra persona en darle un trabaja. 
Don Cirilo planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de sus venta de tacos ya que con el nuevo carrito será para los gastos familiares y pagarle a la persona que contratara para que le ayude a la venta.
texts.en:
Mr. Cirilo Hernandez is very thankful for you help with the previous loan, which he used to supply his taco sales cart. Now, he requests a new loan to set up and supply a new cart for taco sales and this way also help another person by giving them a job. Mr. Cirilo plans to repay the loan with the earnings that he gets from his taco sales because the new cart earnings will be used to pay for family expenses and to pay the person he will hire to help him out with the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply a new cart for taco sales

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. Her children are between the ages of 12 and 20, and they are all attending school at the present time. In addition, Mary cares for additional family members. She resides in and rents a two-room house, where she lives with six other people. Her family has access to electricity but no running water, and she works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala.

For ten years, Mary has been in the business of selling bananas in the Kalerwe market. She notes that she purchases these bananas from delivery trucks, which have been stocked by farmers. She explains that she does not incur any transportation costs to and from shopping areas because she buys the bananas at her place of work. She sells to all categories of people -- both retail and wholesale customers.

Mary has been with MCDT for nine years, and she is currently servicing her 22nd loan, working all the while with the same group members. She is now applying for another loan, with the hope that the proceeds from this loan could be used to buy additional bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business expand further so that she can someday purchase her bananas directly from the farmers.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional bananas

loans.name: Roshan Jan Group

texts.en:
Roshan jan is a group of six women:

--Torpeki, the group leader, shares her husband's fruit and vegetable business. Torpeki cleans and packages fruits and vegetables for her husband, and then he sells them from his cart.
--Mursal is a tailor who excels at sewing clothes. She would like a loan to buy a new sewing machine.
--Seema has a women's bakery where women usually bring their dough to bake. She needs the loan to expand her business and purchase more firewood.
--Kamela is a quilt maker who sews different kinds of quilts. She is proud of her work, and she says the loan will help her develop her business.
--Ghuti wants a loan to purchase more stock for her husband’s general store, and Farzana wants a loan for her brother’s second-hand clothes shop. 

Together, they have requested a group loan of 60,000 Afghan Afghani (AFN). They thank the Kiva lenders so much.

loans.use: To purchase materials required for their businesses.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle L. is happily married to Muslemia. They are blessed with five loving children, namely: Jhonn Mark (7 years old, elementary student), Jhonna Rose (6 years old, pre-school pupil), Ashley Joie (5 years of age), Jasmine Rose (3 years old), and Michelle Anne (one year old). They are harmoniously living in the village of Nagassican, Santiago City.

Michelle aims to improve their way of living by expanding her business, but she says that she needs financial support for this. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders. This money will be a great help in the fulfillment of her dreams in life.

loans.use: Additional capital for business improvement

loans.name: Tsevelsodnom

texts.en: T. Tsevelsodnom is 29 years old and lives with her parents and son in a house in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. Her son, Halhtulga is 6 years old and recently started primary school. Tsevelsodnom operates a dairy and meat product trading business with the help of her mother in their town. She started her business in 2000 selling dairy products and clothing, however, since 2008 sales of clothing have dropped dramatically and she recently dropped them in favor of selling meat. Sales of dairy products have remained strong and have brought her business success over the years. Selling meat has made her business more profitable and has stablized her earnings. Tsevelsodnom attributes her success to her good accounting skills and is making many plans for the future. She says, "My mother and I are planning to operate a livestock farm in the future." She is requesting a 2,300,000 tugrug (~1610 USD) loan to purchase more dairy products to sell in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy products to sell in her business

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with three adult children. They live in Mukachevo town.

Valentina sells clothing at one of the local markets located next to the bus station. She launched this venture two years ago. During this time she has been able to gain many repeat clients and to develop her business.

The type of clothing Valentina sells people often buy as a gift. That is why Valentina would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase her assortment for the coming Christmas season.

Valentina desires to develop her business further and make it a stable source of income for her big family.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Taibat

texts.en:
Taibat is 39 years old and is married with three children: 11, 9 and 5 years old. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband is a driver and they both contribute to supporting the family.

Taibat sells provisions, medicine, clothes and bags. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She believes that having an assortment of women's clothes that is both practical and good quality will increase her sales. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions, medicines, clothes and bags to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, medicines, bags and provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 30-year-old engaged man living in Tyre, southern Lebanon, where he has been working as a home painter since 2000. When he first started the business, which he entered because of his experience, he didn’t face difficulties except making himself known to the public. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase paint and painting tools for his work. This is his second loan, and he repays on time.

Khaled is special in his work because he does it well and is aware of the new painting fashion; he does his best to have the newest tools in order to improve his performance. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase paint and painting tools for his work.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis B. sells fried fish at Abura, Cape Coast. Mavis has received junior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Mavis has been selling fried fish for some time now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into that business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Sandra es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Sandra vende ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al crédito.
Sandra necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de niños.
Los sueños de Sandra son construir su casa y tener un negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the Solidaridad Communal Bank.

Sandra is a 30-year-old married mother with 3 children. She sells clothing by special order to friends and family. Her sales are mostly done on credit.

Sandra needs a 1,000 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing children's apparel. She dreams of having her own house built and of running her business from home.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children's apparel

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y vive junto al ultimo de sus hijos en el sector Chepito Bajo del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito que tiene a la mayoría de su población instalada en zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la venta de cerveza y abarrotes en su domicilio. El negocio nació de la necesidad de agenciarse de un ingreso adicional que le permitiera colaborar con el mantenimiento de su familia, ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como trabajador agrícola no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio goza de mucha acogida gracias al esfuerzo que Julia ha puesto para que este salga adelante, empezó ofreciendo pocos productos y luego ha ido ampliando poco a poco la bodega, actualmente viene ofreciendo abarrotes en general y principalmente cerveza. Esta actividad es importante para la comunidad ya que, al estar ubicada en una zona rural, la distancia que lo separa del pueblo principal es larga y los habitantes no pueden movilizarse hacia alla todos los dias para adquirir productos de consumo diario.

Julia se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más abarrotes para ampliar su negocio. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y hacer crecer su bodega, por ello Julia da lo mejor de si para sacarla adelante.

Ella es una persona conocida y estimada por los vecinos del lugar que la consideran una mujer responsable y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Julia is 48 and married. She lives with her youngest child in the Chepito Bajo sector of the Mórrope district. Most of the people in this district live in rural areas. It belongs to the Lambayeque province, which is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For six years she has been selling beer and groceries in her home. The business was born from the need for an additional income, which would allow her to help support her family. Her husband’s income as a farm worker is not enough to pay the family expenses. Thanks to the effort Julia has put into getting ahead, the business is well received. She started by offering a few products, and then she slowly expanded the convenience store. She currently mainly sells general groceries and beer. This business is important to the community because they are in a rural area. It is a long distance to the main town. The inhabitants cannot go there everyday to get the products they consume daily. For the first time Julia is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,000 PEN. She will use the money to buy more groceries to expand her business. Her biggest desire is to keep growing as a businesswoman and to make her convenience store grow. To do that, Julia gives the best of herself to get ahead in her business. She is well known and valued by her neighbors. They consider her to be a responsible woman who is always ready to help when she is needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Elsa is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa is starting a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling of coconuts, fruits & vegetables. Elsa is just starting this business.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as her working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Luther

texts.en:
Luther is a rice farmer living with his family in South Cotabato. He is married to Nemia and they have six children. Like other fathers, he wants only the best for his family and works hard to be able to give his children a proper education.

Luther sought assistance for his business by joining CEVI. He says that its program is really helpful to his farm. He is now applying for a loan of Php 15,000 that he will use to acquire farm inputs like seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Lily Pudan Group

texts.en:
Lily P. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Lily is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Lily P.' Group.

Lily is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Lily owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Lily has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lily joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to pay for services to increase crop yield. Lily is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Lily from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un padre de familia que tiene 70 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y a un nieto menor de edad en el distrito agrícola de Nueva Arica, un distrito ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de ropa, zapatillas y maletines en su vivienda, adicionalmente ofrece su mercadería los dias domingo en el mercado del cercano distrito de Oyotún ( ubicado a unos 8 km de distancia de su vivienda), el compra sus productos al por mayor en la ciudad de Chiclayo y siempre trata de obtener productos de calidad para mantener a su clientela fiel ya que esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para mantener a su familia.

Roberto desea ampliar su negocio para captar mas clientes y así poder percibir mas ingresos que le permitan salir adelante, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Roberto es una persona emprendedora y que a pesar de su edad aún tiene ansias de trabajar  para ganarse el sustento, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder tener un negocio mas estable y tener una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive el es una persona querida y estimada.
texts.en:
Roberto is a 70 year old father who lives with his wife and young grandson in the farming district of Nueva Arica, which is located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than five years, Roberto has been selling clothes, shoes, and satchels from his home. He also sells merchandise on Sundays at the market near the district of Oyotún (which is approximately 8km from his home). Roberto buys his products wholesale in the city of Chiclayo and always tries to acquire high quality products so that he maintains a loyal customer base. His business is the only source of income that goes to support his family.

Roberto wants to expand his business and attract more customers so that he can generate more income to get ahead. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can achieve his goal.

Roberto is an enterprising individual who still yearns to work and earn a living despite his age. His greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that he can have a more stable business and a better quality of life. In the area where he lives, Robert is someone who is admired and respected.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand his business

loans.name: Rwenshama Tukore B, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
Operating a grocery business has really transformed his life. Having been prevailed upon by his wife, M. Richard began his business three years ago in Rwenshama, Rukungiri. He has mostly been selling sugarcane, sweet bananas, charcoal, tomatoes and onions. This business has been bringing him earnings amounting to 100,000 Ugandan shillings on a weekly basis.

Being a married father of six lively children made this 44-year-old come to terms with the fact that he needed to work extra hard to improve his family's welfare. With his cultivated hard-work ethic, he has been able to cater for his family's requirements, including meeting the school fees for his children’s education. That has all been made possible with finances from his business.

Before he began this business, Richard was more inclined to farming. He still derives side profits from his small scale coffee-sales business.

This loan will enable Richard to expand his business through the purchase of more crops like sweet bananas, thus increasing his supplying capacity to his increasing clientele. This will enable him to earn more revenue and live a more sustaining life as he looks at business expansion in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more crops like sweet bananas, tomatoes and sugarcane for his store

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora D. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old. Leonora is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel Antonio Z. C. tiene 22 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia.  Tiene 1 hijo, Alejandra (2). 

Manual es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz desde hace cuatro años.  Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los Agro servicios de AGRIPAD y vende los productos en el Mercado de Chillanes.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener mejor ingreso económico para superarse en la vida. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta hacer deporte especialmente el fútbol.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio Z. C. is 22 years old. He is single, and he lives in the town of the Recinto Delicia, located in Chillanes, a canton of the Bolívar province. He has a child, Alejandra, aged 2. Manuel is a member of the rural bank El Progreso La Delicia Recinto, located in the parish of San José del Tambo: there are 19 members in this rural bank, and they dedicate themselves to the sowing of cacao and corn. Manuel engages in agriculture, and he has been planting corn for four years. Every month he buys products and farming supplies from the agricultural services division of AGRIPAD. He sells his products at the market in Chillanes. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy corn seeds. He thinks this loan represents an opportunity to progress. He dreams of earning more money in order to improve the quality of his life. The main challenges he has to face are the weather and the lack of economic resources. He likes playing sports, especially soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 44 years old and married with eight children who are between 7 and 24 years old. Of her older children, one is a money collector on a bus and another is a tailor. She is unable to afford school fees for her children who are of school age.  Her husband works for a church and earns a small income.   In addition to her children, Asia supports orphans and elderly people in her family.  

Asia has a hair salon where she cuts and styles hair.  She plans to use the loan to start a shop that sells milk, soft drinks and snacks. With the profits she hopes to buy a sewing machine to support her child who is a tailor.  

Asia attributes the success of her business to the fact that she is social and hardworking, which her clients appreciate. Eventually, she hopes to make enough money to have a small cattle and chicken farm.

loans.use: To start a shop that sells milk, soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia J. is currently in the business of selling maize flour, rice and beans at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize flour to sell.  

Silvia is 31 years old and married to a builder. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize flour to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 59 años de edad y es soltera; tiene  2 hijos, La socia  es cesante de educación; se dedica tambien a la venta de artículos de dormitorio, ropa en general, ella compra en desaguadero, ahora necesita el préstamo para invertir en mercadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana, 59, is a member of the “VIRGEN DE CHAPI” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She is single and has two children. She is a retired teacher but also sells bedroom supplies and assorted clothing which she purchases in Desaguadero. She needs a loan to invest in merchandise and is asking for la loan to buy clothes. She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.
