Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Margarita Isabel

texts.es: Margarita Isabel M. D. R. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 3 y 6 años D. edad, quienes estudian en el Kinder D. la zona en que viven. Margarita posee un puesto D. venta D. especias como: orégano, diferentes tipos D. semillas, chiles deshidratados y todo tipo D. productos los cuales se utilizan para dar un mejor sabor a los alimentos. Su negocio esta ubicado dentro del mercado D. Soyapango, en donD. cuenta con varios clientes quienes consumen sus productos D. forma periódica.  Margarita cuenta con el enorme deseo D. aumentar sus ventas en gran manera, D. forma que cuente con las posibilidades D. aportar más en el hogar, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad y variedad D. especias, las cuales pueda ofrecer a precios accesibles con el deseo D. aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Margarita Isabel M. D. R., 40, lives in Soyapango with her husband and two children who are 3 and 6 years of age and go to the local Kindergarten. Margarita has a stand where she sells spices like: oregano, various types of seeds, dehydrated chilies and all sorts of products used to improve the flavor of foods. Her store is insiD. Soyapango’s market and she has several regular customers. Margarita has an enormous wish to increase her sales greatly so that she can proviD. more for her home. This is why she’s asking for a loan with which to by larger quantities and varieties of spices to offer at accesible prices thus increasing her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spices.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah M. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts and is requesting a loan to stock baking flour and some shop items to sell.  Sarah is 37 years old and married to a chief. She has two children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to establish a small agricultural farm.

loans.use: To stock baking flour and some shop items to sell

loans.name: Norma Adilia

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer trabajadora, que gracias a su tenacidad y financiamiento con la institución ha mejorado su vivienda. Madre de dos hijos. Casada.
Tiene su propio negocio la venta de cajeta en donde prepara día  a día estos dulces que se venden a diario. Así como también lava y plancha ajeno logrando captar más dinero, siendo de gran ayuda para sus hijos y la economía de su familia, ya que su esposo también labora en operaciones de servicios.
Ha sido atreves de Afodenic que ha logrado las mejoras, lo que le satisface estar en mejores condiciones de techo, con el crédito anterior logro la división de los cuartos. Y con este pondrá piso ya que aun es de tierra, lo que comprara: Arena, cemento, piso y comenzar. El cual será de gran higiene.
texts.en:
Norma is a hard working woman who, thanks to her tenacity and financing from the Institution, has managed to make home improvements.  She’s married and has two children.

She has her own business making caramel that she makes to sell daily.  She also takes in washing and ironing to earn extra income knowing what a help this is for her children and her family’s economy.  Her husband is also employed in service operations.

Home improvements have been possible thanks to Afodenic loans.  The previous loan was used build interior walls to divide rooms.  This loan will be used to install a floor since the current floor is still dirt.  She will buy: paving stones, sand and cement and get started.  This will be more healthy.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies like: paving stones, cement, sand and others.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia, who is married, sells various food products at an open market in Kahovka town, earing a monthly profit of about 4,000 Grivnas. She started this business five years ago, deciding to become self-employed because of high unemployment in her town. Moreover, this business did not require a lot of start-up capital. Today Natalia has many repeat customers and good turnover. She enjoys her business and would like to develop it further.

Natalia is requesting a loan of 10,500 Grivnas to increase working capital. In late fall there are several national celebrations, so Natalia would like to be ready to offer her clients a higher volume of produce.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Richard Nderitu

texts.en:
Richard has operated his retail shop selling electronic goods in the town of Naivasha for the last 20 years. He is 50 years old, married to Beatrice Wanjiru, and together they have five children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 50,000 well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy more electronics for sale in his shop.

In the future, Richard hopes to construct his own building in Naivasha and rent office space.

loans.use: To buy more electronics to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou P., 40 years old, has been selling a variety of food items in the streets since 2000. She lives in Talibon, Bohol.  She has a sari-sari store and five children. She would like to augment the income of her family. Funding from CEVI will allow her to expand her inventory.

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to buy firewood, shampoo and other merchandise to resell in her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene S. is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:   General Store, Rice Dealer and Hog raising businesses.  She lives in Prk. 5, Brgy. Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her General Store, Rice Dealer and Hog raising businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 16,000.  Arlene is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she  can  purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 27,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Arlene aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Apollonea

texts.en:
Apollonea A. is a married lady. Her husband helps in running the business and they have six children aged between twenty-five years old and twelve years old. Her business is located at a busy market in Kakamega. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and it is known as the sugar belt region.

She makes and sells steel doors, windows and gates. She has been in this business for five years now and has two employees. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is scarcity of materials for making the items that she sells. She also admits that being a woman, she has to work extra hard to convince the local people that she can do exellent work for them just like men. This is because this kind of business is male dominated. She works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy steel to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. In future, she hopes to open a hardware store. She also hopes to bring up a healthy and literate family. She describes herself as hardworking, persistent and patient.

loans.use: To buy steel.

loans.name: Khadejah

texts.en:
Khadejah form Marka, Amman is a 41-year-old married woman. She is an entrepreneurial woman who has a dry-cleaning shop and she is one of the rare women who works in this field.

Khadejah is requesting a loan of 500 JD to buy a new washer to clean bed covers and to buy a steam-ironing machine. She is well known in the area as having a good reputation, and is planning to open a new branch for her shop to meet the increasing demand.

loans.use: To buy a new washer to clean bed covers and to buy a steam-ironing machine

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school while the others have graduated.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  Mwanatumu faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition from other charcoal sellers in her business.  She hopes to be self reliant in her business in the future.

With the 60,000 KES she wants to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal and construction materials to renovate two rooms for rental.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase twenty sacks of charcoal and construction materials to renovate two rooms for rental.

loans.name: Mirtha Beatriz

texts.en: Ms. Mirtha Gonzalez is single and has a 5-year-old daughter.  She used to be an employee of a jewelry store, where she worked for several years; that's where she got the idea of becoming an independent worker, and 10 years ago she did.   Now Mirtha buys and sells silver and golden jewelry, and she is well established in the business.  Also, due to customer requests, she is going into the women's shoe business as well, in which she is doing great.  in the near future she is planning in opening a small general store business in her house.

loans.use: Jewelry and shoes for women

loans.name: Surik

texts.en: Surik A. lives in Goraik village of the Syunik region. Surik lives with his mother and newlywed wife. The family has a cattlefarm and is engaged in land cultivation. The Syunik region has severe cold climate, which is suited for cattle farming. Currently there is increased demand for small cattle on the market. To enlarge the business and increase the profit for his growing family Surik has applied for this loan to purchase more cattle.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Manuel Florencio

texts.es:
Manuel Florencio A. P. tiene 44 años, Vive en Unión Libre vive con la compañera y los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene  3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, arroz, maracayá en pocas cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz además para insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es trabajar para poder sacar adelante a los hijos.

Le gusta pasear y trabajar en el terreno.
texts.en:
Manuel Florencio A. P. , 44, is in a common law relationship.  She lives in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province with his wife and three children.

The “JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS” (We Progress Together) communal bank is located in Matilde Esther which belongs to Chillanes canton.  It has 12 members primarily involved in short cycle farming of corn, rice and small amounts of passion fruit and in raising small animals like pigs and chickens.

Manuel is a corn and rice farmer.  He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.
He is asking for a loan to plant corn and rice and to buy farming supplies.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, diseases and weather variations. 

His dream is to work to support his children.  He enjoys working the land and going on excursions.

loans.use: To plant corn and rice and to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Yasna

texts.es:
Yasna forma parte del banco comunal “Arco Iris” perteneciente a la ciudad de Osorno.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, vendiendo artículos para regalos en una galería ubicada en el centro de Osorno. Yasna se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 3 años. Yasna tiene muchos clientes debido a la ubicación de su local.
Con éste préstamo pretende comprar peluches, papeles de regalo y accesorios para el cabello, especialmente para la temporada del día de la madre que es una de las fechas en las cuales existe más demanda de compra. 
Su  mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, en una distribuidora.
Yasna vive junto a sus dos hijas de 18 y 11 años de edad. Su hija mayor es quien le ayuda administrar su negocio.
El sueño de Yasna es que sus hijas terminen estudios universitarios y sean profesionales. Es por esto, su motivación de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
Sus metas a nivel comercial, es poder abastecer su negocio con mercadería y ampliar su local, ya que de esta manera aumentarían sus ingresos. 

Para Yasna los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que con éstos podrá invertir. También se encuentra muy contenta y a gusto con su grupo. Ya que le ha permitido crear lazos de amistad. 
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
Yasna belongs to the “Rainbow” cooperative bank, located in the city of Osorno.  She dedicates herself to commerce, selling articles for gifts from a gallery located in the center of Osorno.  She has been in this business for 3 years, and has many customers because of her store’s location.  She wants to use this loan to buy stuffed animals, gift wrapping paper and hair accessories, all of which are especially important as Mother’s Day approaches.  This is one of the times of year when her merchandise is in highest demand.  She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago, at a distributor’s.  

Yasna lives with her two daughters, ages 18 and 11.  Her older daughter helps her run the business.  Yasna’s dreams are for her children to finish their university educations and become professionals.  This is the main reason she would like to continue investing in her enterprise.  Her goals on a business level are to be able to supply and expand her store, which will allow her to augment her income.  The loans via Fondo Esperanza have greatly helped Yasna’s business, as they have allowed her to invest in it.  She also finds herself very happy with her group, and has made many friendships this way.  

Osorno is located in the southern part of Chile, in the Los Lagos region.  It is an important agricultural area, which identifies itself as “The Homeland of Milk and Land of Meat” of Chile.  Within the agricultural activities in the region, what stands out are the cultivation of corn and oats, the raising of livestock for meat and dairy products processing, in addition to the fabrication of farming equipment.  Osorno is known for having the only covered soccer stadium in Chile, the "Rubén Marcos” municipal stadium.

loans.use: to purchase stuffed animals, gift wrapping paper, and hair accessories.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel forma parte del banco comunal “Fénix”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna.
Ella se dedica a vender verduras en un local, dónde paga por el permiso municipal del establecimiento. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 33 años, ya que es un negocio familiar que Raquel ha mantenido en el transcurso del tiempo. Por lo tanto tiene clientes muy antiguos, lo que le ha sido favorable para su negocio. Su mercadería la compra usualmente en la feria de Lo Valledor, donde los precios son a bajo costo, especialmente para comerciantes del rubro. 
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería específicamente verduras para abastecer su local.
Su sueño es ampliar su local, para que le genere mayores ganancias. Sus motivaciones son comprar un vehículo para el traslado de su mercadería y obtener su casa propia. 
Raquel vive junto a sus dos hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad, el mayor de ellos trabaja lo que es un ingreso económico más para el hogar y su hijo menor estudia. Sin embargo ambos la ayudan con la atención del negocio. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo esperanza, ya que éste la ayudará a invertir en su negocio. Además las facilidades de pago y empatía de los encargados de la institución. Las reuniones junto a los demás socios son muy amenas y comparten gratas experiencias. Las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para aprender a organizar la contabilidad de su negocio. 
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Raquel is a member of the Communal Bank “Fénix” (Phoenix), which is located in the city of La Cisterna.  She sells vegetables from a space that she obtained by purchasing a municipal permit.  Raquel has been a part of this family business for 33 years.  As a result, she has many long-time customers who have been a benefit to her business.  Her merchandise is usually acquired at the fair in Lo Vallendor where prices are low, especially for produce merchants.  With this loan, she will buy merchandise, particularly vegetables to restock her business. Her goal is to expand her business so that she can generate more income.  The goals that motivate her are to buy a vehicle for transporting her goods and to obtain her own home.

Raquel lives with her two children, ages 18 and 16.  The older child works and helps bring in more household income, while the younger child is in school.  Both of them help with managing her business.  

Raquel is pleased with and grateful for the loans obtained through Fondo Esperanza.  The funds will help her invest in her business.  In addition, she appreciates the convenience of the payments and the empathy that the staff of Fondo Esperanza has demonstrated.  The meetings with the other members are enjoyable and enable them to share experiences.  Raquel has also found that the training seminars have been essential in helping her learn how to organize her accounting records.  

La Cisterna is a community located in the south central section of Metropolitana region.  It is essentially a residential and business community.  At first it was a rural area with large tracts of land.  As a result of population growth and the arrival of public services, the area is now 100% urban.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Herminia

texts.es:
Doña Maria Herminia R. T., es casada, tiene 51 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a impartir clases de estudios primarios ya que es maestra, tiene 29 años de experiencia en este trabajo.

Se acerca a ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar medicamentos y mejorar su condicion de vida ya que lo mas importante es tener buena salud, espera mejorar su salud por los medicamentos que adquiere y solventar el credito que esta haciendo, ha sido socia de ASDIR desde el año 2006 y a estado al dia en sus pagos.
texts.en:
51-year old Doña Maria Herminia R. T. is married and has two children who are both students. Maria has been a primary school teacher for 29 years.

She is asking Kiva partner ASDIR for a loan to buy medications and improve her living conditions as the most important thing is to have good health. She hopes to improve her health by taking the medications. Maria has been a member of ASDIR since 2006 and has always paid back the money on time.

loans.use: to buy medications

loans.name: Hope Development Group

texts.en: 34 year old K. Mujibu is a charcoal salesman in Kisenyi, Kampala. The happily married father of 4 has been operating this business for the last 10 years, before which he was mostly doing odd jobs in and around Kampala.   He says his weekly business profits are about 150,000 shillings, and adds that with this loan, he will purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.  Mujibu also has a rental business that he oversees. Through the course of the years he says he has relied on one thing, which is hard work. This hard work ethic has sustained him this long, and he anticipates that if he keeps going with that tenacity, his further longevity will be guaranteed.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Nueva Esperanza es un grupo integrado por 18 señoras que decidieron formar un comité solidario, cada una con un sentimiento de superación. Están actualmente en el 1er ciclo. Son muy tabajadoras, unidas y responsables.
La Sra. Sully solicita el crédito para la adquisición de plantas en sus variedades, rosas, orquídeas, margaritas, etc. y destinarlos a la reventa, de esta forma espera poder brindar una ayuda económica a su familia, con el fruto de su sacrificio.
Si bien este es el primer crédito que solicitan, todas son mujeres muy responsables en sus pagos según las referencias y los antecedentes crediticios que poseen, por eso esperan contar con el apoyo de Kiva y Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza gropu is made up of 18 women who decided to form a solidarity group for lending, in hopes of improving their lives. The group is in its first loan cycle and all the members are hardworking and responsible women who are committed to supporting one another.
 
Sully is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of plants to sell, such as roses, orchids, and daisies. Through her hard work she hopes to contribute financially to her family's wellbeing. 

Although this is the group's first loan request, all the women have responsibly repaid previous loans, according to their credit history and references. They hope to receive the support of Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy a variety of plants.

loans.name: Kwassi

texts.fr:
Kwassi est un homme âgé de 30 ans. Il est célibataire. 
Kwassi a travaillé comme revendeur depuis 2005. Il vend des cartes de recharge de portable de façon ambulante. Il achète les cartes à Lomé. 
Kwassi a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharge. Il veut satisfaire la demande croissante et assurer un avenir meilleur pour lui-même.
texts.en:
Kwassi is a 30-year old man. He is single.

Kwasi has been working as a vendor since 2005. He sells recharge cards for  mobile phones as a street vendor. He stocks up  in Lomé.

Kwasi is seeking his third loan from WAGES in order to buy more recharge cards. He would like to meet the growing demand and ensure a better future for himself.

loans.use: to buy recharge cards for mobile phones

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 7 children. 

Melchora is providing manicure and pedicure services.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy materials needed for manicures and pedicures.

Melchora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Melchora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for manicure and pedicure

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 42 years old and single, with 7 children whose ages range from 4 to 18 years old. Monica has no other dependents and lives in her own house in Hoima District, Uganda.

Monica has been dealing in the textile business for 9 years. She started as a tailor and saved money to start her current business, through which she has been able to improve her finances and educate her children. So far, Monica doesn’t have any serious hardships. Her wish is to see her shop grow into a bigger wholesale business. Monica wants a loan to buy cloth to sell.

loans.use: to buy textiles for resale.

loans.name: Dagbegnikin 2 Group

texts.fr: DAGBEGNIKIN 2 est un groupement constitué de dix neuf personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Bernadette. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Bernadette est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Marcellin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les charges de la famille sont supportées à la fois par le mari et par Bernadette. Il y a environs six ans, Bernadette mène comme activité la vente de fruits et des céréales à son domicile mais aussi par le système de distribution. Bernadette achète ses produits au Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Bernadette et à son groupement DAGBEGNIKIN 2, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: The Dagbegnikin 2 group comprises 19 people and its president (with the raised hand in the photo) is named Bernadette. The group members live in the same area in Benin. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking its first loan through ALIDÉ. Bernadette is 41 years old and married to a carpenter named Marcellin. The couple have three children, all of whom are in their care and attend school. Bernadette and her husband provide for the family together. For about six years, Bernadette has run a business selling fruit and cereals at her house and also through the local distribution system. She gets her products in Benin. This first loan will certainly allow Bernadette and her group Dagbegnikin 2 to raise the level of their business and increase their clientele and income.

loans.use: To buy fruit and bags of maize.

loans.name: Theam

texts.en:
We know that the field as farming business is the one business where it is veR. hard to earn enough income to support the family comfortably as others. Mrs.Theam and her husband tR. eveR. day to work hard to feed all their children. Both of them work as farmers. They can earn about $4 per day. They are raising four children; three of them are studying at school and one of them helps the parents to do farming. All of them are single. 

To create a big family in prosperity and modern as others, Mrs.Theam would like to borrow the amount of $375 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en: Sarun is 63 years old and earns about $7 a day by selling vegetables. She is a single mother with two children who are 26 and 23 years old. Each of her children works in a garment factory and earns about $3 a day. Every month, the family has to spend $100 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. Sarun is applying for a loan for $700 to buy a motorbike for her daughters to use when traveling to work. In the future, she would like to help one of her daughters go into business for herself by opening a small tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike her family can use when commuting to work.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is illiterate and remains at home. She is very active and performs her household tasks very well. Her husband sells vehicle tires and tubes. His shop is located in the market. He is very fair in his rates and provides good quality products and services to his customers. She doesn’t have any children. 

Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy tires and tubes of different brands and companies to raise his profits and sales. He is very experienced in his business and has been doing it for the past 27 years. Sughran hopes that an investment will help him earn more profits from his business and she will be able to save some profits for their old age.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy vehicle tires & tubes to sell

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Yuri is from the village Kharjami, South Georgia. He is 49 years old, married and lives with his family: wife - Manana, 25-year-old son, daughter-in-law and mother (retired). 

The main source of income for the family is agriculture. In particular, they have a dairy farm with 8 milk cows. The family members produce and sell, on average, 150 kg of cheese locally. They have a lot of experience in cheese production and their cheese is of a high quality. Also, Yuri grows potatoes, haricots and onions on a family-owned plot of land. Vegetables are sold locally to the greengrocery wholesalers. Total average income of the family is 650 GEL per month, including the pension of Yuri’s mother. 

Yuri requested credit to purchase hay for feeding the cows during the winter period. Also, approximately 30% of the credit will be used for expansion of the cattle shed. In the near future, Yuri plans to increase the amount of cows on the farm, but the existing cattle shed doesn’t allow him to keep more than 8 cows. After expansion of the cattle shed he will be able to realize his business idea, which will be followed by the increase of the family income, as well as improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cows and construction materials for expansion of the cattle shed

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Magdalena has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Magdalena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Magdalena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 42 years old and blessed with two children.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for fattening her pigs to ensure good nutrition. Livestock with good nutrition can be offered at a higher price when it's ready for disposal. The business has been operating for just a year and for Yolanda, a net profit of PHP 7,000 is raised for each pig she is able to dispose. The business is quite good for the needs of her family so she wants to maintain it well.

With the help of this loan, in the future, she would like to strengthen her pig-selling business to earn and save enough money to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for fattening her pigs.

loans.name: Mercideta

texts.en:
Mercideta is 37 years old, married and has six children, four of who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mercideta has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Mercideta requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Mercideta has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Mercideta would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. She is 34 years old and married to Johnson; they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs.

In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her farming methods and raise her income in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Ruth Ladies Group

texts.en:
Judith is 30 years old. She is married and has three children, age 8, 5 and 2, with one going to school. Her husband works at Masvingo Remand Prison as a lab technician. They stay at a company house where the spouse works.

She works at a salon that is located in Masvingo. She rents a chair from the owner of the salon. She does not have any employees and has been in operation for 10 years. The business faces a challenge of high competition in the market as well as the failure of some of her customers to pay for the products that they have taken on credit.

She wants to purchase weaves, hair chemicals and jewelry with the loan. 

She has a vision of opening her own hair salon in the next five years. With the profits she would be able to save for her children's future so that they may be able to have a quality education.

loans.use: to buy weaves, hair chemicals and jewelry.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito is 34 years old and married. He has 3 children aged 10, 7, and 1. Julito is a seaweed farmer from Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in this kind of business for 7 years. Julito earns 15000 PHP per month from seaweed farming. 

Julito has requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, wooden pegs, and other materials. Julito hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, wooden pegs, and other materials

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is single and blessed with two children. For the last eleven years, she has been running a tailoring business to support her family. Hannah has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers.
 
She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of fabric. 

Since Hannah joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of fabric.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Agneta is the facilitator of the Upendo group. Agneta and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Agneta and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Agneta joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Agneta had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Agneta was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Agneta will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Upendo group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Agneta with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
Mrs. On is 28 years old and a loving mother of four children. She is a local farmer, cultivating annual rice crops throughout the year. She also takes some time to sell sweet things, snacks, and groceries for extra profit. 

After the rice season ends, Mrs. On will have available time to do work at home, so she wants to improve her living condition by raising some piglets in her backyard. Now she would like to borrow some funds to build a wooden piggery and buy some piglets and feeds. She hopes that she will be able to lift her family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: To build a wooden piggery and buy some piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Yvette is 35 years old and married with six children, aged between 3 and 15 years old. Yvette sells eggs, bananas, sugar, etc. Her business is well organized. She works from 6 am until 9 pm every day and has three years of experience.

Yvette has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of tomatoes, eggs, bananas, sugar, etc to sell. With any profit from the loan, Yvette will reinvest in her business and be able to save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, eggs, bananas, sugar, etc to sell.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La Señora Gladis es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 35 años de edad, es Madre Soltera, vive en casa propia, tiene un hijo, es vendedora ambulante de frutas y verduras de estación, realiza repartos a domicilios, casa por casa ya que cuenta con clientela formada.
Con mucho esfuerzo va logrando solventar los gastos de estudios de su hijo, con la venta de tomates, lechugas cebollas  y frutas en general. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que no es nada fácil Salir a recorrer por las calles para vender. Su meta es que su hijo pueda ser una persona con buenos estudios, para que de esa forma no tenga que pasar por privaciones como la que ellas tuvo que pasar.
 Acude a  Fundación Paraguaya para  acceder a una pequeña ayuda que destinara a la compra de Frutas y Verduras de estación para volver a revender. Agradece a la fundación y también a Kiva, por la gran ayuda que le brinda, pues el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Gladis is from the city of Villarrica.  She is 35 years old, and is a single mother.  She lives in her own home, and has one child.  She has a business selling seasonal fruits and vegetables in an itinerant manner.  She makes deliveries to homes, house by house, because she has an established customer base.

She has been covering the educational expenses for her child with a lot of effort, by selling tomatoes, lettuce, onions and fruit.  She comments that her work requires a lot of sacrifice, because it's not easy to go out into the streets to sell.  Her goal is to have her son become a good and well-educated person, so that he will not have to suffer the hardships that she experienced.  

She approached the Fundación Paraguaya to ask for a small loan that will help her to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell.  She is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for this great assistance that they are providing, as this loan is going to be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Dababougou Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Dababougou Benkadi 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   AWA , 2 eme femme  debout de la droite vers la gauche sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 190.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Dababougou Benkadi 4" are married women averaging 35 years of age and five children each all living in traditional families in Soké, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with AWA, the second woman standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, some seeds, and sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining one hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 190,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: Sokroeurn

texts.en: is 43 years old, married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province. She buys and sells sugar, earning income about USD4 per day. Her husband is security guard and also motor taxi driver, earning income about USD6 per day. One of her children is a guard in garment factory, earning income around USD2.6 per day. Sokroeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to buy equipment to build her house. In the future, she hopes she can support her children get high education.

loans.use: buy equipment to build her house

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 36-year-old Agness from Moriba town in Bo in the southern area. She is married with 2 children, and her children are currently attending school. 

Agness runs a food stand business selling groundnut for resale. She has been running this business for some years now. She works at the business from 9:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m., 6 days per week. Agness says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Agness has requested a loan in order to purchase a bag of groundnut and cooking seasoning to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase a bag of groundnut and cooking seasoning to expand her business

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
Kan is aged 25 years and married with two dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district earning a living through farming rice while her husband works as a worker to help earn income to support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR24,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR10,000 each day for the future needs.
Kan has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Kan wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Kléber

texts.en:
ENGLISH 

Kleber V. owns a small business where he sells fabrics and makes clothes. He works in making adjustments, new designs and creating custom fabrics. His business is run out of a rented location where he has access to attract clients from the community. Kleber needs $685 to be able buy materials like: fabrics, threads, scissors, and a mannequin. He was born in Manabi, he is 39 years old, he is single father with 2 sons and lives in an apartment which was inheritance from his parents. He has 15 years of experience in this type of business. He works from 7:00am to the 18:00pm, and appears to be very committed and hardworking.

SPANISH

Kléber V.,  nació en  Manabí, tiene 39 años de edad,  es padre soltero, tiene 2 hijos, vive en un departamento que es herencia de los padres Posee un negocio de Confección de ropa, alquila un local en la avenida principal, sus clientes son todas las personas de la comunidad, su experiencia es de 15 años en esta actividad, él atiende a partir  de las 7:00 AM hasta las 18:00PM,  él  necesita $ 685, para poder comprar materiales como: telas, hilos, juego de tijeras, una moldeadora, se  pudo observar que es una persona trabajadora, y  emprendedora.

loans.use: Kleber needs $685 to be able buy materials like: fabrics, threads, scissors, and a mannequin.

loans.name: Rovshen

texts.en: Rovshen B. is a local retailer of cell phones and cell phone accessories in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of the country. Rovsen is looking for funding so that he can increase and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: To purchase a newer and more diversified inventory.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um P. is a local doctor in Phnom Penh, and earns $20/day.  His wife, 4 children, and mother all live with him.  Um P. would like to use this loan to buy land which he will rent out.  He is seeking to transition from a doctor to a businessman that buys and sells land and other assets.  With this new income, he would like to send his children to study at a top Cambodian university.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath has been married since 1979 and has 2 sons and 6 daughters. Her husband only completed 4 grades of school, and Sambath is illiterate. She has been selling groceries for the past 10 years, while her husband has been a motor taxi driver for the same period of time. One of Sambath's daughters is working in a garment factory, while another 3 are still studying. The rest of Sambath's children are already married and living in a separate house. She needs a loan of US$1,000 to repair her old motorbike and to buy grocery items, rice and noodles. Sambath's business can earn enough money for her family and can support her children's education. Sambath and her husband are polite and honest, and will be capable of repaying the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery items and rice for sale and repair of a motorbike.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. She owns a grocery store. She started this business 15 years ago, and she tells us that she started with little capital. She had only a little bit of savings, and those days it was difficult to get a loan because she didn't have a credit history.

The first few years were difficult because the sales were not good, but she persevered and nowadays she has many customers. She also sells fast food to the workers in the neighborhood that already eat breakfast from her products.

Her main accomplishment was to have her own business and to be able to provide and maintain her family. She is requesting a loan to buy products like milk, yogurt, meat, beer, soft drinks, wine, fruits, etc.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

La señora Francisca tiene 44 años, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, posee una despensa , se inició en ésta actividad hace más de 15 años, comenta que empezó con un pequeño capital, producto de unos ahorros que tenía, ya que ese tiempo le fue difícil acceder a un préstamo a nivel de financieras ya que no contaba con referencias anteriores.

Los primeros años a su inicio fueron difíciles porque las ventas no fueron las más buenas, no obstante siguió perseverando y hoy día tiene muchos clientes, también vende comidas rápidas para los obreros de la zona que hoy día ya habitúan desayunar sus productos.

Su principal logro fue el de poder cumplir su meta de tener su negocio propio y el de proveer a su familia del sustento necesario. Desea el crédito para comprar productos como leche, yogurt, carne, cerveza, gaseosas, vino, frutas, etc.

loans.use: to purchase products like milk, yogurt, meat, beer, soft drinks, wine, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is 40 years old and a married mother of 4 children; she sells garri, plantain, pepper and bush meat in the market. She has 15 years' experience in this business and has been with LAPO for the past 6 years. She is requesting for the sum of $400 to buy plantain, melon, pepper, garri & bush meat for sales.

loans.use: To buy more melon, pepper, garri, bush meat & plantain

loans.name: Kimatai

texts.en:
Kimatai is one of the active clients of Microinvest. She became a client in 2003; since then, she has demonstrated herself to be a punctual and accurate person. Her business stall is located in J.Rasulov, in the Khujand region of Tajikistan. She said her place is crowded every day as it is situated in the first clothing row in a big market, and customers have a good opportunity to see her goods first.

Kimatai has 13 years of experience in trade, and she has learned the rules of market. She says that the quality of her products and polite service are the main laws of attracting new clients and holding them. She always tries to help them to choose clothes, and they stay very satisfied with her communication and quality of her goods. Kimatai has 3 children who are grown up enough to help their mother. Two of her sons have their own business and they are responsible for buying and bringing goods from the wholesale market to their mother. Her daughter often sells goods with her. Now Kimatai wants to have extra capital to purchase warm clothes for the winter season.

loans.use: Purchase of warm clothes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana C. is the head of her family. She takes care of her children, and learned how to get ahead by herself through selling food. Everything started four months ago when she decided to start a business because her neighbors were asking her for her food. They liked it so much that she adapted a space in her house to make it a small restaurant.

Nevertheless, she doesn't have enough supplies right now to keep making her dishes, besides offering her clients food for the holidays. This is why Juana is requesting a loan of $300, to be repaid in 4 months, to be able to buy merchandise to make her dishes. With your help, Juana will be able to keep her business going and to establish it so she can pass it on to her kids.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Juana C. es una jefa de familia, que tiene a su cargo sus hijos y sola a sabido salir adelante con la venta de comidas. Todo comenzó hace un año cuatro meses que se decidió a poner su negocio porque sus vecinos le pedían guisados y les gustaba mucho fue así que adecuó un espacio en su casa para poder hacerlo un restaurante pequeño.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con el suficiente material como para seguir elaborando comidas, además de ofrecerle a sus clientes comidas para las celebraciones. Es por es oque Juana está solicitando un crédito de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y así poder comprar mercancía para elaborar los guisados. Con tu ayuda Juana podrá salir adelante en su negocio y estabilizarlo para poder tenerlo como un patrimonio.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make her foods

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es:
Dora is married and has three older daughters. With the financial support of her husband, who works as a mechanic, she has been able to provide an education for them and they are now studying at the university. The family lives in the La Libertad neighborhood, a place where the residents find themselves in a precarious situation in life.

She attends to a school cafeteria that offers items such as breakfast, sandwiches, hamburgers, drinks, and sweets. The cafeteria’s customers are the school students and faculty, who are able to buy a quality product there. Given that the school has two daily sessions, morning and afternoon, Dora works from 6 am to 5 pm. Her daughters help her with tasks related to running the cafeteria.

Currently, her customers are asking that she add new dishes to her current menu. For this reason, she seeks a loan to buy additional food/ingredients such as rice, beans, chicken, and vegetables in order to prepare the meals. Her short-term goal is also to improve the physical condition of her cafeteria's location.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Dora es casada y tiene 3 hijas mujeres, con el apoyo económico de su esposo que se desempeña como mecánico es que ha podido educar y preparar a sus hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando en la Universidad, esta familia habita en el barrio Villa Libertad en donde los pobladores se encuentran en precaria situación de vida. La Sra. atiende un Cafetín Colegial, en este cafetín se ofrece desayunos como sándwich, hamburguesas, almuerzos caseros, refrescos y golosinas. Los clientes del Cafetín son los alumnos del Colegio y los Docentes del mismo, los cuales se les ofrece un producto económico de acuerdo a sus necesidades, la Sra se encuentra trabajando desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m., ya que el colegio tiene 2 horarios de clase, mañana y tarde. Las hijas le ayudan a su madre ha administrarlo. Actualmente, a la Sra. le están demandando nuevos productos y platillos para ofertarlo a sus clientes, es por eso que necesita el préstamo, para comprar productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, pollo, verduras para elaborar los platillos que ofrece. Su meta a corto plazo es ampliar la estructura física del cafetín.

loans.use: Purchase food/ingredients for cafeteria.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is a 37 year old petty trader.  She sells food items in the market of Makeni town in Sierra Leone. The previous loan increased her stock and profit.  Fatmata said she can now save small amounts of money every month for future business diversification. She is requesting a loan of $350 to increase her stock and income.  Fatmata is married with 4 children.

loans.use: Fatmata needs to increase her stock of food items for selling and the Kiva loan would allow her the opportunity to do so.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en: Naseem S., this group's leader, is from Lahore, Pakistan, having moved there after her marriage.  She is originally from from the mid-sized industrial city of Faisalabad, Pakistan. She has one son and two daughters. Her son is a jeweler, and one daughter is married while the other daughter works as a helper at a nearby medical clinic. Naseem makes electric switches on order, a trade she learned from one of her cousins. She is requesting a loan so that she can manufacture electrical switches in larger quantities. Her fellow group members are: Fozia B., who runs an herbal pharmacy; Nabeela B., whose husband is a turner; Majeeda M., who buys and sells rice; and Arshad B., who operates a boutique.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan of $1,350.00.

loans.use: To increase manufacturing capacity of electrical switches.

loans.name: Hayrinisso

texts.ru:
Hayrinisso F. lives in the Khuroson region. She raises poultry. She has a small poultry farm in her backyard where she raises chickens, turkeys and ducks. When the little chicks are grown, she sells them on the market. She also sells eggs. Her business furnishes the local markets with fresh poultry and eggs. She has been in this business for the past 3 years. The business is profitable, but the income is insufficient to afford rebuilding the chicken house, which she needs to do in order to be able to work in better conditions and take better care of the poultry. Hayrinisso would like to borrow 3000 TJS for this purpose. She plans to repay the loan withing a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Файзуллаева Хайриниссо проживает в районе Хуросон. Занимается птицеводством Имеет небольшую ферму у себя во дворе, где разводит кур , индюков и уток. Подросших цыплят продает на базаре. Кроме того , что она обеспечивает рынок свежей птицей, она еще продает домашние яйца. Опыт в данной сфере около 3 лет. Этот бизнес дает ей неплохой доход, но его не хватает для того , чтобы перестроить курятник. Для того , чтобы улучшить условия работы , для ухода за птицей Хайриниссо хочет получить кредит в размере 3000 сомони . Погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase materials to rebuild the chicken house

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
I have a store that I have had for five years; I devote myself full-time to attend to my customers, who look for the quality of my products. I have four children who help me to go and buy the products to supply the store. My proposal is to increase my business and to be able to supply it. It is also my desire to purchase two display counters and fill them with products so that my store can have all that is necessary for everyday needs.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo una tienda, donde llevo 5 años de tenerla; me dedico a tiempo completo a poderla atender donde mis clientes buscan la calidad de mis productos. Tengo 4 hijos de los cuales me ayudan para poder ir a comprar el producto y poder surtirlo. Mi propósito es agrandar mi negocio y así poder surtirlo. Además mi deseo es poder comprar dos mostradores y llenarlo de productos, para que mi tienda pueda tener todo lo necesario para los consumos del día.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock the store

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chum C., 30, is a mother of two children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling groceries in front of her house. Normally, she makes $2 of profit per day. Her husband, Meas Keo, is a construction foreman. He works constructing houses in his town. This couple has two children. One of them is a student and another one is not yet school aged.

Mrs. Chum C. has applied for a loan from KIVA to expand her grocery inventory and the leftovers will be used to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to commute to work. The motor-taxi cost is very expensive as the inflation rate in Cambodia is very high and everything is extremely expansive, including gasoline. She and her husband believe that the new motor-bike will reduce their transportation costs and make their family more comfortable.

loans.use: Expand grocery inventory, and purchase a motor-bike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To get various goods to restock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Chhal

texts.en: Mrs. Chhal N. is the villager in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie Village in Kandal Province. She is a mat maker and farmer. Her husband, Mr. Srun Kong, is a blacksmith and he helps his wife in the rice field. On the plantation, Mrs. Chhal N. faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer to plow her rice field. Thus, Mrs. Chhal N. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and she would use part of the loan to buy rice seeds to cultivate. Mrs. Chhal N. is 44 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in school. Mrs. Chhal N. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow her rice field and rice seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Déborah

texts.fr: Née en 1976 à Agoè, Madame Déborah L. est veuve et a un enfant à charge. Elle est commerçante et vend  de l’huile rouge de palme,du sel,du mais et divers. Elle sollicite ce crédit dans le soucis de développer son commerce et de subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1976 in Agoè, Mrs. Déborah L. is a widow raising one child. She sells red palm oil, salt, maize, and various other items. She is requesting this loan with the intention of developing her business so she can support her little family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and re-sale of various foodstuffs, etc.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena is the mother of 3 children who lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She has a pottery business. She has been involved in this business for a long time. She is a hard worker and a talented woman. She makes clay bowls and her husband sells them in the bazzar. She got her first-cycle loan and furthered her business with more success. With the income from the first loan, she was able to open a retail shop for her husband.

Now she has requested her second-cycle loan to complete his stock and also further her own business so that she can find an opportunity to enlarge her husband's business and continue her business with more success.

Mena is happy. She would like to say that before she received her first-cycle loan, she was really very weak in her business. After that she was able to open a retail shop for her husband, so she would like to thank those that helped her already and those who will help her now in this process. And also she would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for making this process available to people like her.

loans.use: To complete her husband's stock

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: Mehman is 30 years old and lives in Baku City. Five years ago he started his food market business. He would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy more food items to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 28 años, ella y su pareja viven juntos y están todavía en preparativos para casarse, tienen dos hijos. Se comprometió muy jovencita, desde entonces, con su esposo se dedicaron de lleno a la agricultura, que se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos, se han organizados y delegado funciones cada uno. Trabajan en la chacra de lunes a miércoles, los días de feria ella baja a la ciudad llevando sus productos para venderlos en el mercado, luego el viernes y sábado trabaja en la chacra y termina el domingo, vendiendo su producción de papa en el mercado de la ciudad, mientras que su esposo se dedica íntegramente al cultivo y cuidado del campo. Para ellos la agricultura le es rentable ahora, porque ella misma comercializa sus productos, en años pasados vendía a los mayoristas y ganaban muy poco. Este es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y es muy responsable en sus pagos. Este dinero será invertido en la compra de 6 sacos de fertilizantes, ya que la tierra necesita de abono, sin ello no produce, nos dice sonriente.
texts.en:
Betty is 28 years old and lives with her fiancé, with whom she has two children. She was engaged at a very young age, and since then has worked with her fiancé in agriculture. This has become their sole source of income, and they each have a specific function. They both work in the field from Monday through Wednesday. On her day off, Betty goes down to the city to sell their products in the market. Fridays and Saturdays, she works in the field and finishes Sunday, selling her potatoes in the city market while her fiancé tends the land. Now, agriculture is profitable for them because Betty sells the produce herself; in past years they would sell to wholesalers and earn very little. This is her seventh loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very responsible with her payments. This money will be used for the purchase of six bags of fertilizer, without which, she says with a smile, the land doesn't work.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Carlos Demetrio

texts.es:
Carlos pertenece a Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro
Carlos tiene 24 años, vive en casa de sus padres, le han dado un cuarto para que viva con su esposa,  el estudio ingles y computación pero no termino por falta de dinero, el tiene un hijo de un año y dos meses  
Carlos ha trabajado desde los diez años en mil oficios ahora es chofer de una combi de la linia Real Expres él trabaja de  6de la mañana  hasta las 9 de la noche  todos los días
Carlos solicita un préstamo de 400 soles para comprar ropa de niño y venderla en el mercado de Villa el Salvador, uno de su  sueño es tener  un puesto de venta de ropa, Casarse y tener su casa propia
texts.en:
Carlos belongs to the Community Bank Mujeres del Futuro [Women of the Future]. Carlos is 24 years old and lives with his parents, who gave him a room to live in with his wife. He studied English and computing but did not finish due to a lack of money. He has a son who is a year and 2 months old. Carlos has worked since he was 10 years old in many different jobs. Now he is a van driver for the "Real Expres" line. He works from 6 in the morning until 9 at night every day. Carlos is requesting a loan of 400 soles to buy children's clothing. He will sell it in the Villa el Salvador market. One of his dreams is to have a clothing stand, to get married and have his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua A. is 24 years old. He is single and independent. Joshua lives alone in a rented apartment in Bawjiase community near Accra. Most of the inhabitants of Bawjiase are either in farming or buy and sell farm products. Very few people run different types of business. John is a trader and trades in pork. He buys the pigs from the northern part of the country, dresses them and supplies them to restaurant operators as meat for their meals.

Pork is enjoyed in many Ghanaian homes because the flavor is good and it is quite affordable. His business progress is slow because he has inadequate funds to buy the pigs from the farmers. With the loan, he wants to buy more pigs to serve his customers with good quality pork for their meals. He believes the loan will allow him to better meet the demands of his customers. He is a member of the community group called "Special Trust Group". In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to sell for meat

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Ерова Зебо проживает в городе Яван. Замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Домохозяйка , но занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит молодых бычков. Откормленных животных ее муж выводит на рынок , где продает по более выгодной цене. В данный момент планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zebo Y. lives in Yavan. She is married with six children. She is a homemaker and she raises bull calves. Her husband sells grown bull calves at a higher price at the market. Zebo is applying for a loan that would allow her to purchase more bull calves. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bull calves

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Ada F. tiene dos años y medio de haber uniciado a vender ropa nueva, ella vende su producto de manera ambulante, todos los dias sale bien temprano de su casa a vender su producto en diferentes oficinas ya sean publicas y privadas, en donde ella vende mucho su producto es en las tabacaleras ya que en danli hay bastantes fabricas de puros o habanos, ella es madre soltera y tiene un hijo y esto la ha obligado a buscar como conseguir dinero para poder alimentar a su hijo, lo mas importante es que ella ha sabido ganarse a sus clientes, ella aspira que su negocio sea mucho mas grande.
ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y poder salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Ada F. has been in business for two and half years. She sells new clothes door to door. She sets out early every day to sell her products in government and company offices. She sells a lot in cigar factories, of which there are many in Danli.

Because she is a single mother with one son, she has had to work to maintain him. She is proud of the clientele she has built up, and hopes to make her business much bigger.

She needs the loan to buy more merchandise so as to enable her and her son to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shirts, T-shirts, sandals, trousers, shoes, underwear, socks.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo D. is engaged in rice farming. He owns a small parcel of land that he uses to support the needs of his family. He is 42 years old and has three children. Danilo has been into farming since he was just a small kid. His parents are farmers and everything he knows about growing crops came from them. Danilo's life is on the farm and he wanted to support his children.

Danilo is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, and herbicides for his farm. The loan will help enrich the soil and result in good harvests. They need the loan to sustain their business.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own businesses. They give their clients credit, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer cuenta con 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo, hace muy poco se mudaron a su propia casa. En los años de su infancia se dedicaba a las labores agrícolas con sus padres, pero ahora que formó su propia familia tiene nuevas visiones de vida, por ello que hace dos años puso una bodega en su casa, con el apoyo y motivación de su esposa. Y cuando tiene que ir de compras a la ciudad para surtir su bodega, van en compañía de su esposa, porque ella es muy buena buscando y negociando los mejores precios. Wilmer está muy contento por la prosperidad de su bodega, sus planes son de ir incrementando su negocio, para que sea más rentable, e ir comprando los utensilios y artefactos que hacen falta en su casa. Wilmer es un cliente muy dinámico y activo en cada una de las actividades que realiza su banco comunal, además es muy puntual en sus pagos. Este es el 9no crédito que viene trabajando con MFP. Y el dinero que solicita es para incrementar la mercadería de su bodega, así podrá captar mayor cantidad de clientela.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 24 years old. He lives with his partner and mother of his son. Not long ago they moved to their own home. In his childhood years he did agricultural work with his parents, but now that he has formed his own family he has new life visions. It is for this reason that two years ago he put a grocery store in his home, with the support and motivation of his wife. And when he has to go shopping in the city to supply his grocery store, he goes with his wife, because she is very good at searching for and negotiating the best prices. Wilmer is very happy with the prosperity of his grocery store. His plans are to increase his business, so that it is more profitable, and to purchase the utensils and appliances that are needed in his house. Wilmer is a very dynamic and active client in each of the activities conducted by his communal bank, and is also very punctual with his payments. This is his 9th loan working with MFP. And the money that he is requesting is to increase the merchandise of his grocery store, so that he can attract more clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his merchandise

loans.name: Nebasfeh

texts.en:
G. is a father of one child and makes a living by building beds and raising chickens. He lives in Bamenda, the same town that GHAPE is located in, and runs his business there. With this loan, G. plans to purchase wood or "plank", varnish, animal feed and two chickens.

This is G.'s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. He has been doing well with his bed-making business, he says, because he uses good materials and has friends.

Having faced challenges with this business, being sick and even being poor, G. continues to keep his business afloat. He says, with the loan profits he will look to provide for his family and their needs, as well as take care of his house. G. takes out GHAPE loans because he knows by taking out a loan that he will have to work hard and he likes the encouragement.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy wood, varnish, chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye S. vit à kolda où il est né. Il tient un atelier de menuiserie métallique avec l'aide trois (apprentis). Il est établit dans le quartier Doumassou et fabrique pricipalement des portes et des fenetres en fer, des grilles et d'autres objets en fer.Ses activités marchent et il parvient à faire face aux besoins sociaux de sa famille. Il voudrait cependant agrandir son atelier et ainsi utiliser plus de main-d'oeuvre.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye S. lives in Kolda, where he was born. He runs a metal welding workshop with help from three apprentices. He's located in the Doumassou neighborhood and mainly makes iron doors and windows, grilles, and other iron objects. His business is doing well, and he manages to support his family. Nevertheless, he would like to expand his workshop to be able to increase his workforce.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his metal welding workshop

loans.name: Afi Delphine

texts.fr: Cette femme vit avec son mari et ses 2 enfants dans le quartier de kégué qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de  poissons frais et d’huile. Une bonne partie de sa clientèle sont propriétaire de restaurant, ils achètent chez elle les poissons  pour leur activité de restauration. Le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet de satisfaire ses clients, elle demande alors à WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 paniers de poissons et 8 bidons d’huile.
texts.en:
This lady lives with her husband and their two children in the Kégué district, which is an outlying neighborhood of the town of Lomé. She sells fresh fish and oil to earn a living. A good number of her customers are owners of restaurants. They buy fish from her for their restaurants.

Her present stock does not allow her to satisfy her clientele's needs, so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 30 baskets of fish and 8 jerry cans of oil.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish and oil for re-sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 36-year-old woman. She is divorced and a mother with three children. All her children are in school. She lives with the children at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She works very hard to support her children's basic needs. She is a food vendor who sells rice and stew in the community where she lives. She started her operation about seven years ago to take care of her entire family. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business.

She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and bags of rice to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support and provide for her family and finance her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: J. Zuhro is 50 years old and is working to support her single son who is the drive for her to live. She is operating her own clothing sales business, which she has owned for more than three years. The savings she earns from her business goes to improve their health and living conditions. Zuhro is requesting this 3,000 Somoni loan to purchase more merchandise to restock and increase her inventory. Her business is growing and she has shown that she can increase sales with a larger supply of product. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Auxiliadora de 47 años de edad, soltera, con dos hijos de 8 y 18 años que estudian, reside en el barrio Concepción de Maria en la capital de Managua, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace ocho años logro poner el cual inicio con ayuda de su exmarido.  Con este crédito es su octavo ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por los beneficios ya que a través de los prestamos ha logrado poder seguir con su pulpería ya que le ha tocado seguir adelante con la venta ya que su esposo se fue de la casa, lo que mas desea es poder ayudar a sus hijos que estudien. Con este crédito comprara mercadería variada como: granos básicos, carnes, productos lácteos. Ya que son los alimentos diarios de los Nicaragüenses.es la variedad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora is 47 years old. She is single and has two children, who are 8 and 18 years old. Both children attend school. She resides in the town of Concepcion de Maria, in the capital of Managua. Her business is a convenience store which she started eight years ago with her ex-husband’s help.
